  • Internet Key Exchange (IKE) is used to negotiate tunnel parameters.

Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP) and Layer 2 Forwarding (L2F) protocols do not offer any encryption. PPTP, L2F, and L2TP are in the order of evolution for these protocols. It is only once we get to L2TP that encryption is added through the use of IPSec. PPTP and L2F do not offer any encryption options.

questions.question: Sam is setting up a Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) for a critical file server. He has four drives that are each 100GB in size. He must support 250GB of user data and remain fault-tolerant. What RAID level should he select?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 5

When using RAID-5, your usable storage is only reduced by one drive's worth of storage. RAID-5 also provides fault-tolerance.

If four drives at 100GB each are used, you get the following results for each RAID level:

  • RAID-0 – 400GB of usable space with no fault-tolerance. Data is striped across all of the drives. There is 250GB of space as needed for the question, but there is no fault-tolerance.
  • RAID-1 – 200GB of usable space with fault-tolerance. Because of the mirroring you lose 1/2 of the available space.
  • RAID-10 – 200GB of usable space with fault-tolerance. This is mirroring and striping combined. Due to the mirroring, there is not enough space.
  • RAID-5 – 300GB of usable space with fault-tolerance. With the interleaved parity, there is a loss of space equivalent to one drive. So now there is enough space for the question's needs and there is fault-tolerance with the parity.
  • RAID-6 – 200GB of usable space with fault-tolerance. There is double parity to be able to tolerate double drive loss. With the double parity, there is too much drive space lost to meet the needs of the question.

questions.question: Which of the following is a wireless communication technology that utilizes light to transmit and receive data?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: LiFi

LiFi is a wireless communication technology that utilizes light (in the visible, infrared, or ultraviolet spectrums) to transmit and receive data. While LiFi transmissions cannot penetrate walls like WiFi (which utilizes radio frequency) can, because the light spectrum is significantly larger than the radio frequency spectrum, faster data rates are supported. LiFi, or Li-Fi, is a term coined by Professor Harold Haas from the University of Edinburgh.

Zigbee and Bluetooth are both wireless communication protocols that utilize radio frequencies in the 2.4GHz range. Fibre Channel over Ethernet (FCoE) is an encapsulation of the Fibre Channel protocol adapted to operate over an Ethernet network.

questions.question: When determining if users should be granted read access, which principle is MOST LIKELY to be used?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Need to know principle

The Need-To-Know (NTK) principle is used to determine if a user’s access to certain information is necessary to perform their job role sufficiently. If a user does not need read access to data to carry out their job role, they should not be granted access. The need-to-know principle differs from least privilege because the need-to-know principle is only concerned with read access.

If a user has an NTK then the question is what level of permission do they need. Do they need read, write, full control, or another level? The best idea is to give them as little permission as possible, just enough to do their job. This is called the principle of least privilege.

Split knowledge is a tool to control very sensitive data or systems. The information is literally split among two or more people. It is necessary for all of them to be there to be able to complete the job, whatever it is. For example, if there is a Hardware Security Module (HSM) that contains all of the keys that are used to encrypt the corporation's data, it would be a good idea to split the password/key into many pieces and give each piece to a different person. In order for the password/key to be entered to access the keys in the HSM, all of the people who have a piece of the password/key in their possession must be present to get access to the keys in the HSM.

Kerchoff’s principle is one of the six that Augusta Kerchoff wrote about in the late 1800s. The principle that the industry is still struggling with is that the secrecy of the algorithm is not what should be used to protect our data, rather the secrecy of the key is what must be maintained. The algorithm should actually be published and analyzed by many people to ensure that the math of the algorithm is as strong as possible.

questions.question: When an object is referred to as "hot" in the realm of business continuity and disaster recovery, the term usually indicates what?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: It's a high-demand item that is required for full functionality
Its reference is subject to environmental concerns, specifically temperature

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: It's currently online and running

A hot site provides the most rapid recovery capability because it is complemented by the full resources required for instant function and connectivity of IT systems. If a system is referred to as "hot," it usually indicates that the system is either already running or can be brought online in a short amount of time.

Hot does not refer to the hardware temperature, although that should be monitored by the network operations center. It is not the temperature of the data center either, although that does need to be regulated. There are hot data centers, but the question eliminates this by bringing disaster recovery into the question. High-demand items could be referred to as "hot," which should be taken into consideration when planning for disasters.

questions.question: Acme Inc. allows data owners on their systems to grant access and manage permissions without involving the IT department. What type of access control model does Acme Inc. MOST LIKELY use?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Discretionary access control

A system that employs Discretionary Access Controls (DACs) allows the owner to control and define access to that object. All objects have owners and access control is based on the discretion or decision of the owner.

Mandatory Access Control (MAC) uses a classification of the data, the clearance of the user, and then the policy to make determinations about what access to grant to which people and to what data. Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) works based on the roles that a user is assigned. The user's role is essentially their job and the role they are assigned is granted the permissions that are allowed. Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) grants access based on a variety of different attributes such as time of day, firewall status, antivirus status, patch level, etc.

questions.question: Of the following, which is the most common and well-known ticket system that uses a key distribution center, an authentication server, tickets, and ticket-granting tickets?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Kerberos

Kerberos offers a Single-Sign-On (SSO) solution for users and provides protection for credentials. The current version, Kerberos 5, relies on symmetric-key cryptography using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES). Kerberos provides confidentiality and integrity for authentication using end-to-end security and uses a system of keys and tickets to grant access to resources.

Kerberos is an SSO technology, but due to the details of the question, Kerberos is the better, more specific answer. New Technology Local Area Network (LAN) Manager (NTLM)) is an SSO technology as well. Again, the details of the question point to Kerberos. NTLM does not have a Key Distribution Center (KDC), tickets, or ticket-granting tickets. Those terms are specific to Kerberos. Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is an SSO technology, but it uses tokens rather than tickets. Functionally they are similar, but the term ticket belongs to Kerberos and tokens to SAML (and other technologies).

questions.question: FM-200 is BEST defined as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Gas

FM-200 is a gas that extinguishes fires, making it a safe suppression system for electronics. FM-200 is a colorless suppression agent that is electrically non-conductive and safe for humans. It extinguishes fire through heat absorption. It can be used to replace Halon in fire suppression systems.

FM-200 is not a liquid, therefore it is not heavy water. It is not a foam either.

questions.question: An organization wants to find the most appropriate solution to back up its data in preparation for the possible event of a major natural disaster. What would be the BEST solution to securely back up data off-site and protect against a natural disaster?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: Provide the backup data to a trusted third party in another state
Provide the backup data to a trusted third party in another country
Provide the backup data to a trusted third party across town
There is no viable solution and this is an accepted risk for all organizations

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Provide the backup data to a trusted third party in another state

By providing backup data to a trusted third party in another state, an organization can ensure the data is secure and untouched by their local natural disaster. A fire in California won't impact New York, so the backup data can be transferred to a hot site or rebuilt data center as needed.

Providing the backup data to an entity across town would still risk the consequences of a natural disaster. Providing the data to a party in another country would be possible, but this risks potentially violating agreements between the organization and customers. Data in another country may require additional regulatory precautions and increase risk if data governance practices are not followed carefully. While natural disasters are a risk for any organization, many businesses take precautions instead of simply accepting the risk as a whole because it is something that can reasonably be worked around.

questions.question: What type of protocol is Frame Relay?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Wide Area Network (WAN)

Frame relay is a Wide Area Network (WAN) technology that is used between WAN providers and customers for networks that are spread over a large geographical area. Frame Relay was replaced mostly by Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) which was then mostly replaced by Multi-Protocol Label Switching (MPLS).

WAN technology connects devices across the planet. LANs connect devices within a building. PANs connect users to their very local technology (mobile phones, headsets, wearable technology, etc.) MANs connect technology across a city.

Ethernet is a shared media Local Area Network (LAN) technology. Token ring employs a token-passing mechanism to control which systems can transmit over the network medium. Token ring is a LAN technology. Fiber Distributed Data Interface (FDDI) is a high-speed token-passing technology that employs two rings with traffic flowing in opposite directions and is designed for the Metropolitan Area Network (MAN). Bluetooth, IEEE 802.15, is an example of a Personal Area Network (PAN) technology.

questions.question: Which of the following is MOST LIKELY to be used in conjunction with a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)

A Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) can use a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) when a client queries for a Certificate Authority (CA). PKI and LDAP can be used to support Single Sign-On (SSO) systems.

Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) is a tunneling protocol. Tunneling allows an unsupported protocol to be transported across another network such as the Internet. GRE is commonly used between two routers. File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is used to transfer files in cleartext. Security can be added to it by using File Transfer Protocol Secure (FTPS) which adds Transport Layer Security (TLS). Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is a Single Sign-On (SSO) system that is commonly used today to allow people to access Software as a Service (SaaS) applications in the cloud.

questions.question: Garrett is a system administrator for a hospital. He discovers someone has plugged a small, handheld-sized device into an Ethernet port in the visitor lobby and hidden it behind an artificial plant. After investigating traffic logs, he concludes the device was used to open a reverse Secure Shell (SSH) tunnel and allowed the attacker remote access to the hospital network. Of the following, what control would MOST LIKELY have prevented this attack from being successful?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 802.1x

802.1x is an Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) standard that requires a device to be authenticated and authorized before network access is granted. 802.1x is frequently used with wireless networks but can also be used for wired networks. 802.1x has three roles: Supplicant, Authenticator, and Authentication server. The supplicant is the device attempting to authenticate. The authenticator is either the switch or wireless access point the supplicant is connected to. The authentication server is the server that informs the authenticator if the supplicant should or should not be authorized.

Cameras in the lobby and external Secure Shell (SSH) monitoring are detective controls and would not have prevented the attack. Transport Layer Security (TLS) only encrypts sessions, it does not do any identification authentication activities.

questions.question: What is the default subnet mask for the 172.16.1.1/16 network?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 255.255.0.0

Class B networks have a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) equivalent of /16 and a default subnet mask of 255.255.0.0.

255.255.255.0 is incorrect because it has a CIDR equivalent of /24. 255.0.0.0 is incorrect because it has a CIDR equivalent of /8. 255.255.255.255 is a host address subnet with a CIDR equivalent of /32.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST thorough and secure method of permanently removing data from a hard drive with a spinning platter?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Degaussing and shredding

Degaussing uses a powerful magnet to destroy the magnetic fields on a drive and making it unusable and unrecoverable. Shredding also makes the media and data unreadable and unrecoverable, although data could be recovered from fragments, so degaussing should be done first.

Deletion is one of the weakest ways to sanitize data, since it only breaks the link to the data, leaving the data easily recoverable.

Formatting may overwrite data, but it is not as effective as degaussing.

Encryption and disposal runs the risk of the encryption key and disposed of drive being found or the encryption being broken at a later date due to technologies such as quantum computing.

questions.question: A corporation has been faced with an incident that they failed to detect for about two years, yet they have been able to reconstruct the actions the threat actor took through this incident. What was a critical element of the corporation's Information Security Management System (ISMS) that enabled the reconstruction?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Log retention

If the logs are not retained for a long enough period of time, the corporation will not be able to reconstruct the events of the incident. Detecting the incident immediately is the goal, but if that does not occur and it takes two years as it says in the question, the log retention rules become critical.

Log storage could refer to time or location. If it is the time that is the concern, that is more specifically referred to as log retention. The location where the logs are stored is another critical aspect. If the threat actor can get into the storage location, they can alter or delete the logs. That is not what the question is pointing to though.

A log policy is critical as it includes details about how long to store the logs, where to store them, and so on. The question is more specific than this though because it mentions the two-year timeframe. It is possible to say that the logging policy contains the logging rules.

questions.question: Which of the following types of security controls is designed to address an incident but doesn't restore normal operations?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Corrective

The six main types of security controls include the following:

  • Corrective: Corrective controls fix issues after a security incident but may not fully restore normal operations. Antimalware that removes an infection or an auto-close arm on a door are examples of corrective controls.
  • Recovery: Recovery controls restore normal operations after an incident to a greater extent than corrective ones. Backups and server clusters are examples of recovery controls.
  • Preventive: Preventive controls are designed to stop an incident from happening. Fences, locks, and access controls are examples of preventive controls.
  • Detective: Detective controls help to identify that an incident is occurring. CCTV, audit trails, and honeypots are examples of detective controls.
  • Deterrent: Deterrent controls attempt to discourage an incident from occurring. Corporate policies and security cameras are examples of deterrent controls.
  • Compensating: Compensating controls are used as a replacement when the preferred control is unusable. For example, a company renting an office in a building may put locks on the doors when it can't build a fence.

questions.question: The act of searching for correlations of data in a data warehouse is BEST known as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data mining

Data mining is searching through data warehouses and correlating data. Analysts use data mining to find potential revenue. For instance, an analyst could data mine a product's sales patterns and identify that October is the best sales month. Marketing and sales could then increase during those months to increase revenue for the company.

Data sleuthing involves investigative techniques to uncover hidden or valuable insights within datasets. It includes data analysis, pattern recognition, and exploratory methods to extract meaningful information for decision-making or research. Data surveying is the systematic collection, examination, and analysis of data to gain insights and understanding. It involves methods like surveys, questionnaires, or observations to gather and interpret information effectively. Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to machines or computer systems designed to perform tasks that typically require human intelligence. It encompasses areas like machine learning, natural language processing, and problem-solving, aiming to mimic cognitive functions such as learning, reasoning, and problem-solving.

questions.question: Which of the following asset classes includes copyrights, trademarks, patents, and similar intellectual property?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Intangible

Intangible assets describe asset types that do not possess a physical substance. Copyrights, trademarks, patents, and similar intellectual property are all classified as (and are examples of) intangible assets. While such assets are without physical substance, they are not without value, making it essential to consider them in risk management planning.

Tangible assets describe assets with physical substance. Examples of tangible assets include computing devices, buildings, furniture, automobiles, and machinery. Waterfall and Agile are not asset classes but refer to software development methodologies. Waterfall follows a structured, linear approach while Agile utilizes an iterative approach that supports greater flexibility.

questions.question: Acting in a way that a reasonable and competent person would act is BEST described as what?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Due care

Due care is defined in Black's Law Dictionary as "just, proper, and sufficient care, so far as the circumstances demand it; the absence of negligence." This means that due care involves taking reasonable steps to prevent harm or mitigate risks in a way that a prudent person would under similar conditions. It reflects an obligation to act responsibly and avoid negligent behavior.

Due diligence, on the other hand, is defined as "such a measure of prudence, activity, or assiduity, as is properly to be expected from, and ordinarily exercised by, a reasonable and prudent man under the particular circumstances." Due diligence refers to the investigative efforts taken before making decisions, ensuring risks and obligations are well understood.

Ethics standards are personal or corporate guidelines defining what is right or wrong but do not specifically relate to legal obligations like due care or due diligence.

"Human reasonability" is not a recognized legal or cybersecurity term.

questions.question: A data breach at which data classification level in a nongovernmental organization would likely cause the MOST irreversible damage?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Confidential

Confidential is the highest level of data classification for a nongovernmental organization and could cause the most irreversible damage if breached. Confidential information includes trade secrets, source code, and information that keeps the organization competitive.

A data breach of private data could cause serious damage. A data breach of sensitive data would cause limited damage. A data breach of public data would cause no damage.

A corporation could decide that they use a ‘private’ or ‘sensitive’ classification for their most sensitive data. However, more commonly, ‘confidential’ is accepted as the classification for more sensitive information. Public information is commonly accepted as information that it would be acceptable to disclose to the general public, therefore it is not sensitive in any way.

questions.question: An organization has been using state-of-the-art software for automation in its warehouses. Designed in 1992 by Maple Leaf Industries, this state-of-the-art software has guided the organization through a major portion of its history. In fact, this software is the backbone of their infrastructure and would seriously damage the organization if it were no longer available or able to be processed and reformed for updates. Maple Leaf Industries has recently experienced serious financial issues and has decided to make its proprietary software available to customers if it financially collapses and can no longer operate. What can Maple Leaf Industries put in place to protect the source code until these requirements and conditions are met?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Software escrow

A software (or code) escrow process is when a third party maintains the source code in the event that a customer needs it when a vendor or company that initially developed the code no longer exists. This ensures the security of the source code from being released to the public while allowing a way for software to be relied upon or passed on to someone else when the creator is no longer available.

Code repositories are similar, but are more concerned with holding code in an air-gapped network for the purposes of protection. Code repositories aren't directly concerned with passing on code or providing it in escrow in the event the creator goes out of business. Static Application Security Testing (SAST) and Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) involve analyzing code in real-time or statically. For example, you can manually inspect code through SAST or use DAST to test code as it runs in real-time. Fagan inspections and malware analysis are prime examples of both processes being used. A company will is a fabricated term.

questions.question: Of the following, which BEST describes an asynchronous token device?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

choices.text: A device that generates a one-time password using a challenge/response mechanism
A device that generates a one-time password at regular intervals

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A device that generates a one-time password using a challenge/response mechanism

An asynchronous token device generates a one-time password using a challenge/response mechanism. An example of this could be if a workstation displayed a numerical challenge value. The user will then enter the value into the token. The token uses this value to generate a new response value that the user enters into the workstation.

A device that generates a one-time password at regular intervals is a synchronous token device. Tokens are a type-2 authentication factor. A type-1 authentication is something you know such as a password or pin. A type-3 authentication factor is something you are or biometrics. Tokens are considered a type-2 authentication factor.

questions.question: Odelia works for a large manufacturing firm that sells some products directly to customers and the rest wholesale to distributors. When processing credit cards she ensures that she is compliant with her contract with the credit card companies. How many requirements does the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS) have?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 12

The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS) has 12 main requirements. Each requirement has additional sub-controls. The 12 requirements are as below:

  1. Install and maintain a firewall configuration to protect cardholder data
  2. Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for system passwords and other security parameters
  3. Protect stored cardholder data
  4. Encrypt transmission of cardholder data across open, public networks
  5. Use and regularly update anti-virus software or programs
  6. Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
  7. Restrict access to cardholder data by business need-to-know
  8. Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
  9. Restrict physical access to cardholder data
  10. Track and monitor all access to network resources and cardholder data
  11. Regularly test security systems and processes
  12. Maintain a policy that addresses information security for employees and contractors

questions.question: Of the following, what is the BEST benefit of having a passphrase over a password?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: They are longer

A combination of length and complexity makes passwords secure. When possible, use passphrases instead of individual words. Passphrases are more secure because of increased length and randomness, and are easier to remember than shorter but more random passwords. When passphrases are random and long enough, they are very unlikely to exist in a rainbow table.

Including spaces is incorrect because a space is just one additional ASCII character. Passphrases should be easier to remember. Passphrases don't require more complexity.

questions.question: Hafiz is working in the data center of a large corporation. He has been troubleshooting the media access control address conflict that a system is reporting. In what layer of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model would you find that address?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data Link

The Media Access Control (MAC) address can be found in the Data Link layer. It is the second layer and is represented in the descending sequence as the second-lowest layer. Data is passed from the highest layer (application; layer 7) downward through each layer to the lowest layer. The seven layers include the following:

  • Application (Layer 7)
  • Presentation (Layer 6)
  • Session (Layer 5)
  • Transport (Layer 4)
  • Network (Layer 3)
  • Data Link (Layer 2)
  • Physical (Layer 1)

questions.question: What BEST describes an attack that targets the senior management of an organization?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Whaling

Whaling is a type of phishing that focuses on the senior management of an organization.

Vishing is incorrect because it is a type of phishing that occurs over the phone. Phishing is incorrect because it targets anyone, not specifically senior management. Spear phishing is incorrect because, even though it targets a group of people, it does not target only senior management.

questions.question: The "KISS" principle is focused on simplifying the integration and delivery of code, for example. Which of the following is NOT an element of the "KISS" principle and may hinder the full utility of software upon release?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security

choices.text: Many configurations and options are initially available if they are needed later
Adding options and features as they are needed

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Many configurations and options are initially available if they are needed later

While this may seem like an element of the Keep it Simple Silly (KISS) principle, having many options available to users that may not be in demand at the time could become problematic with troubleshooting, computational overhead, or even overwhelming users.

For these reasons, keeping things simple means eliminating redundancy. Maintaining simple configurations and adding features only as needed will lead to less extra work for developers and allow user input to determine how a product develops over time.

questions.question: Alex is troubleshooting packet loss and high latency for a 1Gb/s device connected to the network with a 500-meter-long Ethernet cable. He discovers the device has many unnecessary programs installed and not enough Random Access Memory (RAM). He also finds that the hard drive is only 5400-RPM.  Of the following, which MOST LIKELY explains the problem with the device?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: The device should be configured for 10 Gigabits per second

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: An attenuation problem due to length

Attenuation is the loss of signal as it travels through a medium. In this scenario, the device is connected to a 500-meter-long Ethernet cable. Ethernet connections should not exceed the recommended length of 100 meters. Excessive length can cause the signal to degrade as it travels through the cable. This can lead to packet loss or excessive latency.

Packet loss can only occur on a network connection (wire/wireless/fiber) or within a network device such as routers and switches. RAM in the end system and unnecessary programs would, therefore, not cause those problems. Configuring the device for 10 Gigabits per second (Gbps) would not work as the speed must be the same at both ends of the wire.

questions.question: Sean is the new IT manager and has been asked to begin developing a crisis communication plan. Of the following, which is the MOST important step in creating this type of plan?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Collecting employee contact information

An organization's employee contact information should be contained in the disaster recovery plan or crisis communication plan for potential emergencies. The plan may also provide a priority list to establish a chain of command. Employee contact information is used to ensure their safety and it is essential to collect contact information when building a communication plan.

Performing risk assessments is critical in information security, as it is necessary to understand what can happen to plan appropriately. Some of the controls that are added as a result of the risk assessments are Business Continuity Plans (BCP) and Disaster Recovery Plans (DRP). However, the communication plan is about being in contact, so the employee's contact information is more important here.

A cold site is generally low on the list of things to do when building a DRP. Performing the risk assessment and planning for more immediate recovery methods is more important for most businesses.

Conducting penetration tests is a different topic. A penetration test emulates an attack from a bad actor and allows a corporation to view its defenses when attacked by a particular type of attack.

questions.question: There are many different types of fires an organization can be faced with. If a fire is ignited by shorted electrical wires in a dropped ceiling, it would be classified as what class of fire?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Class C fire

Fires are classified according to what material is burning. Class C fires are electrical fires. Class C fires require carbon dioxide or dry powder to extinguish them. Using water on a Class C fire can cause electrocution.

  • Class A: Common combustibles, such as wood or paper
  • Class B: Liquids, such as fuels or oils
  • Class C: Electrical, such as wiring or equipment
  • Class D: Combustible metals, such as magnesium or sodium
  • Class K: Combustible cooking media, such as grease

questions.question: Which of these protocols operates within the transport layer of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: User Datagram Protocol (UDP)

User Datagram Protocol (UDP) is correct as it is a connectionless protocol that provides fast delivery of datagrams across a network at the transport layer.

Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) is a data link layer protocol. Its job is to translate the Internet Protocol (IP) address to a Media Access Control (MAC) address. File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is an application layer protocol. It is used to put or get files onto a server. Secure Shell (SSH) is a session layer protocol that is used to encrypt sessions. Commonly used for administrative sessions to configure devices such as routers and switches.

questions.question: Rebecca is activating a hot site to simulate a disaster recovery event. Of the following, what is generally considered the timeframe it should take to activate the site?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Minutes to hours

Hot sites already have all the required equipment, including servers, communication links, and probably some data. If configured correctly, they should go live within minutes to hours. The most recent data and people are missing from the site.

Warm sites don’t have live data and may take days or weeks to become live. They are going to have some equipment there. There is no single standard that everyone agrees to about what is at this site; it could be expensive equipment or it could be cheap equipment. If following a standard or a law, there should be a clearly defined level of equipment that must be present to be able to call the site a warm site. Consistently, what works for ISC2 tests is that a warm site is missing something; it has something there or it is partially equipped.

Cold sites are empty, with no server or communication equipment. Cold sites may take a few weeks to a few months to become live since the equipment must be purchased and installed. Cold sites are usually best suited as a backup to the backup site.

Mirror sites have everything needed at both locations for critical business processes. If one site goes offline, the other is already there and working. Service may be disrupted for anyone connected to the site that failed. It could take seconds to minutes to reestablish a connection with the other site.

questions.question: Which of the following is the slowest recovery method after a disaster?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Cold site

A cold site is an empty computer room with environmental facilities such as heating, ventilation, and air conditioning, but no computing equipment. It is the slowest form of recovery; however, it is also the cheapest.

Hot site is incorrect because it provides rapid recovery capability since it has all the resources required for instant function and connectivity of Information Technology (IT) systems. A warm site is incorrect because it has computers and communication links already in place, ready to be loaded with data. Cloud site is incorrect because you don’t have to procure physical servers to use cloud services.

questions.question: When discussing the Central Processing Unit (CPU) architecture, what BEST describes the role of a register?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering

choices.text: A temporary storage location for instruction sets
A hierarchical database that stores low-level settings for the operating system
A list of addressable Random Access Memory (RAM)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A temporary storage location for instruction sets

A register is a temporary storage location located on the Central Processing Unit (CPU). It is used to store instruction sets. When a CPU executes an instruction set, it loads it from the register.

A hierarchical database that stores low-level settings for the operating system is known as the Windows Registry in Microsoft Windows operating systems. The Windows Registry is a centralized database that stores configuration settings and options for the operating system, hardware devices, software applications, and user preferences. It is organized in a hierarchical structure with keys and values, allowing the system and applications to retrieve and store configuration data efficiently.

A list of addressable Random Access Memory (RAM) locations can be referred to as a memory map. A memory map is a structure or diagram that details the specifics of how memory is organized and utilized within a computing environment. It shows the distribution and allocation of memory addresses to different types of data and hardware registers, facilitating efficient memory management.

The Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) is the component of a computer processor that performs arithmetic and bitwise operations on the data it processes. Arithmetic operations include basic calculations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, while bitwise operations involve manipulating individual bits within data words, including operations like AND, OR, XOR, NOT, shifts, and rotations. The ALU is a fundamental part of the CPU, enabling it to carry out the mathematical and logical operations that underpin virtually all computer processing tasks.

questions.question: Which of the following, if performed before initiating a vulnerability scan, will reduce false negative results?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Update the vulnerability database

Vulnerability scanners rely on a database of known vulnerabilities for detection. If this database is outdated, vulnerabilities that are present may go undetected (which is referred to as false negative results). Therefore, the database should be updated before each scan.

Authenticated scanning utilizes credentials for a more complete (and accurate) scan of the device. This may reduce false positive results (where a vulnerability that isn't present is reported as being present); however, it will not reduce false negative results. The order in which hosts are scanned is unlikely to have any impact on false negative results.

questions.question: Which form of management would BEST ensure secure baselines are maintained and deviations are authorized?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Configuration management

Configuration Management is used to ensure secure baselines on systems are adequately maintained, and any deviations are authorized and documented. Configuration management seeks to establish safe, reliable configurations for systems.

Change management is a process to document and control changes within an Information Technology (IT) department, and it manages Configuration Items (CI).

Vulnerability management identifies vulnerabilities, flaws, or weaknesses within systems. The process of vulnerability management extends to the steps followed to mitigate the risks associated with them.

Patch Management ensures that systems are current on patches and up to date. Patches are the software fixes applied to systems when a vulnerability has been identified and corrected by the manufacturer.

questions.question: Nora is a penetration tester who has been hired to assess an organization’s campus. She finds Computer Aided Design (CAD) drawings classified as sensitive. She discovers that two of the drawings are for the same part and, when combined, should be classified as confidential. This process is MOST LIKELY known as what?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Aggregation

When discussing classification labels, data aggregation means that data classified at a higher level can be inferred by combining data at a lower classification level.

Collection of data means to just gather data. It does not imply that the data collected will cause a need to reclassify. It is not the use of aggregation and collection in English, it is the accepted use of the words in information security that is critical here.

Data mining is the process of analyzing large datasets to uncover patterns, relationships, and insights that are not immediately apparent. It involves various techniques from statistics, machine learning, and database systems to extract useful information from raw data, helping businesses make informed decisions, predict future trends, and gain competitive advantages.

Deducing data is not a term used in data science today.

questions.question: Which of the following is LEAST LIKELY to be a benefit of virtualizing backup data?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Security

While taking advantage of trending technology may seem like a good idea, spreading data to a virtualized environment, on- or off-site, can actually increase a potential attack surface. This includes options like OneDrive, Dropbox, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Azure, Google Cloud Provider (GCP), and so on. Moving data from one drive or environment to another provides more opportunity for it to be stolen. Before moving data, ensure it is encrypted at rest, transit, and use. Also, keep data remanence in mind when moving the data.

Having data available anywhere via the cloud can certainly be convenient, especially when backing up or migrating data for personal or professional use. If properly handled, it can also alleviate some of the security burdens an enterprise would have to deal with. In some instances, it may be faster to obtain the data via the cloud instead of a physical site. One of the greatest benefits of virtualizing data seen today is reducing overall storage space. That said, despite the appeal of virtualizing our data for many reasons, sometimes simpler is in fact safer.

questions.question:
Wendy deleted all the old customer files from her drive since she no longer needed the data. To her surprise, the following year, the data showed up on a report generated by special drive scanning software.

This is MOST likely due to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data remanence

Data remanence refers to the residual data that can be recovered and reassembled when media is not appropriately sanitized. This means a higher level of data destruction should be used for sensitive data. Some organizations destroy storage media to ensure that it does not actually delete the data from the user interface. It usually only deletes the pointers to the data location, it does not actually remove the data from the drive.

Snapshots have been used to back up desktop machines for a very long time. They are also used to make backup copies of virtual machines. Volume snapshots are a backup technology from Microsoft. Both versions of snapshots intentionally store the data. The user in this question is trying to delete the data. A file system stream is a sequence of bytes that contain the contents of a file. This is the data the user has tried to delete. Shadow copies are point-in-time backup copies of files and folders.

questions.question: Maple Leaf Industries wants to implement an approach to their software development practices in which employees from security and development join together to create software-defined security. Which term BEST describes this approach?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: DevSecOps

In DevSecOps, the security team is integrated into the development of software very early. Typically, the security team will follow the software creation progress and work with the developers during every step of the development phase. This helps to ensure secure practices occur at every stage of the software development life cycle, instead of potentially allowing things to be missed during the development. Additionally, this can make the development of software more efficient. In DevSecOps, the work will be checked for security flaws while it is being created, not after.

SecOps, short for Security Operations, refers to the practice of integrating security measures into an organization's overall operations. It involves the collaboration between security teams and operations teams to ensure the continuous protection of an organization's systems, data, and assets. The primary objective of SecOps is to detect, prevent, respond to, and recover from security incidents and breaches effectively.

DevOps, short for Development and Operations, is a set of practices and cultural philosophies that promote collaboration and integration between software development teams and IT operations teams within an organization. The primary goal of DevOps is to facilitate the rapid and reliable delivery of software products and services, ensuring high-quality, efficient, and scalable solutions.

The Agile methodology is a method of the software development lifecycle, which may play a role in DevSecOps revisiting a part of the software development lifecycle. However, Agile methodology does not explicitly describe the development and security operations team coming together.

questions.question: Jon discovers odd traffic patterns on a server and begins an investigation. He discovers that other servers and workstations have a similar network signature. After scrutinizing the traffic, Jon believes he has found evidence of a coordinated attack that is slowly stealing sensitive banking data. He concludes that the attackers have exploited an undisclosed vulnerability and have specifically targeted Jon’s organization. Of the following, what type of attack or threat is Jon’s organization MOST LIKELY experiencing?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Advanced Persistent Threat (APT)

An Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) is usually carried out by a group of attackers who work together to target a specific organization. When their skill sets are put together they are very skilled. APTs are skilled and exercise patience to reduce the likelihood of being discovered and increase the possibility of a successful attack. Attacks carried out by an APT are generally not random, and the attackers have a motive to attack a specific organization. They are often even state-sponsored.

Script kiddies are not that skilled. They utilize software that other bad actors have created so that all they have to do is click through the software to launch an attack.

A Man-In-The-Middle (MITM) attack occurs when some attacker inserts themselves into the middle of the communication stream between the client and server. The attacker could just be watching and gathering information, making them very difficult to detect. It is also possible that they are altering the data and then forwarding it on to cause some other problem.

A logic bomb is a type of malicious software that ‘explodes’ or becomes active at a specific time or condition. An example is the Michelangelo virus. Every year on his birthday it ‘explodes’ although there may not be any systems on the planet that are still vulnerable.

questions.question: Integrity is the primary function of which security model?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Biba

Biba is an integrity model that prevents subjects with lower security levels from writing to objects at higher security levels.

Take-Grant is incorrect because it dictates how rights can be passed from one subject to another. Brewer and Nash is incorrect because it dynamically changes access controls to protect against conflicts of interest. Bell-LaPadula is incorrect because it primarily focuses on confidentiality and prevents subjects with lower security levels from reading objects at higher security levels.

questions.question: What is the main difference between an external audit and a third-party audit?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: A third-party audit is an audit conducted on behalf of another firm.
A third-party audit involves multiple firms directly in an audit at once.
A third-party audit is the practice of the public population testing security controls.
A third-party audit involves a smaller firm auditing, as opposed to a larger firm.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A third-party audit is an audit conducted on behalf of another firm.

A third-party audit most closely relates to an audit conducted on behalf of another firm. This can also be an unrelated firm that has the ability to be fair and impartial regarding the audited business.

A third-party audit with multiple firms involved could very well involve an internal and second-party audit, which would not be a third-party audit because there is some bias in these audits. Having the public audit an organization may enhance its trust in an organization, but the public may not have an encompassing interest in regulation frameworks or have the knowledge to keep that in mind. The size of a firm does not dictate whether or not there is a third-party audit occurring. Instead, it primarily focuses on the auditors' relation to the industry being audited along with the organization being audited.

questions.question: Which of the following security principles can protect against BOTH fraud and someone falling for a phishing attack?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Separation of Duties

Separation/Segregation of Duties (SoD) ensures that no one has full control over a critical process, system, or function. This protects against fraud and someone falling for a phishing attack.

Shared responsibility refers to the fact that an organization may share security responsibilities with some other organization. This is most commonly seen in cloud environments but applies elsewhere as well.

The principle of least privilege states that users should only be granted the permissions required for their role. This reduces the risk associated with a compromised account.

Failing securely means that an application results in a secure, safe state if something goes wrong. This is typically accomplished by implementing error and exception handling mechanisms in the code.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes Closed Circuit Television (CCTV)?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: The command and control traffic of a transient virus
A terminal server being accessed by a thin client

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Internal security camera system

CCTV stands for closed-circuit television. It's more commonly referred to as security cameras and is used for physical security. CCTV is used in data centers for security monitoring or in the workplace to protect against theft and vandalism.

The command and control traffic between a bot/zombie and the command center is usually referred to as Command and Control (CnC). Encryption algorithms can be used for real-time traffic. There are no specific algorithms for this. The most commonly used today is the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES). Thin clients accessing a terminal server is just that: a thin client accessing a server.

questions.question: Which technical form of assessing risk deals with the more elusive theoretical evaluations?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Qualitative risk analysis

Qualitative risk analysis does exactly as it sounds: it takes in the qualities, or theories of value and risk, to evaluate risk. It is a subjective form of risk analysis. There are two main approaches to performing a risk assessment: quantitative and qualitative.

Quantitative takes a calculated value of an asset and the projected percentage of loss of an asset to calculate the projected loss if an incident were to occur. It then further calculates the projected annual loss by adding in the number of incidents that would be expected within a single year. Theoretical mathematical review and objective risk analysis are not real risk management terms.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT in a typical vulnerability management workflow?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Funding

A typical vulnerability management workflow does not include a funding step.

A standard vulnerability management workflow starts by detecting or scanning for a vulnerability. The second step is validating that the vulnerability is not a false positive. The third and final step is the remediation of the vulnerability, such as with a patch.

questions.question: Which of the following does NOT fall into the category of Software-Defined everything (SDx)?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Virtual office

Software-Defined everything (SDx) refers to replacing hardware with software through virtualization. A virtual office is a fabricated term not associated with SDx.

Virtual Machines (VMs) run guest operating systems. There can be multiple VMs on one piece of hardware, so new hardware is not needed for each operating system. Software-Defined Networks (SDNs) separate controls from rules and remove the need for networking hardware such as routers and switches. A Storage Area Network (SAN) is a high-speed network that connects storage devices with servers. A Virtual Storage Area Network (VSAN) virtualizes the storage controllers using virtual servers.

questions.question: Sam is an operator of a Private Branch eXchange (PBX) and notices random calls that only last 3 seconds in the middle of the night. The calls sequentially ring each number in his organization’s block of phone numbers. Of the following, what is the MOST LIKELY cause of this behavior?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: War dialing

War dialing is when an attacker calls each number in a given range. The attacker is looking for modems or fax machines to use for future attacks. When a modem or a fax machine answers a call, it makes unique tones to identify itself as a modem or fax machine. Modems are still used for backup communication or management communication for network equipment.

Phreaking is incorrect because it targets a specific PBX and tries to manipulate menu options or make free calls. Phreaking also includes using blue boxes on public pay phones to trick the system into thinking that coins were added to place phone calls. Telecom keep-alive signaling is incorrect because it is a fabricated concept. Sales staff don't call late at night in a consistent manner, in many places this is even against the law.

questions.question: What BEST describes the purpose of separation of duties?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management

choices.text: To prevent any one person from having the ability to subvert security controls
To provide an efficient corporate structure of personnel
To reduce negative impact on the organization if the employee leaves

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: To prevent any one person from having the ability to subvert security controls

Separation of Duties (SoD) segregates critical job roles between individuals and prevents any one person from subverting critical security controls. For example, if an Identity Access Management (IAM) admin wanted to plant a network sniffer but didn't have access to the monitoring system to disable the security alerts, they would be less likely to attempt planting the sniffer.

SoD does not provide an efficient corporate structure of personnel. In fact, it complicates it by requiring more than one person to be involved in completing a task where it would be easier for one person to do the work. Its job is to prevent one user from committing fraud. It does not protect the confidentiality of information, it prevents one user from completing all the steps of a particular process. It does not protect the sensitivity since both of the users see some of the data, if not all of it. It also reduces the negative impact of an employee misbehaving while being employed, not after they leave the organization.

questions.question: Confidentiality is the primary function of which security model?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Bell-LaPadula

The Bell-LaPadula model is lattice-based and is a highly specialized security model whose sole function is confidentiality and limiting access; it has no other substantial functions. The Bell-LaPadula model was developed to formalize the U.S. Department of Defense's (DoD) multi-level security policy.

Clark-Wilson is incorrect because it is an integrity model that relies on the separation of duties and the separation of subjects from objects. Subjects access and modify objects indirectly through an interface or program. This is known as the "access triple." Biba is incorrect because it is an integrity model that prevents subjects with lower security levels from writing to objects at higher security levels. Sutherland is also an integrity model.

questions.question: Of the following, which BEST encompasses the primary goals and objectives of security?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Confidentiality, integrity, availability

Confidentiality, integrity, and availability are at the heart of information security. Confidentiality is the idea that sensitive data should be kept confidential and kept away from unauthorized individuals. Integrity is the idea that data remains authentic and unaltered. Availability ensures reliability and access to system resources.

Examples:

  • Confidentiality: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES)
  • Integrity: Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA-3)
  • Availability: Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID)

Organizational hierarchy is critical to assessing security. For example, it is normally a conflict of interest to have the security department reporting to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO). In most businesses, the CFO is responsible for audits. If that is the case, it is a conflict to be responsible for the audits of the security that you are also responsible for. This is not a primary goal of security. It is a best practice in security.

Privacy and acceptable use case policies are critical for security and are tools within the department. Privacy today usually refers to the protection of personal data. An organizational roadmap is critical for business. It is necessary for management to have an idea and plan for where they want to take their business. That is not security though. There can be a security roadmap, but that is how you get to the goal, not the goal itself.

questions.question: Of the following, what BEST describes 802.1X?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: A Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN) tagging standard

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A network-level authentication standard

802.1X is an Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) standard that requires network devices to be authenticated before accessing network resources. 802.1X can be used to dynamically assign a device to the correct Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN). It can be implemented on wired and wireless networks. Administrators can implement 802.1X using RADIUS as the centralized authentication protocol. It also uses Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) as a local protocol to transmit the authentication information to the access point when used in wireless networks.

IEEE 802.11, 802.15, and 802.16 are wireless protocols for wireless Local Area Networks (LAN), Personal Area Networks (PAN), and Metropolitan Area Networks (MAN) respectively. Ethernet is defined in IEEE 802.13. A VLAN tagging standard is IEEE 802.1Q.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the reference model for the collection and preservation of evidence?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Electronic discovery

Electronic discovery (e-discovery) standardizes the collection and preservation of data. The steps include information governance, identification, preservation, collection, processing, review, analysis, production, and presentation. The process is complex and requires participation from Information Technology (IT) professionals and legal counsel.

The evidence life cycle literally refers to the lifecycle of the evidence. It begins the moment that someone thinks or says “This is evidence” and ends when the evidence is no longer needed, which could be after all appeals have been completed within the court system. The critical concept that this sounds like is the chain of custody, but that is different from the ‘evidence life cycle’. Preservation of evidence is critical through the chain of custody.

Investigations are the process of assessing, analyzing, discovering, comprehending, and concluding what happened. Criminal investigations would likely lead to a criminal court case. Criminal cases are specific to criminal laws and criminal laws exist to protect the public.

Regulatory investigations would be related to administrative or regulatory laws such as the United States Health Information Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). They are laws that regulate industry.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of the software assurance maturity model?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Adaptation

Adaptation is not a function of the Software Assurance Maturity Model (SAMM). SAMM is a regimented and well-structured approach to ensure proper software development with security in mind. It does not offer the flexibility of adapting to the needs of software. Instead, software should follow suit with SAMM.

Governance, design, and verification are three key points of SAMM. Governance ensures policies and compliance come into play, while design and verification ensure security requirements are met when the software is developed and put into use.

questions.question:
Which of the following are considered required or critical steps in developing a Business Continuity Plan (BCP) as established by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)?

  1. Form a tiger team
  2. Develop the contingency planning policy statement
  3. Identify preventive controls
  4. Business Impact Analysis
  5. Ensure plan maintenance
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 2, 3, 4, 5

Although forming a tiger team may be done, it's not considered a critical step in a Business Continuity Plan. An IT tiger team, also known as a red team, is a specialized group of skilled professionals within an organization, or hired externally, with the primary purpose of simulating real-world cyberattacks or security breaches. The team's objective is to assess and test the organization's cybersecurity measures, infrastructure, and response capabilities. The name "tiger team" is derived from the idea of having a highly agile and aggressive team that actively hunts for vulnerabilities and weaknesses in the organization's security posture.

The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) outlines the following steps in SP 800-34:

  1. Develop the contingency planning policy statement. A formal policy provides the authority and guidance necessary to develop an effective contingency plan.
  2. Conduct the Business Impact Analysis (BIA). The BIA helps identify and prioritize information systems and components critical to supporting the organization's mission/business functions. A template for developing the BIA is provided to assist the user.
  3. Identify preventive controls. Measures taken to reduce the effects of system disruptions can increase system availability and reduce contingency life cycle costs.
  4. Create contingency strategies. Thorough recovery strategies ensure that the system may be recovered quickly and effectively following a disruption.
  5. Develop an information system contingency plan. The contingency plan should contain detailed guidance and procedures for restoring a damaged system unique to the system's security impact level and recovery requirements.
  6. Ensure plan testing, training, and exercises. Testing validates recovery capabilities, whereas training prepares recovery personnel for plan activation and exercising the plan identifies planning gaps; combined, the activities improve plan effectiveness and overall organization preparedness.
  7. Ensure plan maintenance. The plan should be a living document that is updated regularly to remain current with system enhancements and organizational changes.

questions.question: Two-way communication, where only one component can transmit at a time, is referred to as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Half-duplex

Half-duplex both sends and receives, but only one or the other can be done at a time. They must take turns. An example of a half-duplex device is a walkie-talkie. Each device can send and receive communication, but only one device can transmit at a time.

Simplex is incorrect because it is a one-way communication path established with a transmitter at one end of the connection and a receiver at the other end. Full-duplex is incorrect because it can transmit and then receive signals at the same time. Singular-plex is a fabricated term.

questions.question: Which action is performed at the beginning of business continuity planning to identify areas that would suffer the greatest financial or operational loss in the event of a disaster?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Business Impact Analysis

The Business Impact Analysis (BIA) is performed to determine which areas would sustain the greatest impact in the event of a disaster or disruption. One purpose of this analysis is to identify critical systems and prioritize assets that are most critical to the business. A BIA involves quantitative risk assessments, qualitative risk assessments, and determining the Maximum Tolerable Downtime (MTD), Recovery Point Objective (RPO), and more.

A quantitative risk assessment involves calculating the Single Loss Expectancy (SLE), Annual Rate of Occurrence (ARO), and Annualized Loss Expectancy (ALE).

questions.question: What is a deluge fire suppression system?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Water suppression system

A deluge fire suppression system is a water suppression system with extra-large pipes and sprinkler heads that allow for large amounts of water to flow in a short amount of time. Deluge suppression systems are not recommended for computer equipment because of the potential for water damage and electrical shorts.

A gaseous suppression system would use something like Halon (the 1987 Montreal protocol banned the creation of more of it) or FM200. A dry power suppression system (or dry chemical) would use something like Sodium bicarbonate and mono-ammonium phosphate. They can be used on class B or class C fires. There are temperature-based fire detection systems. They work on the basis that once the environment reaches a certain temperature, the fire suppression system releases its suppression agent. There is no temperature suppression system though. However, water works by reducing the temperature of a fire. Water can be used on class A fires.

questions.question: There are many different network topologies that have been used over the years to connect computers within a building. If there is a switch that has individual ports that connect category 6 cables from the user's machine to it, what topology is in use?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Star

Network topology refers to the physical layout and design of a network. Topologies are a part of the physical layer in the OSI model.

  • Star: A central switch connects many computers by way of category 5/6/7 wires together.
  • Ring: A ring topology connects all computers together in a ring or a circle.
  • Bus: Bus topology contains one trunk cable and each computer is connected to this one trunk.
  • Mesh: Each computer is connected to every other computer with a cable for each connection. Mesh topologies are the most complicated and expensive.

questions.question: Porter is preparing for an upcoming trial. One of their employees was investigated and charged with spying for a competitor. In the trial, Porter will be testifying as an expert witness. What differentiates an expert witness from a standard witness?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: An expert witness may express their opinions or conclusions without providing direct evidence.
An expert witness is another name for the key witness.
An expert witness is someone who passed a polygraph test.
An expert witness is admitted by the judge and not the prosecution or defense attorneys.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: An expert witness may express their opinions or conclusions without providing direct evidence.

An expert witness is believed to have greater insight because they have professional experience and expertise in the topic that their testimony covers. They can add insight and information to legal proceedings for various crimes. Expert witnesses should not be confused with standard witnesses who provide direct observational evidence about the case.

The rest of the answers do not define an expert witness. The witness is an expert if they have professional experience and expertise in the topic that they are testifying on.

questions.question: Of the following options, which is true regarding the Role-Based Access Control model?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

choices.text: A user can be a member of multiple groups
A user can only belong to one group
A user's access is defined by the owner of the object they are trying to access
A user's access is based on the label applied to the data

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A user can be a member of multiple groups

A Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) model uses specific roles or group memberships to define the level of access that the associated users will have in the environment. Users are not limited to just one group but can have multiple memberships with different levels of access.

The Mandatory Access Control (MAC) model uses labels that include the classification level applied to the data. There is also a label applied to the user that indicates their clearance level. The Discretionary Access Control (DAC) model has the owner determining user access. The owner has the responsibility of following policy within the business, but they grant access at their discretion.

questions.question: Which of the following types of disaster response plans prioritizes cost and minimal disruption over realism?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Tabletop

Testing disaster response plans is essential to ensure that they are effective and nothing is missed. Testing can be performed in various ways, including:

  • Read-through/tabletop: A read-through or tabletop exercise involves reading through and role-playing the disaster response plan. This is the cheapest, least disruptive, and least realistic form of testing.
  • Walkthrough: In a walkthrough, the team physically performs the actions described in the plan (unless they would disrupt operations). This can build familiarity and help identify parts of the plan that are impossible or require additional resources.
  • Simulation: In a simulation like a fire drill, the team is given a scenario and tasked with responding to it. This is more realistic than a walkthrough, but can be more disruptive to operations since tasks are actually completed.
  • Parallel test: Parallel tests perform normal business operations at an alternate as well as the primary site. This ensures that the alternate site can complete its duties while minimizing the potential impact on normal operations.
  • Full-interruption test: A full-interruption test actually switches operations over from the primary to the recovery site. This is more disruptive and risky than a parallel test but actually verifies that the organization’s failover processes work.

questions.question: An organization is looking for a threat modeling framework that enables it to consider risk while taking into account the fact that certain corporate IT assets are more important than others. Which of the following is the BEST fit?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: PASTA

PASTA is a seven-step threat modeling framework that considers both risks and the importance of various corporate assets.

DREAD classifies threats based on the Damage, Reproducibility, Exploitability, Affected users, and Discoverability of a threat.

STRIDE is a Microsoft-developed threat modeling framework named for the six types of threats that an attacker may pose to the organization.

VAST is a threat modeling framework customized for Agile environments.

questions.question: What is one major issue with a company purchasing commercial off-the-shelf software?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Less transparency compared to open-source products

Often, companies purchasing Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) software open to the public will not receive the source code of their products. This prevents any organization from making changes or tailoring the software to their needs by editing the code. It also encourages future software sales because, if anyone can edit the software, it would be easier to find edits online versus buying the newest version.

A common security argument is that COTS software is less secure than open-source products because the community cannot review the code and find the problems quicker, with the ability to modify it quickly. Vendor support is going to be there when you purchase COTS software though, which is a major benefit compared to open-source software.

questions.question: Why were early attempts to prosecute cybercrime challenging?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management

choices.text: Traditional criminal laws were written before cybercrime existed
Data is not tangible and can be confusing in court cases
Experts in computer science make poor court witnesses

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Traditional criminal laws were written before cybercrime existed

Until laws were written to specifically address cybercrime, prosecutions were attempted under traditional criminal laws, which often applied only loosely or indirectly. The Comprehensive Crime Control Act (CCCA) of 1984 was the first United States law with language specifically relating to computer crimes.

Data not being tangible can be confusing for judges and juries (if a part of the trial), but that is not the greater problem. Experts should be able to explain the evidence just as they can do with DNA evidence. Experts in computer science are no better or worse than other experts when they testify. Computer crime evidence is volatile but it is not usually removed. It needs to be collected quickly and protected properly just as most other types of evidence.

questions.question: Of the following, which BEST describes hacktivism?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: An information security attack carried out by a former or disgruntled employee
A state-sponsored information security attack used to gather intelligence against enemies

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A politically motivated information security attack

Hacktivism generally occurs because an individual is politically motivated to carry out an information security attack. Examples of hacktivism include the defacing of government websites or tarnishing a private organization or person's reputation because of political positions.

All of the other answers are reasons for attacks, but they do not have specific names.

questions.question: An attacker has successfully spoofed a client’s default gateway and now all legitimate traffic is routed through the attacker. Of the following, which attack option did the attacker MOST LIKELY use?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) poisoning attack

Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) is used to map Media Access Control (MAC) addresses to Internet Protocol (IP) addresses.
