Attackers can spoof an IP address by sending a gratuitous ARP update to a client claiming an IP address. The client will update its ARP cache with the attacker’s MAC address that maps the IP address. If an attacker spoofs a client’s default gateway, the client will send all traffic it would typically send to the gateway to the attacker instead.

Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) starvation attack is incorrect because the question specified that the gateway was spoofed. DHCP starvation attacks can be used to route legitimate traffic through an attacker but the attack is accomplished without spoofing IP addresses. The IP address was what was spoofed in the attack because the question includes the words routed and gateway. Routing is done using IP addresses. Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) is incorrect because it does not spoof IP addresses. XSS involves an attack against websites where the attack injects a script in some way. A MAC spoofing attack would involve a switch forwarding data incorrectly because an attacker is claiming a MAC address incorrectly.

questions.question: Jennifer receives a document with the word “CONFIDENTIAL” stamped on it. Of the following, what BEST describes the process of stamping the document?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Marking/Labeling

Marking and labeling are when the classification level is physically added to the document or media. Marking helps ensure individuals protect information and media while in their position.

Data classification is incorrect because it identifies the sensitivity of the data according to the data governance policy. Data normalization is a database design technique that organizes and structures data to eliminate redundancy and dependency. It involves breaking down large tables into smaller ones to reduce data duplication and improve overall database efficiency. Media categorization involves classifying and organizing media files, such as images, videos, or audio, into specific categories or tags based on content, context, or metadata. It facilitates efficient retrieval and management of media assets.

questions.question: What are the Statement of Standards for Attestation Engagements (SSAE) 18 and International Standards for Assurance Engagements (ISAE) 3402 commonly used for?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: Proper auditing requirements involving EU entities and customers for GDPR compliance
U.S. and international privacy regulations for commerce

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: External and third-party audits of companies

The Statement on Standards for Attestation Engagements (SSAE) 18 and the International Standard for Attestation Engagements (ISAE) 3402 are Service Organization Controls (SOC) audits. SSAE 18 is a national auditing system while ISAE 3402 is a very similar system used internationally. Both are standards used by companies to audit other companies in their jurisdiction.

Companies both locally and internationally now have a way in which to conduct third-party audits in a structured manner. This is one of many steps taken to ensure fairness and impartiality when businesses audit each other. It also ensures a uniform and organized approach to maintaining the standards of the industry as a whole. Both a national standardization of security practices and proper auditing requirements of EU entities would not suffice for an answer, as the answers are separate and the audit structures listed in the question encompass national and international frameworks. Additionally, neither involve strictly commerce.

questions.question: What is the BEST motive for an organization to create a Business Continuity Plan (BCP) or Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP)?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: To reduce disaster-related risks to an acceptable level
Members of the IT department are concerned with their ability to recover from a disaster

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: To reduce disaster-related risks to an acceptable level

The best motive for developing a Business Continuity Plan (BCP) or Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP) is to reduce disaster-related risks to an acceptable level. Senior management should be involved because they set the risk appetite of the organization, and they should be the driving force behind the creation of a BCP. Senior management is accountable to the stakeholders for the effectiveness of the plan. Organizations that try to create a BCP or DRP without senior management often do not align the goals of the BCP or DRP with the organization's risk appetite.

Regulatory compliance is incorrect because, while it's a good motive, it's not the best motive. To eliminate all disaster-related risks is incorrect because it is not possible to eliminate all risks. Discussing only the concerns of the IT department is incorrect because this represents a bottom-up approach. BCP and DRP creation should have senior management buy-in to ensure the risk levels align with senior management's risk appetite.

questions.question: Malware analysis can require the use of debuggers and decompilers for the purposes of breaking down and analyzing code. Many organizations develop their own custom set-ups consisting of these very programs, so users have one convenient place to conduct their work. What would a downloaded virtual machine consisting of pre-selected malware analysis programs BEST describe?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Integrated development environment

An integrated development environment is a pre-created environment composed of useful programs for the task at hand. An example of this would be Kali Linux, which is an operating system filled with various red and blue teaming tools.

A hypervisor is what controls a platform for virtualization. The hypervisor alone won't provide the tools for the job. In fact, it is the specific downloaded operating system that would provide such tools. Code repositories are collections of code made by many people, typically open for the use of others. An example of this would be Github. Dynamic Link Libraries (DLLs) are usually functions meant to be used with a specific coding language for a specific purpose. For example, there are many DLLs for creating machine learning AI in Python. These libraries allow the AI to have data for use when communicating with a person. The AI would possess a library in their code, which would tell them how to respond to specific statements.

questions.question: Which of the following organizations maintains a cybersecurity evaluation framework that is structured around five functions (Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, Recover)?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)

The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) maintains a cybersecurity evaluation framework that is structured around five functions (Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, Recover). The NIST Cybersecurity Framework (NIST CSF) was originally developed as a means to enhance cybersecurity in critical infrastructure, but it is now widely accepted for use (and is adopted) by organizations of every size and industry.

The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA), the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) are all organizations that promote standards, but they do not maintain a cybersecurity framework structured around five functions (Identify, Protect, Detect, Response Recover).

questions.question: Which of the following resource isolation terms BEST describes an added layer of protection to ensure low-privilege processes cannot access and modify a high-level process’s memory space?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Hardware segmentation

Higher trust levels often require hardware segmentation of memory. This memory becomes physically separated, not just logically separated. The physical security controls add a protection level from outside processes accessing memory resources for a particular application.

Random Access Memory (RAM) is computer memory used for data storage and quick access by the CPU. It's volatile, meaning data is lost when powered off. RAM's speed and capacity significantly impact system performance. Cache memory is a high-speed, small-capacity storage unit located between a computer's main memory (RAM) and the CPU. It stores frequently used data and instructions, reducing the time needed to access them, thereby boosting overall system performance. Read-Only Memory (ROM) is a type of computer memory that stores data permanently. It contains firmware or software instructions essential for booting the computer or device. Unlike RAM, ROM is non-volatile, meaning it retains data even when the power is off, ensuring critical functions are available at startup.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST ensures that access to an object is denied unless it has been explicitly allowed?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Implicit deny

A fundamental principle of access control is implicit deny. The implicit deny principle ensures that access to an object is rejected unless it has been explicitly granted to a subject. It is very common for firewalls to use implicit deny to block network access to resources that have not been granted.

Explicit deny is the process of specifically denying access to specific users. This would require a lot of work to ensure that each user, or Internet Protocol (IP) address, or Media Access Control (MAC) address, etc. is not allowed access. An access control matrix is a chart that explains the level of access subjects should be granted to objects. Least privilege is the concept that a user should only be granted the permission that they require to be able to perform their job. The least number of permissions possible, so, if the user only needs read access, they should only receive read access.

questions.question: Which of the following is MOST LIKELY to prevent a Structured Query Language (SQL) injection attack?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security

choices.text: The use of an Open DataBase Connectivity (ODBC) connector

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Input validation

Structured Query Language (SQL) injection attacks happen when an application interface does not properly validate an input. This allows an attacker to send SQL commands as application input and manipulate or alter data within the database.

Open DataBase Connectivity (ODBC) is a standard Application Programming Interface (API) used to communicate with databases. It would not prevent an SQL injection attack. That needs to be done at the source, where the user entered text, or filtered at the database. ODBC is also a different protocol than SQL. Schema changes and making attributes read-only help to control certain attacks, but SQL attacks are not what they prevent.

questions.question: The estimated time it takes to remedy a failure is called what?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Mean Time to Repair (MTTR)

Mean Time to Repair (MTTR) is the estimated time it takes to recover from a failure. Sometimes the acronym is MTR.

Mean Time to Failure (MTTF) is the estimated time between failures. Maximum Tolerable Downtime (MTD) is the maximum amount of time the system can be down before causing irreversible damage. Recovery Time Objective (RTO) is the targeted time, or work window, that a service must be restored after a failure.

questions.question: Sunita, a bank's IT manager, is building a gateway to gateway Virtual Private Network (VPN) between two IP-based networks from a local branch to headquarters. She must ensure the confidentiality of data and keep the bank's internal network topology secret. Of the following VPN technologies, what would be the BEST option?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: Internet Protocol Security (IPsec) with Encapsulating Security Protocol (ESP)
Transport Layer Security Virtual Private Network (TLS VPN)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Internet Protocol Security (IPsec) with Encapsulating Security Protocol (ESP)

Internet Protocol Security (IPsec) is a suite of protocols that provide protection at the network layer of the Open System Interconnection (OSI) model. IPsec is frequently used to establish a Virtual Private Network (VPN) between two routers. IPsec protects the original Internet Protocol (IP) packet by encrypting or hashing the IP packet and adding a new Authentication Header (AH) or Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) header with a new IP header.

IPsec can be used in either AH or ESP mode:

  • Authentication Header (AH) provides integrity of the packet and adds an AH header. This includes authentication for each packet but no encryption.
  • Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) provides the confidentiality of the packet and adds an ESP header. This provides limited authentication for each packet and encryption of the original packet.

Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP) is used when a Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) connection needs to be extended through an IP network. Transport Layer Security (TLS) VPNs protect layers 5-7 of the OSI model and are typically not used for a gateway-to-gateway tunnel. TLS VPNs are usually used for remote users to connect to the corporate network.

questions.question: What protocol uses a three-way handshake to establish communication?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP)

A three-way handshake is used to establish a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection. A client establishing a connection with a server initiates the connection by sending a TCP SYN (synchronize) packet as the first part of the handshake. In the second part of the handshake, the server replies to the client with a SYN-ACK packet, which synchronizes it. In the third part of the handshake, the client responds with an ACK (acknowledge) packet back to the server.

The other three protocols, Internet Protocol (IP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP), are all connectionless protocols. They do not have a handshake and they do not do acknowledgments. They do not retransmit missing or lost frames/packets.

questions.question: Kodi works with software developers as the information security specialist on a specific current project. She knows that they have been having issues with code access not being controlled properly among the team. Developers have had too much access or not enough access to the code they are supposed to be working on. Which of the following is typically used in software development to manage source code and maintain versions?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Code repository

A code repository is a centralized storage system that enables developers to manage, version, and collaborate on software projects. It facilitates source code sharing, tracking changes, and maintaining project history. Through version control systems like Git, developers can contribute, merge changes, and resolve conflicts efficiently, ensuring a smooth development workflow.

A data warehouse is a large, integrated, and structured database that consolidates data from various sources within an organization. It serves as a centralized repository, optimized for data analysis and reporting. Data is extracted, transformed, and loaded into the warehouse, enabling businesses to access historical and real-time data for decision-making purposes. Its design allows for complex queries, analytics, and business intelligence, providing valuable insights into the organization's performance and trends.

Data Loss Prevention (DLP) is a set of measures and technologies implemented to prevent sensitive or confidential information from being accessed, used, or leaked without proper authorization. DLP solutions monitor data movements across networks, endpoints, and cloud environments to identify potential risks and enforce security policies. By classifying and protecting data, DLP helps safeguard against accidental or intentional data breaches, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations and maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of critical information within an organization.

Runtime Application Self-Protection (RASP) is a cybersecurity approach that defends applications in real-time. It integrates into the application code or runtime environment to monitor behavior, detect threats, and apply security controls dynamically. By actively safeguarding the application during execution, RASP reduces the attack surface and mitigates risks promptly, enhancing overall security.

questions.question: Which disaster recovery test shuts down operations at the main site and moves them to the recovery site?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Full-interruption

Full-interruption tests are similar to parallel tests except they involve the actual shutdown of operations at the main site and moving to the recovery site. These tests are extremely costly and risky due to the complete shutdown of operations at the main site.

A structured walk-through is when the disaster recovery team gathers in a conference room and does a role-play of a disaster. A simulation test is when the disaster recovery team is presented with a disaster scenario and is asked to come up with a response, and then that response is tested. A parallel test is when the disaster recovery team relocates personnel to the recovery site and implements site activation procedures, but the primary site is left fully operational.

questions.question: Which of the following is MOST LIKELY to be a security issue associated with installing a platform such as Python, and leaving that program on a computer?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security

choices.text: It allows malware written in Python to affect the computer
If unused for too long, it will become deprecated and useless

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: It allows malware written in Python to affect the computer

Malware can be written in a variety of languages. Typically, it is written in C or C+ because they are basic coding languages that many computers use. If a computer can recognize and act upon a coded language, it can have terrible consequences if used maliciously.

Python is a popular language and malware can be written in it, but it is often avoided because not every computer has Python installed. Aside from obviously taking up more storage space and being of no use if left on a computer, potentially malicious processes would be the main reason to uninstall unused programs and services. Taking up space on a computer is not a security risk. Deprecated and useless is also not a security issue, at least not as it is written. If it is deprecated, it could have vulnerabilities that are unknown to the computer owner. Since the answer marked correct here has the word malware in it, it is the better of those two answers.

questions.question: Adriana is designing a parking lot for a bank. The security manager instructs her to ensure the proper lighting requirements are used. Of the following, what is the MINIMUM light level Adriana should use for a parking lot?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Two foot-candles

A foot-candle or lumen is a measure of the visible light that a light produces. The accepted standard for lighting used in parking lots or perimeters is a minimum of two foot-candles.

One lumen is approximately equal to one foot-candle. So the right lumen answer would be two lumen, not 20 lumen. 50 foot-candles is incorrect.

questions.question: Which of the following is known as the first mathematical model of a multilevel security policy?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Bell-LaPadula

Bell-LaPadula was the first mathematical model of a Multilevel Security (MLS) policy. The concept of MLS is the idea that a system would have multiple levels of classification in the same system. Access control philosophies can be organized into models that define approaches to security issues. The Take-Grant model, the Bell-LaPadula model, and the Biba model are examples of different access control models.

Bell-LaPadula was released in 1976 by the US government to provide for better confidentiality. The Biba model was released in 1975, but it addresses integrity. The Clark & Wilson model is from 1987 and also addresses integrity. The Brewer and Nash model is from 1989 and its primary focus is on the confidentiality of data.

questions.question: Which software development method has an emphasis on risk analysis and is used for rapid production and prototyping?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Spiral model

The spiral model has an emphasis on risk analysis and prototyping. This is used for rapid production and prototyping systems. The spiral model is derived from the waterfall model. Each loop in the spiral is one full iteration of the waterfall method.

The waterfall model is incorrect because it is a sequential design process used in software development where progress is seen as flowing steadily downward. Joint analysis development is incorrect because it uses prototyping in the life cycle area of the Dynamic Systems Development Method. Clean room is incorrect because it is a software development process intended to produce software with a level of reliability that can be certified.

questions.question: Which of the following file content types could be compromised by a rainbow table?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Hashed passwords

A rainbow table contains precomputed hash values that correlate to possible password combinations, enabling an attacker in possession of a hashed password file to crack plaintext passwords. Rainbow tables can be defeated through the use of cryptographic salts, which add a random value to the end of each password before it is hashed.

Account permissions, system logs, and memory dumps would not be compromised by a rainbow table since none of them contain hashed passwords.

questions.question: The US Government agency that has created a lot of useful documentation for information security is NIST. What does NIST stand for?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: National Institute of Standards and Technology

NIST stands for the "National Institute of Standards and Technology." NIST is part of the U.S. Department of Commerce and is responsible for developing information security standards and guidelines, including minimum requirements for federal information systems. NIST also helps develop standards and guidelines to be used by private sector companies.

questions.question: Which form of evidence is offered by witnesses who give oral testimony based on their observation of a crime?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Direct evidence

Direct evidence may come from witnesses who give oral testimony based on their observations. Direct evidence cannot be hearsay, which is second-hand testimony.

Conclusive evidence is incorrect because it is irrefutable and cannot be contradicted. Circumstantial evidence is incorrect because it can prove an intermediate fact used to assume another fact. Corroborative evidence is incorrect because it is used to prove an idea or point that cannot stand on its own.

questions.question: Apipa Pi Inc. is excited to begin migrating many of its systems from its physical servers to cloud servers. The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is especially excited, as this will reduce the need to resolve problems in person and allow for focus on larger projects within the business. However, the CISO also knows the company still holds responsibilities for many things and must maintain high standards. Of the following, what is one major component the business is no longer necessarily responsible for after the transition to cloud servers and to a Software as a Service (SaaS) company?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Application

In a Software as a Service (SaaS) implementation, the cloud provider would be responsible for everything up to the application. Apipa Pi Inc. is likely partially responsible for the application, but for the other elements, in the other answers, they are absolutely responsible. This would be determined by the cloud provider and their shared responsibility model.

Apipa Pi Inc. would still be responsible for identity and access management, as they would need to permit employees to access resources and manage logins, permissions, and passwords. The company would still be responsible for the users and endpoints being used to access the data now stored in the cloud. In fact, Apipa Pi has transferred a lot of risk to the cloud provider, yet at the same time, they have increased their attack surface. Apipa Pi Inc. is responsible for its data. Placing data in the possession of the cloud provider does not remove their responsibility for protecting their data. The cloud provider is also responsible in some way depending on the contract and laws.

questions.question: Which of the following refers to a VPN implementation that routes only a subset of traffic through its tunnel?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Split-tunnel

A VPN implementation that routes only a subset of traffic through its tunnel is using a split tunnel. Split tunneling is frequently employed to separate common internet traffic from any other interesting traffic that is routed through the tunnel.

Full-tunneling refers to a VPN implementation that routes all traffic through its tunnel. Network Address Translation (NAT) is a method to map and/or share IPv4 address space. Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) is an IP protocol, widely known for its association with the ping function.

questions.question: The Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption (POODLE) attack is possible against what protocol?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: SSL

Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) standard v3.0 was found vulnerable in 2014 to an attack known as the Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption (POODLE). POODLE demonstrated a significant flaw in the SSL 3.0 fallback mechanism. SSL is considered insecure and should be replaced by the latest version of TLS if it is in use and it can be replaced. If it cannot be replaced, other security mechanisms should be added.

HTTPS is incorrect because even though it is a protocol, the underlying protocol that it uses to encrypt is either TLS or SSL. Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) is incorrect because it is not vulnerable to the POODLE attack.

questions.question: Jim signs a document using a unique key assigned to him. Of the following, which BEST describes the purpose of signing the document?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Nonrepudiation

Nonrepudiation prevents an individual from claiming not to have done a particular action. In this example, Jim cannot deny he signed the document since he is the only individual with the digital signature’s private key. To repudiate is to deny or argue. Nonrepudiation leaves a user who cannot deny or argue their action.

A signature does not provide any confidentiality. A signature is achieved when the user encrypts something with their private key. To verify the signature, it is verified by decrypting it with the user's public key. The public key is public, anyone can get a hold of that key. Integrity is achieved through the use of the hashing algorithm. The message digest, the result of the hashing algorithm, is what is usually encrypted by the private key. So there is an element of integrity to the digital signature, but that is not the purpose of the digital signature. Accounting is the third "A" in IAAA. It requires that a log is created so that the user can be held accountable. But accounting is only a record of their actions, not a digital signature.

questions.question: Which of the following security features is commonly utilized in conjunction with mobile devices to restrict access based on location?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Geofencing

Geofencing is a security feature commonly utilized in conjunction with mobile devices to restrict access based on location. Location is typically determined by using the device's GPS system (which itself is referred to as geolocation services).

Geotagging refers to the ability of a mobile device to incorporate time, date, and location data into the metadata of media that is created by the device. Rooting refers to the act of bypassing the native security restrictions of a mobile device to grant its user full device privileges. Sideloading refers to a method of mobile app installation that uses a locally executed installer to bypass the managed installation (and security screening) typically provided by an app store.

questions.question: Unencrypted communications between a website and its user were intercepted during the negotiation of an e-commerce transaction. Of the following, which attack type is the user MOST at risk of?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Session hijacking

If the unencrypted communications between a website and its user were intercepted during the negotiation of an e-commerce transaction, the user is most at risk of a session hijacking attack. Session hijacking occurs when captured authentication details are utilized by a malicious actor to assume the identity, and act on behalf of, one of the parties in that session, to the other party.

Output encoding and input validation are not attack types but application security techniques used to prevent a broad range of web application attacks (e.g. cross-site scripting, code injection). Input validation ensures that actual input is aligned to the input expected for a particular field, while output encoding converts certain characters within website form inputs (e.g. ') into their HTML character entity reference equivalents (e.g. &apos) to ensure these characters are processed as data (and not potentially misinterpreted as programming syntax). Sideloading is also not an attack type but refers to a method of mobile app installation that uses a locally executed installer to bypass the managed installation (and security screening) typically provided by an app store.

questions.question: As of 2022, which Wi-Fi standard is the latest to be officially released in the United States?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Wi-Fi 6E

Wi-Fi 6E is the latest Wi-Fi standard to be released yet, allowing a maximum data rate of 9.6 Gbps under the 6Ghz frequency. Like Wi-Fi 6, it falls under the IEEE 802.11ax standard. Wi-Fi 6E is currently the only 6Ghz standard in the U.S., with the release of Wi-Fi 7 to occur shortly.

Wi-Fi 6 operates at the 2.4 Gbps and 5Ghz frequency but allows for the same data rate as the Wi-Fi 6 and 6E standards. Wi-Fi 5 is an old Wi-Fi standard, allowing for only a fraction of the data transfer rate Wi-Fi 6 and 6E allow for. Wi-Fi 7 is available as of January 8, 2024. The current exam outline, as of writing, is Wi-Fi 6e. The exam update in 2024 would make Wi-Fi 7 a valid question.

questions.question: Which statement about security awareness training is INCORRECT?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: Security awareness training effectiveness is only measured after training takes place.
Security awareness training is intended for all employees.
Security awareness training educates employees on how to recognize and respond to security threats.
Training activities should be tracked and audited to ensure all employees attend.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Security awareness training effectiveness is only measured after training takes place.

To test the effectiveness of a training program, performance must be tested before and after the training. If it is only tested after the training, it's impossible to know if the training was effective, because there is nothing to compare the results with.

Security awareness is for everyone. Security awareness should help employees recognize and learn how to respond to security threats effectively. Training activities should be tracked to ensure that all employees attend and, even better, are learning.

questions.question: Which of the following is the international standard known as the "Common Criteria" from the International Standards Organization (ISO) and that evaluates information technology product security?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: ISO 15408

International Standards Organization (ISO) 15408 is known as the "Common Criteria for Information Technology Security." It was developed as a standard for evaluating information technology products. ISO 15408 has seven levels:

  • EAL1 – Functionally tested
  • EAL2 – Structurally tested
  • EAL3 – Methodically tested and checked
  • EAL4 – Methodically designed, tested, and reviewed
  • EAL5 – Semiformally designed and tested
  • EAL6 – Semiformally verified designed and tested
  • EAL7 – Formally verified designed and tested

ISO 14001 is the environmental management standard used to establish an Environmental Management System (EMS). ISO 9000 covers the basic concepts of quality management systems. ISO 9001 sets the requirements of a quality management system.

questions.question: Which BEST describes an interface when discussing security assessments?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: The logical or physical point where two systems or a user interact with each other

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: The logical or physical point where two systems or a user interact with each other

An interface is best defined as the logical or physical point where two systems or a user interact with each other. This broad term includes the Graphical User Interface (GUI), Application Programming Interface (API), and physical interfaces such as the Ethernet card. Since the question does not specify what kind of assessment is being performed, e.g. software, network, etc., the more generic answer is best here.

When performing a security assessment on a system, all relevant interfaces should be evaluated.

questions.question: The IDEAL software development model has how many phases?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Five

The IDEAL software development model has five phases. The phases are as follows:

  1. Initiating
  2. Diagnosing
  3. Establishing
  4. Acting
  5. Learning

questions.question: Software that can run in various types of environments is known as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Portable code

Portable code is code that can function in any environment without a compiler. This code is typically found in a runtime environment. Specifically, it is the code providing the functionality of an operating system for a virtual machine, for example. These file types can often be seen as ".iso" images.

Although it may appear similar to a simple template, portable code is not static. In other words, it interacts with the virtual machine it is joining and provides functionality. Runtime refers to the period during which a program or application is executing or actively running on a computer. It starts when the program is launched and continues until it is terminated. Runtime Application Self Protection (RASP) is a security technology that identifies and mitigates vulnerabilities and attacks in real-time, safeguarding applications during their execution phase.

questions.question:
The primary data owner has been given the responsibility to handle all data and associated assets with due care and due diligence. As a responsible person, the data owner knows to be careful with how all types of data are shared and used but considers these two terms to be the same.

What is the difference between due care and due diligence?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: Due care is the act of taking steps to initially secure assets and information. Due diligence is ensuring due care is effective.
Due care is a knowledge-based approach to asset security. Due diligence is a physical approach.
Due diligence is a proactive measure to ensure due care is properly implemented.
Due care is the act of ensuring due diligence is being followed with all assets.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Due care is the act of taking steps to initially secure assets and information. Due diligence is ensuring due care is effective.

Due care is acting upon assets to ensure their security, while due diligence is ensuring this security measure is doing what it should. A data owner can create policies and rules for data usage and assign the ability to share information with a data controller, which would be an example of due care. The data owner then watching over the data controller and ensuring all policies and procedures are being followed would be an example of due diligence.

Due diligence is a secondary measure meant to ensure the due care process is being followed and is effective. Often, some may see these terms as being synonymous, but they become different when data roles come into play and data is shared among other entities.

questions.question: When should a Class D fire extinguisher be used?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: On a lithium-fed fire

Fires are classified according to what material is burning. Class D fires are combustible metal fires. Combustible metals include lithium, calcium, magnesium, lutetium, and cerium, for example. Class D fires require dry powder to extinguish them. Using water on a Class D fire can cause explosions and further feed the fire.

  • Class A: Common combustibles, such as wood or paper
  • Class B: Liquids, such as fuels and oils
  • Class C: Electrical, such as wiring and equipment
  • Class D: Combustible metals, such as magnesium or sodium
  • Class K: Cooking media

questions.question: Which of the following is BEST used to assess business functions and processes to prioritize their criticality?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Business Impact Analysis

Performing a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) is critical in developing a Business Continuity Plan (BCP) and a Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP). The BIA identifies all critical functions and processes so the organization can prioritize them based on criticality. The BIA also involves calculating risk for the identified business functions so that vulnerabilities are prioritized appropriately.

A BCP is used to prepare for disruptions to critical business systems. A DRP is defined by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) as the “plan for processing critical applications in the event of a major hardware or software failure or destruction of facilities.” BCP and DRP are considered by ISO 31000 as part of Business Continuity Management. A Statement of Work (SoW) is a part of a contract and clarifies what a particular job consists of and its deliverables.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the process of requiring a minimum number of authorized individuals to be present before performing a function?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: M of N control

M of N control requires that a minimum number of authorized users (M) be present out of all authorized users (N) before performing a function. For example, a dual custody safe may have three keys and require that two of the three keys be present before opening. M of N control is a form of split knowledge. Split knowledge separates a piece of information, say a password or combination for a safe, between multiple people.

In split knowledge, everyone needs to show up to be able to use the information. The question says ‘requiring a minimum number’. That changes the answer to M of N. Separation of duties takes all of the steps within a task and then divides it between at least two people. All of the people do not have to be present to complete the task. The first person could complete their steps one day and then the second person on the next day. Software escrow involves having the source code for software developed by a contracted company be placed into safe storage. If that contracted company files for bankruptcy, the purchasing company can then gain access to that source code to be able to continue patching and updating the software.

questions.question: Of the following, which supersedes the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) and has stronger authentication and encryption protocols?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Transport Layer Security (TLS)

Transport Layer Security (TLS) uses asymmetric encryption and Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) to securely exchange a client-generated session key, after which all traffic is encrypted using symmetric encryption. TLS superseded Secure Socket Layer (SSL). TLS is used to encrypt traffic in transit between the client and the server. TLS is used in web browsers, Voice over IP (VoIP), email, and other network communications.

Internet Key Exchange (IKE) is found within the Internet Protocol Security (IPSec) protocol. It is used to exchange the symmetric key for encryption/confidentiality purposes. Secure Multipurpose Internet Mail Extension (S/MIME) is a secure/encrypted method of exchanging emails. It is an improvement to the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extension (MIME) protocol. Secure - Remote Procedure Call (S-RPC) is a secure/encrypted version of RPC. RPC is an Application Programming Interface (API) like SOAP and Representation State Transfer (ReST).

questions.question: Which of the following is LEAST LIKELY to be considered when choosing a spot to place a wireless antenna when setting up the wireless network?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Avoid windows

When picking a spot to place an antenna, windows should not have any bearing on the decision, since they do not significantly affect signal strength. Windows could be a potential security concern though as someone can be in the parking lot capturing that signal and listening to the transmission. The question though does not point to this kind of security concern, and the other three answers can cause the network to not even work from the beginning.

A central location is important to ensure that the signal covers the greatest area possible. Solid barriers reduce the strength of signals and reflective materials can cause signals to change direction and can also reduce signal strength.

questions.question: Which of the following Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) protocols is MOST at risk from an eavesdropping attack?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)

Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application layer protocol in the TCP/IP suite that is commonly used for internet website browsing. Because it is unencrypted, communications that use it are MOST at risk of being compromised by network sniffing.

Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) is the "secure" (encrypted) version of the HTTP protocol, while Secure Shell (SSH) is the "secure" (encrypted) version of the Telnet protocol. Communications that use these protocols are encrypted and not at risk from an eavesdropping attack. Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) is not a TCP/IP suite protocol but a proprietary protocol developed by Microsoft to support remote desktop connections. Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) is a layer 4 protocol that has a three-way handshake but sends all text in the clear. Its purpose is to ensure all data is received but not encrypted.

questions.question: What law demands that personal information such as email addresses and Internet Protocol (IP) addresses need to be protected?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: General Data Protection Regulation

The European Union (EU) General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requires that personal data be protected. Personal data includes name, address, and phone number as expected, but it also includes IP addresses and email addresses, as well as many other direct and indirect identifiers.

The United States (US) Privacy Act of 1974 regulates the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information by federal agencies, ensuring individual privacy rights. This did not include IP addresses or email addresses.

The Uniform Computer Information Transactions Act (UCITA) is a proposed model law that aims to establish standards and rules for software licensing and transactions related to computer information.

The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) is a US copyright law that criminalizes the production and dissemination of technology designed to circumvent measures that control access to copyrighted works.

questions.question: According to the OSI model, which layer is the session layer?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Five

The session layer is the fifth layer of the OSI model and is represented in descending sequence as the third layer from the top. The session layer establishes, coordinates, and terminates communication sessions between networked systems.

Layer two is the data link layer. Layer four is the transport layer. Layer six is the presentation layer.

questions.question: Stealthy Security Suites & Beats is looking to identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) within their organization's firewalls. Which of the following would MOST likely be a reliable KPI?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: Number of times a malicious IP address is blocked before and after a new security rule is implemented
Amount of firewall log entries each day

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Number of times a malicious IP address is blocked before and after a new security rule is implemented

A malicious IP address being blocked after a new security rule is implemented shows a direct correlation between the two events and would indicate the security technique worked. Making observations before and after implementing any sort of control is common practice and smart to do.

The number of firewall log entries, IP addresses being blocked, or Snort alerts are not sufficient KPIs. The number of total IP addresses being blocked only represents that those IP addresses are being blocked, but does not reveal what IP addresses are still connecting or if the firewall needs additional configuring. Measuring this way leads to a false sense of security. The number of firewall log entries is just a number. It does not tell you what it is seeing and doing. It does not help, unlike knowing the number of times a malicious IP address was blocked in relation to the implementation of a security rule. The same is true with the number of Snort alerts. It is a generic number that does not relate to something in particular.

questions.question: Which of the following data protection methods BEST allows a data set to be analyzed and shared without any risk to the privacy of those from whom the data was collected?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Anonymization

Anonymization refers to the technique of removing the fields in a data set which associate that data with a particular person (i.e. personally identifiable information fields) so that the balance of data in that set can be analyzed and shared without any risk to the privacy of those from whom the data was collected. Both direct and indirect identifiers are removed permanently with anonymization. Unlike tokenized data fields, anonymized data fields cannot be recovered, making it the best method for privacy.

Encryption is a method that is applied to provide data confidentiality (customarily through the use of an algorithm and key, which encode plaintext into ciphertext and decode ciphertext back into plaintext). Hashing is a technique used in cryptography in which an algorithm is applied to the content of a message or file to produce a unique, fixed-length output (message digest) derived from that content. Tokenization refers to the technique of mapping sensitive data elements to, and replacing them with, an identifying token that is not itself sensitive if revealed. Only the tokenization solution (or applications authorized by it) can recover the underlying data element from the identifying token.

questions.question: When performing a Business Impact Analysis (BIA), you must identify threats to the organization. Of the following, which is LEAST LIKELY to be considered a threat?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Unpatched server

An unpatched server is a vulnerability, not a threat.

The International Organization for Standardization and the International Electrotechnical Commission define a threat as a “potential cause of an unwanted incident, which may result in harm to a system or organization.” Earthquakes, hackers, and botnets are all forms of threats.

questions.question: Often, it is essential for organizations to share data for research and transparency purposes. This includes government agencies, such as police departments sharing crime statistics, hospitals sharing inpatient statistics, and school districts sharing testing statistics. What is the BEST form of data management that, when done correctly in some circumstances, cannot be reversed and is no longer limited by the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Anonymization

Anonymization is the process of removing data to the point that it is impossible to identify the subject(s). This is most effective with large data sets with many categories. Anonymization also cannot be reversed, making it impossible to use a secondary data set to retrace steps associated with the anonymization process. What sets it apart is anonymization can't be reversed because the technique requires the shuffling of a large data set and has no database to link the random data back to the original subject(s).

Pseudonymization does not remove any data and instead provides false names for subjects. While it may seem like an effective method to protect data, those with knowledge of the fact that the data is using pseudonyms can narrow down the actual identities of subjects based on the categories of traits. Tokenization involves replacing sensitive data with a token that has no actual relation to the data it is replacing. With both pseudonymization and tokenization, a separate grouping of data linking the two together is kept and can be linked back together by those who made the data. Limitation is a fabricated term.

questions.question: What cryptographic attack replays a captured password hash to authenticate?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Pass-the-hash

A pass-the-hash attack is a cryptographic attack that replays a captured password hash to authenticate. In a pass-the-hash attack, knowledge of the underlying password is not required.

A brute force attack attempts every possible combination of characters to crack a password. A spraying attack is a type of brute force attack that introduces a delay between attempts (by looping through different accounts and/or systems) to avoid tripping account lockout controls. A dictionary attack attempts every possible entry in a predefined dataset, such as a dictionary.

questions.question: What is the correct humidity range for a computer server room?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 40% to 60%

The ideal humidity range for a computer server room is between 40% and 60% humidity. Too much humidity can cause corrosion. Too little humidity increases the chance of static electricity discharge.

questions.question: Carbines Steaks Co. is responding to an audit request by a contracted company on behalf of a large auditing firm. This company is auditing for the purposes of pertinent information in accordance with the European Union (EU) General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Which type of audit is this MOST LIKELY representative of?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Third-party audit

A third-party audit is conducted by someone outside the target organization who can be fair, impartial, and transparent in the process. An audit such as this will be seen in major industries where transparency is of the utmost importance to ensure the highest standards. This holds especially true when it comes to meeting government regulations.

An internal audit is the exact opposite and occurs when inside employees audit their own workplace. These tests do hold their value though, as they're great for preparing for major audits. Second-party audits typically involve business partners auditing each other. A great example of this would be an enterprise auditing a cloud provider prior to migrating data. These are useful to ensure all parties are comfortable working with each other and for enhancing trust, but they aren't as useful when it comes to meeting regulations. An independent audit is a fabricated term, but it could most closely relate to an internal audit.

questions.question: Of the following, which is MOST LIKELY used to exfiltrate data?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Steganography

Steganography is used to hide data inside of an image file. It is a common method used to bypass Data Loss Prevention (DLP) engines and is difficult to detect. Steganography works by modifying the least significant bits of the image to embed data into the image.

Fuzzing is a software testing technique. It is used to find flaws in a piece of software, not for the exfiltration of data. Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) poisoning is a Denial of Service (DoS) attack against a network. It is used to stop network traffic, not exfiltrating data across the network. A race condition is a problem or a flaw within a piece of software that is due to programming errors. There are some programming errors that may allow data to be exfiltrated, but this would not be one of them. A race condition causes a system to stop working.

questions.question: An IT administrator reviews all the servers in the organization and notices that a server is missing crucial patches against a recently discovered exploit. Which BEST describes what the administrator has just found?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A vulnerability

The weakness in an asset or the absence or weakness of a safeguard or countermeasure is a vulnerability. A vulnerability is a flaw, loophole, oversight, error, limitation, frailty, or susceptibility in the IT infrastructure or any other process.

A threat is something that could cause damage, alteration, loss, disclosure, etc. It is something that will impact the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of an asset. Exposures are when an asset is susceptible to a threat. If there is no exposure, there is no threat to deal with. A breach is a specific threat that is the exposure of sensitive, confidential, or personally identifiable information to the outside world.

questions.question: Within the process of gaining access to systems at the office, users must take several actions. What is the step of proving a claimed identity called?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Authentication

Identity and Access Management (IAM) follows the process of IAAA. IAAA stands for Identification, Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting; however, it consists of five services.

Identification is when a user makes a claim as to who they are. This is done by providing a user identification, email address, personal number, etc.

Authentication is the verification or proof of the identity claim. This is done through the use of one or more of the three authentication factors. Factor 1 is knowledge, e.g. password, passphrase, or cognitive password. Factor 2 is possession, e.g. token, X.509 certificate, or mobile phone (for the receiving of an SMS (Short Message Shared)). Factor 3 is biometrics, e.g. fingerprint, facial recognition, etc.

Authorization is then granting an appropriate level of permissions if the user is allowed access. Permissions include read, write, tag, list, execute, etc.

Accounting (Accountability or Auditing) is the process of creating a log or audit trail so that there is a record of actions taken. This allows companies to know what happened and hold users accountable for their actions if necessary.

questions.question: Which type of access control is a smart card?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Preventive

Preventive access controls attempt to stop or interrupt unauthorized attempts to gain access. Examples of preventive access controls include fences, locks, biometrics, mantraps, lighting, alarm systems, separation of duties policies, encryption, auditing, and others. A smart card is an example of a preventive access control because it prevents unauthorized activity.

A detective control discovers and alerts the operations center to a possible attack. Logs and the Security Information Event Manager (SIEM) are good examples of detective controls. A corrective control returns something to a functional state. It may not be back to normal but at least it is in a working state. A recovery control returns something to a normal state.

questions.question: Which of the following might be used to define requirements and ensure the security of third-party software?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: SLR

Service-Level Requirements (SLRs) are part of an agreement between a vendor and customer defining requirements for the software or service provided.

A Software Bill Of Materials (SBOM) identifies all the third-party code that went into an application, making it easier to identify potentially vulnerable or malicious components.

A silicon Root Of Trust (ROT) is a tamper-proof hardware component that stores cryptographic keys used for digital signatures and encryption. A silicon ROT is the basis for secure boot.

A Physically Unclonable Function (PUF) is a physical component whose unique physical composition is used to generate a digital fingerprint.

questions.question: Kyle is a penetration tester who has been hired to assess a network for denial-of-service vulnerabilities. He decides to conduct a Smurf attack. Of the following, what type of network addressing does a Smurf attack utilize in its initial transmission?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Broadcast address

In a Smurf attack, the attacker spoofs the victim's IP address as the source and sends Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Requests to the network's broadcast address. The echo request is usually referred to as a PING. Some define PING as the Packet InterNet Groper. When all of the devices on the network reply with an ICMP Echo Response, they will flood the intended victim. With a lot of devices on the network, a flood of packets would hit the victim's device, causing a Denial-of-Service (DoS) attack.

Unicast address addresses a single device. Multicast address addresses a group of addresses. Anycast addresses are sent to just one device like a unicast, but, the way it works is, that the first of any devices that can handle that request will answer, and the rest would then ignore the traffic.

questions.question: Which of the following forms of testing is likely to be performed FIRST?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer:

Application vulnerabilities are a common target for cybercriminals. Some ways to manage the number of vulnerabilities that reach production include:

  • Code review: Code review involves another developer reviewing code for potential issues. Often, this is accomplished by requiring a review before code is incorporated into a code repository. This can be performed earliest because it is performed before any code is accepted, and before the application is executable.
  • Fuzz testing: Fuzzing sends various inputs to an application to try to identify failure cases. These inputs may be randomly generated or intelligently selected based on a model of the system to maximize the probability of finding an issue.
  • Interface testing: Interface testing verifies that the different components of a system will work properly when linked together. The four types of interfaces to test include APIs, user interfaces (UIs), network interfaces, and physical interfaces.
  • Misuse case testing: Misuse or abuse case testing identifies ways in which a user could misuse an application and tests its responses to these malicious inputs.

questions.question: Modern cryptography algorithms can be categorized into all EXCEPT which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Trusted platform modules

Trusted Platform Modules (TPM) are designed to store cryptographic keys. It is a chip that is resident on the motherboard of a computer.

Modern cryptography can be divided into three types of algorithms: symmetric encryption algorithms, asymmetric encryption algorithms, and hashing algorithms. Symmetric encryption is the oldest and most well-known technique. A secret key, which can be a number, a word, or just a string of random letters, is applied to the text of a message to change the content in a particular way. This might be as simple as shifting each letter by a number of places in the alphabet. As long as both sender and recipient know the secret key, they can encrypt and decrypt all messages that use this key. The main disadvantage of symmetric key encryption is that all parties involved have to exchange the key used to encrypt the data before they can decrypt it.

Asymmetric encryption includes two related keys or a key pair. A public key is made freely available to anyone who might want to send you a message. A second, private key is kept secret so that only you know it. Any messages (text, binary files, or documents) that are encrypted using the public key can only be decrypted by applying the same algorithm, but by using the matching private key. Any message that is encrypted using the private key can only be decrypted by using the matching public key.

Hashing is a method of cryptography that converts any form of data into a unique string of text. Any piece of data can be hashed, no matter its size or type. In traditional hashing, regardless of the data’s size, type, or length, the hash that any data produces is always the same length. A hash is designed to act as a one-way function , you can put data into a hashing algorithm and get a unique string, but if you come upon a new hash, you cannot decipher the input data it represents. A unique piece of data will always produce the same hash. Hashing is a mathematical operation that is easy to perform, but extremely difficult, if not impossible, to reverse.

questions.question: Which of the following is an element of quantitative risk analysis that represents the possible yearly cost of a specific threat against a specific asset?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Annualized Loss Expectancy

Annualized Loss Expectancy (ALE) measures exactly a one-year financial loss that a corporation may suffer if an asset suffers from a specifically identified threat.

The formula is ALE = SLE (single loss expectancy) * ARO (annualized rate of occurrence), and it is used to determine risk and insurance requirements based on the potential for failure. The SLE is calculated by taking the Asset Value (AV) and multiplying it by the Exposure Factor (EF). The EF is the anticipated percentage of loss. SLE is effectively the expected loss if an identified threat occurs once.

questions.question: What type of data destruction is MOST LIKELY to ensure that data is unable to be recovered, and is recommended by the United States (US) National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publication (SP) 800-88?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Destruction

Destruction involves disintegrating or otherwise destroying data in a physical manner. This could include destroying hard drives or disintegrating paper files that have sensitive data.

Degaussing clears data on a drive using magnetization to impact the magnetic field associated with the data but could allow for the platters to be installed on a new drive and data to be read. Erasing only deletes the directory link to the file, not the actual data. Purging involves multiple rewrites over data to make it unrecoverable, typically combined with another method such as degaussing. While appearing to be a secure method of ensuring data is unrecoverable, this form of destruction is not considered safe by the US government, and top-secret material is destroyed instead.

questions.question: Which software development model is the most popular today and allows developers to move back and forth between processes as needed?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Agile

The Agile model allows developers to jump from one process to another, editing as they desire based on customer needs. This is most popular today because it meets the needs of businesses and customers, allowing for maximum benefit between both involved parties.

The waterfall method does not allow developers to go backward and fix changes, making any development typically permanent. The spiral method will allow a developer to eventually come back and fix something, but they won't have more than a few chances and they must wait to implement the changes. The flexible method is fabricated, but would most closely describe the Agile development model.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST control an organization might establish to increase security?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: Decrease in salary for causing security events

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Mandatory vacations and job rotation

The purpose of job rotation and mandatory vacations is to act as a deterrent and a detection tool. If an employee knows that someone will be taking over their job functions soon, they are less likely to participate in fraudulent activities. If someone does do something fraudulent, job rotation increases the likelihood it will be discovered. If an employee is given a mandatory vacation, someone is able to audit their work and discover fraudulent activities.

A decrease in salary for causing security events will only keep people from coming forward if there is a security event. Random desk inspections are not as effective as mandatory vacations and job rotation. Frequent drug testing only detects drug use which may or may not impact the organization negatively.

questions.question: In Kerberos the tickets are encrypted, where does the crypto variable that is essential for the encryption come from?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Key Distribution Center

Kerberos has three core servers: the Key Distribution Center (KDC), the Authentication Server (AS), and the Ticket Granting Server (TGS). The KDC is the server that creates and distributes the symmetric keys that are used to encrypt and decrypt the tickets by the user's machine and the destination server.

The tickets are created and distributed by the TGS. The ticket is encrypted by a shared symmetric key that the KDC and the user's machine share. Once the user decrypts the ticket they will find that the content is encrypted by another key. This part of the ticket is forwarded to the destination server which can decrypt that by using a different symmetric key that is shared between the KDC and the destination server.

The AS is the part of Kerberos that goes through the initial process of verifying that the user is who they claim to be. Once that is complete, the user is issued a Ticket Granting Ticket (TGT) which gives them permission to request access to destination servers.

The Identity Provider (IdP) is found within other Single Sign On (SSO) technologies such as the Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML).

questions.question: Which protocol was directly inspired by the Remote Authentication Dial-In User Service (RADIUS), but is not directly compatible with RADIUS itself without an upgrade?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Diameter

Diameter was developed after and inspired by RADIUS to overcome the limitations associated with compatibility among other authentication mechanisms. Additionally, Diameter is able to separate authentication, authorization, and accounting services.

Terminal Access Controller Access-Control Service Plus (TACACS+) was not directly inspired by RADIUS, as TACACS+ was a Cisco development and RADIUS was developed by Livingston Enterprise. TACACS+ is an improvement to TACACS.

Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) is a protocol originally designed for the Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) to allow one or two factors of authentication to be passed across an interface. It is commonly used today in other protocols like RADIUS. Transport Layer Service (TLS) is an improvement to the Secure Socket Layer (SSL), both of which are used in web-based connections for encryption purposes.

RADIUS, TACACS, TACACS+, Diameter, and EAP are all Authentication services.

questions.question: Which of the following is MOST LIKELY to employ a rule-based access control model?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A firewall

Most firewalls use Rule-Based Access Control (RBAC or RuBAC) to filter traffic. Firewalls include a set of rules or filters usually called policies, defined by an administrator. The firewall examines all traffic and only allows traffic that meets one of the specified rules. The final rule is generally a "deny all," meaning that any remaining traffic that did not meet previous rules will be denied and blocked.

Access Control Lists (ACL) or Role Based Access Control (RBAC) are much more common on servers, workstations, and databases.

questions.question: Which of the following refers to when an attacker floods the broadcast address with Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) requests containing the victim's Internet Protocol (IP) as the source address?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Smurf attack

A Smurf attack spoofs the source Internet Protocol (IP) address with the victim's address and floods the broadcast address with Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) requests. This causes devices on the network to send an ICMP reply to the victim for each ICMP request sent by the attacker. This overwhelms the victim and can cause the system to crash. A Smurf attack is a Denial of Service (DOS) attack.

A birthday attack is a cryptographic exploit that leverages the probability of two different inputs producing the same hash value. Attackers use this likelihood to compromise hash functions and forge digital signatures or certificates. A teardrop attack is a cyber assault that involves sending fragmented packets with overlapping, malformed payloads to a target system. The intention is to overwhelm and crash the recipient's operating system or network stack. A land attack occurs when the source Internet Protocol (IP) address is spoofed to match the target address so that the source and destination addresses are the same. This could cause a device to respond to the incoming message, but it would be responding to itself, causing confusion.

questions.question: Which of the following was published by the Internet Activities Board (IAB) in 1989 to promote responsible use of the Internet and to characterize unethical activities?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Request For Comment (RFC) 1087

In 1989, the Internet Architecture Board (IAB) published RFC 1087, a statement of policy titled "Ethics and the Internet". This statement promoted responsible use of the Internet and characterized five categories of activity as unethical. RFC 1087 is considered a forerunner to many contemporary ethics policies.

The Ten Commandments of Computer Ethics was developed by the Computer Ethics Institute to provide an ethical framework for computer use. Each of its canons begins with "Thou shalt not" in the style of the biblical Ten Commandments. The Code of Fair Information Practices, developed by a government advisory committee in 1973, was an early attempt at defining ethical principles for the handling of personal information. The COSO Framework does not directly relate to ethics, instead referring to internal controls.

questions.question: Nakano works for a manufacturing business that produces circuit boards for automobiles. She has been hired recently as the new information security officer. She has been preparing to talk to the Board of Directors (BoD) about the critical nature of protecting their corporate assets. Of the following, what is the BEST motivation when controlling access to assets?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

choices.text: Verifying that all subjects have been authenticated
Verifying that only valid objects are accessible

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Maintaining confidentiality, integrity, and availability

The primary reason an organization will implement access control mechanisms is to prevent losses. There are three categories of IT loss: loss of confidentiality, loss of availability, and loss of integrity. Those are the three core aspects of information security.

In protecting those assets, companies are likely to put many controls in to prevent unauthorized access. But that is what is being done. The question is asking why it is being done.

That logic extends to the other two answers as well. All subjects need to be authenticated when they access any asset that a company has. This protects confidentiality, integrity, and availability by ensuring that the right people are in the right place and are hopefully trained to access our assets.

With that, it could be critical to validate the objects before making them available to users. Validating the object is an integrity check.

questions.question: The Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) model is BEST defined as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

choices.text: Access decisions based on characteristics of the subject, object, or action
Access decisions made by the data owner
Access decisions made based on the user's defined role
Access decisions made based on the user's clearance label

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Access decisions based on characteristics of the subject, object, or action

A system that employs Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) uses attributes of the subject, object, or action to define access. ABAC is similar to rule-based access control but is able to be more specific. ABAC allows for the most granularity of any access control model.

If the access decision is made by the data owner, then the Discretionary Access Control (DAC) model is being used. Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) uses the user’s defined role to make access control decisions. Mandatory Access Control (MAC) uses the user’s clearance label and other things like the classification label, the policy, and so on.

questions.question: Cade has been working on their cloud Platform as a Service (PaaS) deployment. He has been creating image files for each of their deployed systems. These images are considered golden images. From the perspective of cybersecurity, which of the following is the BEST motivation to create system images and baselines?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: Decrease the time needed to deploy new systems

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: System hardening

System hardening reduces the overall risk of a system by removing unnecessary software and implementing best security practices. Once a secure baseline has been established on a particular system, administrators can capture the system's state, called an "image", and deploy it to other systems. This process is known as imaging.

Imaging can be used to decrease the time needed to deploy new systems. However, the best motivation from a cybersecurity perspective is to ensure that all systems are deployed with a hardened image. From an IT perspective, decreased deployment time is a very valuable reason for creating images. Having uniform names is not really a good reason for creating the images. It is a good idea to make the management of the images easier. Having a central inventory of the golden images is a good idea as well to make it easier to always find the golden image. However, it is not why the images are created.

questions.question: Of the following, which is the BEST example of risk transfer?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Cybersecurity insurance

Risk transfer is when risk is transferred to someone else. For example, when you pay an insurance company, they become responsible for paying out if the risk is realized.
