Early knowledge of a vulnerability provides a company with more time to remediate the issue. Evolving threats would also cause a desire for internal or external audits, as threats can sometimes evolve faster than required compliance audits.

questions.question: An organization has selected a recovery site that balances cost and speed of recovery. Which of the following does this BEST describe?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Warm site

Recovery sites can be classified based on the level of infrastructure that they provide and the amount of work needed to bring them online. The main types include:

  • Cold: A cold site provides a location and potentially infrastructure (power, Internet, etc.), but no devices. It is the cheapest site to maintain but the slowest and most expensive to bring online.
  • Warm: A warm site has more equipment than a cold site, potentially including some devices but needing others to be added when needed.
  • Hot: A hot site is an exact copy of the primary site with the same devices and the same data (potentially with some lag). It’s the most expensive type of site to maintain but the fastest to use.

Some disaster response groups use mobile sites, which build a server room in a shipping container or vehicle that can be easily transported to wherever it is needed.

questions.question: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) of Maple Leaf Industries is seeking to develop a hot site on the opposite side of the city to incorporate into the disaster recovery plan. Which of the following would MOST LIKELY meet the needs of Maple Leaf Industries?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: A fully assembled site with all the infrastructure, data, and necessary related services
An empty but available site suitable for full migration of all systems and services
A site with workstations and internet connectivity, but no data
A site that can transport itself whenever

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A fully assembled site with all the infrastructure, data, and necessary related services

A fully assembled site with all the infrastructure, data, and necessary services would be defined as a hot site. This site would allow for the fastest method of recovery since everything is set up to production environment standards.

An empty site or a site that otherwise does not have the networking, hardware, software, data, and real estate to be a viable backup is not a hot site and would not meet the requirements of the business. This would best be defined as a cold site. A site that can transport itself whenever and wherever would be a mobile site, which falls under a different capability and does not have the same scalability to sustain the needs of a large enterprise. A site that has only workstations and internet connectivity would be a good location for employees to move to if their work location is not available. However, this is not classified as a disaster recovery site and is part of maintaining the business continuity plan.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a way to help prevent a social engineering attack?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: When discarding office documentation, be sure to place it in a trash can
Ask why when someone requests sensitive information over the phone
Never give a password over the phone

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: When discarding office documentation, be sure to place it in a trash can

When discarding office documentation, do not merely put it in the trash but ensure it is discarded in a secure manner.

Whether you are talking in person, through email, or on the phone, always request proof of identity. Sensitive information should never be given over the phone unless it is a secure phone. Never give out a password over the phone for any reason.

questions.question: The only cryptography known to be impossible to crack, except by using brute force, when correctly implemented, is known as what?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: One-time pad

Gilbert Vernam invented the One-Time Pad (OTP) in 1917. A one-time pad requires a completely random key that is the same length as the message. Each bit of the message and the key are exclusive-OR (XOR) together. The resulting ciphertext is considered unbreakable with pure brute force as long as the key remains secure. For a one-time pad to be implemented correctly, keys cannot be reused and must truly be random.

One-Time pad requirements include the following:

  • Keys must be genuinely random values
  • Keys can only be used one time
  • Keys must be exchanged securely
  • The sender and receiver must keep the keys secure
  • The key must be the same length as the message

Quantum encryption is incorrect because it is different from traditional cryptographic systems in that it relies more on physics than classical mathematics and may be cracked. An elliptic curve is incorrect because it is a form of cryptography based on the algebraic structure of elliptic curves and can be broken. Vigenère cipher was developed in France in 1553 and uses Caesar ciphers with different shift values. A keyword is used to create the shift values.

questions.question: What security process is used to identify and understand potential threats and mitigations regarding an asset?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Threat modeling

Threat modeling is the security process wherein potential threats and mitigations to assets are identified and analyzed. It can be used for software, hardware, business processes, Internet of Things (IoT), and more.

Threat hunting refers to a technique used in security operations in which production environments are actively scrutinized by an experienced analyst for threats and indications of compromise. Penetration testing attempts to discover and exploit potential vulnerabilities. Penetration testing does not analyze mitigations for the threats it discovers. After the penetration test has been performed and the report submitted the company can then look for mitigations. Control testing is performed to evaluate controls for sufficiency. It can be used to test the quality of a control before being sold to the public using something like Common Criteria (ISO 15408), or it can be used to test the control within a business.

questions.question: Operations security seeks to implement controls that create all EXCEPT which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Optimization

Optimization is a critical concept in networking design, hardware design, software design as well as other areas of business such as processes.

The three objectives for security systems are confidentiality, integrity, and availability. This is known as the CIA triad. Confidentiality strives to protect assets from unauthorized access, integrity focuses on ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data and systems, and availability focuses on maintaining uninterrupted access for authorized individuals.

questions.question: An organization has implemented regular backups to minimize data loss in the event of a disaster. What type of security control is this is an example of?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Recovery

The six main types of security controls include the following:

  • Recovery: Recovery controls restore normal operations after an incident to a greater extent than corrective ones. Backups and server clusters are examples of recovery controls.
  • Preventive: Preventive controls are designed to stop an incident from happening. Fences, locks, and access controls are examples of preventive controls.
  • Detective: Detective controls help identify that an incident is occurring. CCTV, audit trails, and honeypots are examples of detective controls.
  • Corrective: Corrective controls fix issues after a security incident. Antimalware that removes an infection or an auto-close arm on a door are examples of corrective controls.
  • Deterrent: Deterrent controls attempt to discourage an incident from occurring. Corporate policies and security cameras are examples of deterrent controls.
  • Compensating: Compensating controls are used as a replacement when the preferred control is unusable. For example, a company renting an office in a building may put locks on the doors when it can't build a fence.

questions.question: Which of the following concepts related to packet switching is NOT correct?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Uses fixed delays

Fixed delays are used in circuit switching, not packet switching.

Packet switching protocols include the order protocol of X.25, Frame Relay, and Asynchronous Transfer Mode (ATM) which incur variable delays and are ideal for bursty traffic. It breaks down communication into small segments which are known as packets, frames, and cells, respectively. Each segment has its own header which includes source and destination address information.

Connection-oriented is most commonly used to describe protocols such as Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) and X.25 because they both contain sequence numbers and then acknowledge received packets/frames. If one is missing they also can request retransmission. That being said, most protocols in networking are connectionless because they do not do that. This includes Frame Relay, ATM, Internet Protocol (IP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and so on.

questions.question: What is it called when someone combines multiple pieces of information at a lower classification level to infer information at a higher classification?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Access aggregation

Access aggregation happens when someone combines multiple pieces of information at a lower classification level and infers information at a higher classification. This is part of the reconnaissance step in the cyber kill chain.

Footprinting is gaining information to be able to state what systems exist and what their Operating System (OS) patch level is. Access creep occurs when users just keep gaining more access to systems and data the longer they work for a company. When a user leaves a project or department, their old access should be removed if it is no longer needed. Access factoring is not a correct term.

questions.question: Sam is a network engineer and is installing an Intrusion Prevention System (IPS). Of the following, at what position on the network will the IPS be LEAST effective?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: Off of a network Traffic Access Point (TAP)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Off of a network Traffic Access Point (TAP)

A network Traffic Access Point (TAP) is a physical device used to capture network flows between devices. A network TAP can only reproduce traffic and cannot alter or change the traffic as it flows through it. Network TAPs are commonly used when installing an Intrusion Detection System (IDS) but should not be used when installing an Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) since traffic coming off the TAP cannot be altered or manipulated.

An IPS makes forwarding decisions in real-time and must be strategically placed to be effective. An IPS can be installed between a router and a firewall, between two switches, between a switch and a router, or in any other location where the corporation wants to watch and control traffic that they do not want. Most commonly, it would be installed after the Internet-connected router and the first firewall.

questions.question: When discussing wireless security, the Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) protocol has many advantages over the older Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) protocol, including the use of the Temporal Key Integrity Protocol (TKIP). When using WPA with TKIP, what encryption algorithm is used?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Rivest Cipher 4 (RC4)

RC4 is a stream cipher and has a variable key size. It was commonly used in Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP), and Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA). When used with the WPA protocol and Temporal Key Integrity Protocol (TKIP), the key changes for every frame transmitted. WPA also included a sequence counter to protect against replay attacks.

WPA has been replaced by WPA2, which uses the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) instead of RC4. Blowfish is a decent alternative symmetric algorithm, but it is not used by WEP or WPA. Rivest Shamir Adelman (RSA) is an asymmetric algorithm used in many places, such as websites, but not by WEP and WPA.

questions.question: Which network type BEST connects servers to network-attached devices that are designed to hold bulk data over time?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Storage Area Network (SAN)

The Storage Area Network (SAN) connects servers to a network-attached storage device. Storage can be attached using Internet Small Computer Systems Interface (iSCSI), Fibre Channel (FC), or Network File System (NFS).

Personal Area Network (PAN) is incorrect because it is not used for a storage device. Metropolitan Area Network (MAN) is incorrect because it is an area network that extends across a large area such as a city. Wide Area Network (WAN) is incorrect because it is a data network that operates across a relatively large geographic area, e.g. across multiple Local Area Networks (LANs).

questions.question: Mark works in a Security Operations Center (SOC) and monitors firewall connections for suspicious traffic. The firewall that Mark is watching sees a data link layer unicast traffic between devices on the same Local Area Network (LAN) that are not connected to the firewall. Of the following, the firewall is MOST LIKELY connected to what type of device?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Hub

Hubs transmit frames out all interfaces regardless of the source and destination Media Access Control (MAC) address. In this scenario, the firewall would see unicast traffic between devices that are not destined for the firewall, so long as all devices are connected to the Hub.

A switch is incorrect because a switch generally does not send frames to interfaces where the traffic is not destined. A router is incorrect because a router is used to route traffic between networks. A bridge is incorrect because a bridge is used to connect two networks as if they were a single network.

questions.question: Which process found within ITIL would match the process of making new software features available to users?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Release management

Release management is the process of managing, coordinating, controlling, and making new and changed services available. This includes software features being made available to users.

Deployment management is moving new hardware into production or new software to a live environment. Continuity management is the equivalent of disaster recovery elsewhere. This process is about making sure that services are available at a specific level of performance after a disaster. Configuration management is the process of managing configuration items.

questions.question: Which disaster recovery site provides the most rapid recovery capability, but also requires the most effort to maintain its readiness?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Hot site

A hot site provides the most rapid recovery capability because it is complemented by the full resources required for instant function and connectivity of IT systems. A hot site is only missing people and some data.

A cold site is incorrect because a cold site is an empty computer room with environmental facilities such as heating, ventilation, and air conditioning, but no computing equipment. A warm site is incorrect because a warm site is basically a cold site, but with computers and communication links already in place ready to be loaded with operating systems and data. Reciprocal site is incorrect because, in a reciprocal agreement, two organizations pledge the availability of their organization's data center in the event of a disaster but it could take a while to get over to that site and get working. This is not faster because the other company's site would not have any of the data and it can take a while to get the other company to let them in and release access to some of the systems.

questions.question: How many keys are required to implement an asymmetric cryptosystem with 10 participants, assuming that each participant uses a different set of keys, and each can initiate the connection to anyone else?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 20

In an asymmetric cryptosystem, each participant requires two keys⁠: a public key and a private key. If we assume each participant can initiate the connection, and each has a different set of keys, then there must be 20 keys. In this case, there are 10 participants with two keys each.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a security model?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Diffie Hellman

Diffie Hellman is a key exchange method, not a security model.

Security models are used to help design security programs by setting goals and defining techniques and data structures. Bell-LaPadula, Brewer and Nash, and Clark Wilson are all examples of security models.

questions.question: Which of the following access control models relies on classification labels, where each label represents a security domain?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Mandatory Access Control (MAC)

A system that employs Mandatory Access Control (MAC) uses classifications and labels to define user access. Every resource is classified with a label and users cannot access resources unless they have an equal or greater clearance level. MAC is widely used in government and military environments. MAC is often referred to as a lattice-based model because it looks like a garden lattice with well-defined boundaries when it is represented on paper.

Discretionary Access Control (DAC) allows the data owner to control and define access to objects. Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) maps a subject’s role with their needed operations and tasks. Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) makes decisions based on attributes of the subject, object, or actions; such as time of day or object location.

questions.question: An organization has decided to take an action that increases its overall risk exposure. This describes which of the following approaches to risk?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Acceptance

Possible responses to risk include the following:

  • Acceptance: Accept the potential consequences and costs of the risk to the organization. This increases an organization's overall risk exposure.
  • Mitigation: Implementing security controls to reduce or eliminate risk.
  • Assignment/transfer: Transferring responsibility for a risk to someone else, such as an insurer.
  • Avoidance: Avoid taking the action that creates the risk. This can result in lost opportunities.

questions.question: Which of the following control types should be the FIRST line of defense against an initial attempt to access a physical asset?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Deterrent

The first line of defense against an initial attempt to access a physical asset should be a deterrent control such as signs, lighting, or policy.

A physical security program should attempt to thwart threats in the following order:

  • Deterrence/Deterrent controls
  • Denial/Preventative
  • Detection/Detective controls
  • Delay/Preventative and Compensating controls

A corrective control is a control that takes a non-working situation and brings it back to a functional state. For example, if there was a fire in the data center and the company failed to a hot site, they have used a corrective control. A recovery control returns things to a normal status. So if the company returns home they have recovered.

questions.question: An organization installs a honeypot on its private network in a location inaccessible to anyone but a hacker. What cybersecurity concept is being applied here?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Enticement

A honeypot is a vulnerable system deliberately employed for enticement. A hacker who has breached the organization's network would be expected to notice and target the honeypot, thereby alerting the organization to the intruder and their techniques.

Entrapment would not apply in this scenario because unauthorized access is neither solicited nor encouraged. Threat modeling is a structured method to assess threats, risks, and vulnerabilities. Least privilege is a cybersecurity principle (applied primarily in rights assignment) that states that users should be granted only the minimum privileges they need to fulfill their duties.

questions.question: Which of the following is characterized legally by an established brand identity?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Trademarks

Trademarks protect brand identity, including slogans, logos, phrases, or combinations representing the company or brand identity. The primary goal of trademark protection is to avoid confusion in the marketplace.

Copyrights are applied to the ‘expression of ideas’, for example, songs, movies, TV shows, and software. For example, Microsoft 365 Word allows a user to create a document in much the same way that Google Docs does. How the interface is set up is unique to each though, even though in both you can format text, change text color, bold text, etc.

Patents protect ideas that are novel, useful, and non-obvious. Novel means that it has never been seen before. Useful means people are interested in using it and find it a useful idea/tool. Non-obvious means that the average person has not had that thought before. A good example here is the Rivest, Shamir, Adleman (RSA) algorithm. The math involved took many years of work to figure out.

Licensing is a money-making model that vendors can choose to follow. In the past, a user/company bought and owned a copy of the suite of office tools from Microsoft. Today, the software is owned by Microsoft, even if loaded on a personal/corporate computer. Microsoft charges a monthly or yearly fee for the use of the software.

questions.question: With remote jobs becoming more popular than ever, security managers need to find a method to allow employees to securely complete work in a remote area. Management is concerned about allowing such practices, as they may include serious security vulnerabilities and risks if not properly implemented. What would be the MOST LIKELY method used to reduce potential security issues arising from remote work and unauthorized access to files and data?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Attribute-based access control

Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) would allow access to be granted to files and data based on the attributes of the subject attempting to access it. These attributes can include location, time of day, security clearance, and even limit the subject to specific actions. Attribute-based access control is the most detailed access control method because it can be customized with the most variety and be tailored to the smallest detail to meet the needs of an organization.

Rule-based access control is dependent on rules created between a subject and object, usually used in addition to role-based access control. Role-based access control limits a subject's access to an object based on the subject's role in an organization or potentially some structured hierarchy.

Discretionary access control gives the data authorization abilities and responsibilities to the owner or creator of the data, and would typically rely on an Access Control List (ACL) to enforce the access. With discretionary access control, some attributes such as location or time of day associated with accessing the files are not taken into consideration, therefore making this type of access control distinctly different from attribute-based.

questions.question: Security analysts at Maple Leaf Industries would like to determine the best strategy to remotely log all firewall information. Aside from reducing attacks, the analysts want to ensure that if they are attacked they can determine what other systems are affected. There is also growing concern that some logs may be deleted, as attackers attempt to cover their tracks. What could the security analysts implement that would MOST LIKELY reduce or eliminate logs from being deleted on the network and allow for such analysis?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Security and information event management

Security and Information Event Management (SIEM) products are designed to log and analyze networks, providing the user with a variety of ways to observe their network. SIEMs also aggregate data from various sources, making event correlation and threat hunting very simple for security analysts. With the SIEM being remote or a secondary log source on the network at least, there is a second copy of time-organized logs available in case an attacker deletes their firewall logs.

A second router would not complete the job, as it may negatively affect the network through double NATing (Network Address Translation) or blocking ports and other devices. Additionally, a secondary router may only see the traffic coming through it, and would not be scanning the network in its entirety as a SIEM would. Constantly watching logs would be tedious and open the door to human error. An intrusion detection system would give plenty of alerts, but not take action, which again opens the door to delayed action and would only see the traffic passing through it.

questions.question: High humidity can become a serious problem for computer systems. What will MOST LIKELY occur if a computer system is exposed to high humidity for a prolonged amount of time?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Corrosion

Corrosion is a serious problem associated with the buildup of moisture that occurs with higher humidity. Data centers should have humidity controls that balance moisture in the air at the right levels.

Low humidity can lead to an increase in static electricity, which can lead to electrical shorts and data loss. An electrical short occurs when a 'hot' wire comes into contact with a neutral wire. It could happen if it comes in contact physically or if there is an arc of electricity from the hot wire. It does not have anything to do with humidity levels. Any of these problems could cause a loss of data. However, the way the question is worded focuses on humidity and the computer system, so corrosion is the most direct problem.

questions.question: IPSec provides secure Virtual Private Network (VPN) connections. What are its two primary modes of operation that it can be used in?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) and Point to Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP)
Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP) and Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) and Authentication Header (AH)

Internet Protocol Security (IPSec) is a suite of protocols that provides protection in the network layer of the Open System Interconnection (OSI) model. IPSec is frequently used to establish a VPN or an encrypted connection between two routers. However, it is possible that IPSec can be used for a variety of other scenarios that require encryption of a transmission.

IPsec can be used in either AH or ESP mode:

  • An Authentication Header (AH) provides authentication of the source of a packet by encrypting the header. This also provides an integrity check of the packet. It does not touch the data or payload of the packet.
  • An Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) provides the confidentiality of the packet by encrypting it with a symmetric algorithm.

PPTP, L2TP, and L2F are all layer 5 (session) protocols. They are all considered tunneling protocols, which are designed to carry another protocol. The original purpose was to carry older, legacy, protocols across the Internet using the Internet Protocol. The names have layer 2 in them because that is what they are carrying, a legacy layer 2 protocol. That legacy layer 2 protocol is dropped in at layer 5 of the OSI model onto the TCP/IP protocol suite.

questions.question: What is the purpose of cryptanalysis?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering

choices.text: To break a code or decrypt data
To determine the authenticity of a message

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: To break a code or decrypt data

Cryptanalysis is the study of methods for obtaining the meaning of encrypted information without access to the key. Cryptanalysis is also referred to as codebreaking or cracking the code. The ciphertext is generally the easiest part of a cryptosystem to obtain and, therefore, is an important part of cryptanalysis. Depending on what information is available and what type of cipher is being analyzed, cryptanalysts can follow one or more attack models to crack a cipher.

The authenticity of the messages is determined by digital signatures. Digital signatures are created using the private key to encrypt/sign something. Most commonly it is the hash of the message. Decryption tasks are part of cryptography. If you combine cryptography and cryptanalysis, you get to cryptology. There is no particular name given to the recording of key signatures.

questions.question: Coworkers are discussing runtime environments and how they can be beneficial in the workplace. What is a runtime environment?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security

choices.text: A computing environment that provides the necessary resources for executing software programs and services
An environment dedicated to maximum efficiency in the workplace.
An environment exclusively for the dynamic analysis of malware.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A computing environment that provides the necessary resources for executing software programs and services

A runtime environment (RTE) is a computing environment that provides the necessary resources for executing software applications. It includes system memory, libraries, and dependencies required for the program to function. Runtime environments ensure that software runs consistently across different systems by managing execution, handling inputs/outputs, and facilitating interactions with the operating system.

While a runtime environment can be used in malware analysis, coding, or optimizing workplace efficiency, its primary function is to execute applications rather than focusing on a single specialized purpose.

An environment dedicated to maximum efficiency in the workplace is too broad and does not define an RTE.

An environment exclusively for the dynamic analysis of malware is a sandbox, which is used to isolate and test malicious code.

An environment for developing code refers to an integrated development environment (IDE), which includes tools for writing and debugging software, but is distinct from an RTE.

questions.question:
Violet is a penetration tester who has been hired to assess an organization’s security awareness. She decides to send a specially crafted email to a specific employee, asking them to click a link to verify their employee benefits. She chooses this wording because she knows the company recently finished enrolling all their employees into their benefit plans.

Of the following, what BEST describes the type of attack Violet used?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Spear phishing

Spear phishing is a targeted cyberattack method where malicious actors impersonate trusted entities via deceptive emails or messages. They aim to trick recipients into revealing sensitive information and credentials or into downloading malware.

Whaling is a type of phishing that targets high-profile individuals or executives. Attackers craft convincing messages to deceive these targets into revealing sensitive information or authorizing financial transactions.

Clone phishing involves duplicating a legitimate email and replacing links or attachments with malicious versions, typically within an ongoing email conversation. Since Violet crafted an original message rather than modifying an existing one, this is not clone phishing.

Vishing (voice phishing) is a phishing attack conducted over the phone, using social engineering tactics to deceive victims into revealing information. Since Violet used an email rather than a phone call, this is not vishing.

questions.question: Micki is the plant manager of a manufacturing company. She proceeds to log in to her workstation using a username and password. What BEST describes the role of the username?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Identification

Identification is the process of a subject claiming, or professing, an identity. A subject must provide an identity to a system to start the authentication, authorization, and accountability processes. Providing an identity might entail typing a username, swiping a smart card, waving a token device, speaking a phrase, etc.

Authentication is the process of providing information to verify the claim in the identification step. There are three factors of authentication: something you know, something you have, and something you are. Authorization is the process of granting (or not) permissions once the identification is proven. These permissions include things like read, write, execute, tag, etc. Accountability is then the process of creating a log so as to be able to hold the user accountable for their actions or allow reparations to be made after a bad actor gains access to an account.

questions.question: Which of the following developed a security standard specifically designed to protect against theft of financial data?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: PCI Council

PCI DSS is a standard developed by the Payment Card Industry (PCI) Council focused specifically on protecting cardholders' data and preventing fraud.

The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) is an international agency that creates standards defining best practices in various areas. Among these are several information security standards, such as ISO 27001.

NIST is a US government agency that publishes various standards, including cybersecurity ones such as NIST 800-53.

COBIT is a framework developed by ISACA to describe goals for security controls.

questions.question: Public keys in a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) are published through the use of which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Digital certificates

Digital certificates contain public keys that belong to someone or something (e.g. a web server). The standard package that holds the public keys is the ITU-TSS X.509 format. There are several other fields within the certificate such as the subject’s name and the Certificate Authorities (CA) signature. The CA is the trusted source of certificates. They (human and computer combined) are charged with knowing for sure who the key will belong to and then publishing the X.509 certificate.

A digital signature is created when the subject (someone or something) encrypts something (a.k.a. signs something) by encrypting it with their private key. What is normally encrypted is the hash of the data that it relates to. The private key should never be in someone else’s possession so that the digital signature truly means something. Public Key Infrastructure is the correct term, not private key infrastructure. The public key can be shared with anyone.

questions.question: Which of the following represents the formula used to determine annualized loss expectancy?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management

choices.text: Single Loss Expectancy (SLE) x Annual Rate of Occurrence (ARO)

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Single Loss Expectancy (SLE) x Annual Rate of Occurrence (ARO)

Annualized Loss Expectancy (ALE) measures exactly a one-year financial loss an asset may suffer from a specifically identified threat. The formula, ALE (Annualized Loss Expectancy) = SLE (Single Loss Expectancy) x ARO (Annual Rate of Occurrence), is used to determine risk and insurance requirements based on the potential for failure.

Asset Value (AV) x Exposure Factor (EF) is the formula to calculate SLE. The other two calculations are not correct.

questions.question: Which type of encryption does Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) use?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Asymmetric and symmetric

Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) use both asymmetric and symmetric encryption to protect data in transit. Asymmetric encryption is used to authenticate the Client or Server and securely exchange the symmetric key. Symmetric encryption is used to encrypt data after the handshake has taken place.

  1. Client sends a Client hello message to the Server
  2. Server sends the client a Server hello message encrypted with the private key
  3. Client decrypts the message using the public key
  4. Client sends pre-master secret encrypted with the public key
  5. Server decrypts the pre-master secret with the private key
  6. Both the Client and Server generate symmetric keys using the pre-master secret
  7. Symmetric encryption begins between the Client and Server

Symmetric encryption can work in one of two ways; it can be a block algorithm or a stream algorithm. The stream algorithms encrypt one bit of data at a time, whereas block algorithms encrypt chunks, or blocks, of data at a time, e.g. 128-bit blocks.

questions.question:
Freeya works for a large multinational corporation that has begun implementing job rotation in its networking division. There are many benefits that can be achieved from this tool. From the following, please identify the benefits of job rotation.

  1. Improves employee relationships
  2. Provides peer review
  3. Reduces fraud
  4. Enables cross-training
  5. Detects split knowledge
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 2, 3, and 4

The purpose of job rotation is to act as a deterrent and a detection tool. If one knows that someone will be taking over their job functions soon, they are less likely to participate in fraudulent activities. If someone does do something fraudulent, job rotation increases the likelihood it will be discovered through a peer review when someone rotates into that job and is cross-trained on responsibilities. A peer review is performed, effectively, when someone rotates into a job. It is necessary to figure out where the last person left off in order to get to work. This peer review could either detect fraud or, knowing it will happen, reduce the likelihood of it ever happening.

It does not improve employee relationships. It potentially holds the potential of complicating those relationships when someone detects mistakes, or worse, malicious errors caused by a coworker. Split knowledge refers to dividing sensitive information among multiple parties to prevent unauthorized access, requiring collaboration for complete data comprehension. This is not something to detect. Nor is it a benefit of job rotation, it is a separate ideal entirely.

questions.question: Which of the following approaches to removing data remanence is the MOST effective option in cloud environments?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Cryptoshredding

Data remanence refers to information that remains after a disk, USB drive, etc. has been erased. Simply deleting a file isn’t enough, since additional information will be left behind. Some methods of securely deleting data include:

  • Cryptoshredding: Cryptoshredding, or cryptographic erasure, destroys the cryptographic keys used to protect encrypted data. This runs the risk that the encryption algorithm may be broken in the future or a backup key might be discovered. However, it is often the only available option in cloud environments.
  • Erasing: Erasing uses the built-in delete functionality on a computer to remove pointers to the data. However, the actual data remains on disk until it is overwritten by something else.
  • Clearing: Clearing overwrites data with other data. Depending on the number of passes, the storage medium, and data written, data may be retrievable using specialized technology.
  • Purging: Purging repeats the clearing process multiple times to completely remove all data. However, this isn’t always trusted and is not a method approved by the U.S. government for clearing Top Secret media.
  • Degaussing: Degaussing uses a magnetic field to wipe data from magnetic tapes and hard disk drives (HDDs). It doesn’t work on optical disks or flash storage (including USBs, SSDs, and SD cards).
  • Destruction: Destruction physically damages the media to the point that it is impossible to retrieve data from it.

questions.question: Effective incident response management is handled in several steps or phases. Which of the following is performed just after the "detection" phase after an incident has occurred?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Response

Effective incident response management is handled in several steps or phases. There are seven steps outlined in the CISSP exam outline. The steps occur in the following order:

  1. Detection
  2. Response
  3. Mitigation
  4. Reporting
  5. Recovery
  6. Remediation
  7. Lessons learned

questions.question: Of the following, which encryption method MOST LIKELY provides end-to-end encryption?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Secure Shell (SSH)

Secure Shell (SSH) provides end-to-end encryption and exchange keys using the Diffie-Hellman algorithm. The encryption is negotiated between the client and server and does not rely on lower-layer encryption methods to protect the payload.

802.1AE and Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) only provide hop-by-hop or link encryption. Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP) is a tunneling protocol that only provides authentication. Encryption can be added to L2TP through the use of Internet Protocol Security (IPSec).

questions.question: If the state of the system is a snapshot or a moment in time, the activities that alter the state are called what?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: State transition

State transition is the terminology used for activities that can alter a machine's state. State machine security models require that all actions that change the state must be authorized, and the machine's state must remain secure during transitions.

The other terms are not used in system terminology.

questions.question: If a system processes only Secret data all year long, except for one day a year on which it processes one piece of Top Secret data, which classification level should the system be marked?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Top Secret

A system is classified according to the highest level of data it processes. The frequency of data processing does not matter. So, once it processes a piece of Top Secret data, a higher level than Secret, it must be classified at that level.

Sensitive but Secret is not a normal classification level. There is a Sensitive, but unclassified option found at times. Secret/Top Secret does not work. It is either one or the other.

questions.question: An organization is looking for a way to protect its records in its relational structure. They are looking for a way to detect fraudulent activity and undesirable behavior without impacting the performance of the server. What could they use for this?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Database Activity Monitor

A Database Activity Monitor (DAM) is a security tool that continuously monitors and audits database activity to detect unauthorized access, data breaches, or suspicious activities. It provides real-time alerts, log analyses, and forensic capabilities to enhance database security and compliance.

A File Activity Monitor (FAM) is a security tool designed to track and monitor user interactions with files and data stored on a computer or network. It records file access, modification, deletion, and transfer activities to detect unauthorized or suspicious actions, prevent data leaks, and ensure compliance with security policies. File activity monitors provide real-time alerts, detailed logs, and reporting capabilities to enhance data security and protect sensitive information.

DAMs and FAMs are not in any of the listed references. Unfortunately, these books do not contain all of the topics you could encounter on the test. These two are the newest products listed here and they are in the Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) exam, so it is possible to run into them here. They are most closely related to firewalls. They initially only monitored traffic, however, they are now starting to block traffic like a firewall does.

A firewall is a network security device or software that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules. It acts as a barrier between trusted internal networks and untrusted external networks to prevent unauthorized access and potential cyber threats.

A Web Application Firewall (WAF) is a security solution designed to protect web applications from a wide range of cyber threats and attacks. It sits between the web application and the client (user) and acts as a filter to monitor, intercept, and block malicious traffic before it reaches the application server.

questions.question: Which of the following control types is also referred to as management controls?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Administrative controls

Administrative controls are sometimes referred to as management controls. They are the policies or procedures defined by an organization's security program. Administrative controls include hiring processes, background checks, data classification requirements, data labeling, security awareness, and training.

Logical and technical controls are the same thing and refer to controls that include hardware, software, code, etc. Physical controls are controls that you can touch such as fences, locks, guards, dogs, etc.

questions.question: When should a structured walk-through occur?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: While compiling the results from a live disaster test

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Before a live disaster test

It's important to have a structured walk-through before a live disaster test to adequately prepare and complete all necessary implementations. Structured walk-throughs are similar to test drills or simulations, allowing the planning team to review each step in the process. A structured walk-through is also considered a tabletop exercise. It occurs in a conference room where the team members walk through the plan to see if it appears that everything is included and makes sense before getting near live systems where damage could occur if the plans are not complete and ready.

The logical order of tests that should be performed on Disaster Recovery Plans (DRP) would be:

  • Checklist/desk check
  • Structured walk-through/tabletop exercise
  • Simulations
  • Parallel test
  • Full interruption

Live disaster tests would include both parallel and full interruption. So, performing a structured walk-through during or after (when compiling results) a live test is too late.

These tests are not performed constantly. They are very specific and carefully planned tests. So, they do not occur nonstop. There is a clear beginning, middle, and end to these tests.

questions.question: Robert is working on a security assessment for Acme Inc. He is outlining the requirements and determining the tasks he should perform. Which of the following is Robert LEAST LIKELY to complete during the security assessment?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Vulnerability mitigation

Under normal circumstances, mitigation should take place after the security assessment is finished, especially by the assessor.

Security assessments are comprehensive reviews of the security of a system, application, or other tested environments. During a security assessment, a trained information security professional performs a risk assessment that identifies vulnerabilities in the environment that may allow a compromise and makes recommendations for remediation. A threat assessment is done as part of risk management. This could be done in relationship to just about any job/task/project/software/etc that a business engages in. This is not part of the security assessment. In the threat assessment, it would be normal to document the discovered risks. In a security assessment, it is the specific threats and vulnerabilities that are found. A threat is something bad that can happen. A vulnerability is an exploitable flaw or weakness.

questions.question: Chris is a security manager for a bank. He has been asked to install a security system that will alarm if it detects a temperature change. Of the following types of intrusion detection systems, which will Chris MOST LIKELY use?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Passive infrared

A Passive Infrared (PIR) intrusion detection system detects changes in heat. If a person walks in front of a PIR system, it will detect their body heat and set off the alarm.

A wave-pattern intrusion detection system utilizes advanced algorithms to analyze and identify unique wave patterns associated with normal activities. Any deviation from these established patterns triggers alerts, enabling rapid response to potential security threats. A capacitance intrusion detection system employs sensors to measure changes in electrical capacitance caused by alterations in the surrounding environment. Any disturbance, such as an intruder's presence, disrupts the capacitance, triggering alarms for prompt security response. A photoelectric intrusion detection system employs beams of light to create an invisible barrier. When an object interrupts the beams, the system detects the disruption and triggers alarms, providing reliable security against unauthorized access or intrusion.

questions.question: Which threat modeling methodology uses Agile programming concepts?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: VAST

VAST stands for Visual, Agile, and Simple Threat. VAST uses Agile programming concepts to conduct threat modeling.

STRIDE stands for Spoofing, Tampering, Repudiation, Information disclosure, Denial of service, and Escalation of privileges. It was invented by Microsoft for software developers to focus on the possible problems that aid in systematically identifying and mitigating potential security threats in software systems. TRIKE stands for Threat Representation, Intelligence, and Knowledge Engine. It is a threat modeling framework focused on simulating cyber threats and helping organizations identify and mitigate vulnerabilities in their systems and networks. PASTA stands for Process of Attack Simulation and Threat Analysis. It allows for the identification of potential threats. This can be used for applications and IT systems.

questions.question: To whom are security assessment reports given when complete?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Management

Security assessments are generally performed at the direction of senior management. They evaluate the effectiveness of the organization's information security program. Reports should be written in non-technical language that management can understand. More technical info can be distributed by management to their teams to implement the report's recommendations.

Depending on what the assessment reports contain they may be passed along to engineers, auditors, or someone in the IT department. It is also possible the full report is not passed along, but only parts that an individual needs to take action on.

questions.question: Martina is testing a new application that her company is developing. She is trying a testing technique that posts thousands of different inputs into the software to determine its limits and potential flaws. What form of testing is this?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Fuzz testing

Fuzz testing is a technique used to find flaws or vulnerabilities by sending randomly generated or specially crafted inputs into the software. There are two types of fuzzers: mutation (dumb) fuzzers, and generational (intelligent) fuzzers. Mutation fuzzers mutate input to create fuzzed input. Generational fuzzers create fuzzed input based on what type of program is being fuzzed.

Misuse case testing is the process of testing software from the perspective of a user misusing the software or a bad actor using it maliciously. The purpose is to find a way to exploit any bad code in the software that can be exploited from running software. Static testing, or Static Application Security Testing (SAST), analyzes the software in a static, or nonrunning condition. So, what it analyzes is the software code. Dynamic testing, or Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST), analyzes the software in a dynamic or running condition. It is similar to misuse although the purpose is to test the functionality in some way, not to exploit it as misuse case testing does.

questions.question: Electromagnetic Interference (EMI) is a concern due to its ability to interact with and corrupt network communications. Which of the following is the MOST resistant to EMI?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Fiber optics

Because fiber optics uses light and no conductor, it is not susceptible to electromagnetic interference.

10Base5 and coaxial cables have a low susceptibility to EMI, but they are not completely resistant. 1000Base-T, on the other hand, is very susceptible to EMI.

questions.question: Of the following database models, which organizes one-to-many relationships between data elements in a logical tree structure?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Hierarchical model

The hierarchical model is a one-to-many data model and forms a logical tree structure. Corporate organization charts and NCAA March Madness brackets are common examples of the hierarchical model.

The relational model is incorrect because it is similar to a spreadsheet and is a one-to-one data model. In relational models, data is organized into tables. The entries/rows/records contain fields or attributes (columns). Then one record in one table can be linked to a record in another table.

The network model is not used much. The user can move too easily through the data, making it hard to control access.

A data lake is the equivalent of a data warehouse but in the big data world. Both data lakes and data warehouses are created for the specific purpose of analyzing data to gain insights into the business.

questions.question: A legal document used to protect an organization's sensitive information and signed by its employees is MOST LIKELY called what?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Nondisclosure agreement

Organizations often require a Nondisclosure Agreement (NDA) to be signed by an employee prior to giving them access to sensitive information. The nondisclosure agreement reinforces trust between the organization and the employee. The nondisclosure agreement ensures that confidential materials and ideas used by the organization are not disclosed to third parties without consent.

Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) informs users how they are allowed to use the resources that the company gives them access to. This would include computers, phones, Internet access, as well as databases and other resources.

Noncompete agreements are used by businesses to ensure that an employee does not leave their business and immediately work for a competitor or become a competitor. There are a couple of possible reasons for this. One reason is they do not want to spend their money and time training someone for their competition. A second would be they do not want their employees taking their secrets to their competitors. So, this comes close to the correct answer to this question, but nondisclosure is specifically for protecting sensitive information so it is a better answer.

Employment contracts are used to document what the employee is being hired to do, as well as the conditions of their employment.

questions.question: What BEST describes the role of a scrum master in the Agile software development methodology?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security

choices.text: Direct the development team toward their goal and work with stakeholders

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Direct the development team toward their goal and work with stakeholders

The scrum master directs the development team toward their goals, interacts with stakeholders, and ensures a clear path for the team to complete their objectives.  

When the scrum master interacts with the stakeholders and learns the customer's needs, they will communicate that to the team. The correct answer is more inclusive though. The development team designs the infrastructure and the code, while the backlogs typically identify the customer needs and what the product owner desires for their product. During a sprint, the team has a set goal to achieve as fast as possible with the production of their product. The marketing department is responsible for marketing the product to the customers.

questions.question:
A Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is interested in investing in new servers for their northeastern United States data center. The CISO finds that the cheapest servers have central processing units (CPUs) installed, which are indicated to be "end of life" (EOL) or "end of service" (EOS).

What do these terms mean, and what practice should MOST likely be followed to ensure maximum return on investment (ROI) of these servers?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: EOL is the end of production of a product; EOS is the end of vendor support. They should not be considered for future use, as these products may be open to vulnerabilities or require additional configurations.

EOL is the end of support of a product by a vendor; EOS is the end of supply by a vendor or manufacturer. They should be considered for future use, as these products may be open to vulnerabilities or require additional configurations.
EOL and EOS are synonymous. Neither are a major concern to the organization.
EOL and EOS are synonymous regarding the end of support for a product. They should be given great consideration by any organization purchasing a product.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: EOL is the end of life or the end of production of a product; EOS is the end of service or the end of vendor support. They should not be considered for future use, as these products may be open to vulnerabilities or require additional configurations.

Generally speaking, an organization would get the greatest return on investment (ROI) by purchasing new products that are supported by the vendor and are still being produced. Purchasing a product that is still mass produced means buying large quantities will not be an issue due to scarcity. Additionally, purchasing products that are past their end of life or end of service would likely require regulatory compensation measures to ensure these systems are still adequately protected.

questions.question: Maple Leaf Industries has a backup data server that has failed due to a power surge. However, the primary server still functions and was able to be quickly rebooted to meet business needs. The team is now concerned about the data and files. Sometimes, when power surges occur, data ends up corrupted. Of the following, what should be done before considering this event a loss of data integrity and immediately restoring data from the backups?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Automated integrity checking

Before this is considered a loss of integrity, automated integrity checking can determine if files have been changed. If the files have been altered, automated integrity checks can occur with the backup drives upon integrating them into production. There are local programs that can also do this. Sigverif is a Windows program that can check the integrity of files and be useful in the event that backups are not automated, to check integrity.

Integrity in this situation is not necessarily eliminated by default. At this stage, we do not know what files, if any, have been affected. Manually searching for each file to determine if a loss of data has occurred is not realistic for thousands of files. Drive size comparison could be an indication, but wouldn't be specific enough to provide adequate information.

questions.question: A business incorporates a practice in which one employee conducts a weekly audit of all business transactions, while another employee deposits the cash relating to these transactions at a local bank. This employee returns a deposit slip and stores it in a safe place for a supervisor to review later. What is the term given to this practice?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Separation of duties

Separation of duties allows for two or more people to play separate roles in the completion of a critical process. Two people serving separate functions at the same time within a holistic process can allow for auditing and accountability.

Dual control is a security principle that requires two or more individuals to work together to perform critical tasks, such as authorizing sensitive transactions or accessing high-security areas. Ensuring multiple people are involved reduces the risk of unauthorized activities, fraud, or errors, providing an extra layer of protection and accountability in security-sensitive operations.

Least privilege is a security principle that grants users or processes only the minimum level of access and permissions required to perform their specific tasks or functions. Limiting access to essential resources, applications, or data reduces the potential impact of security breaches, minimizing the risk of unauthorized access or misuse of sensitive information.

Split knowledge is a security principle where critical information or sensitive data is divided among multiple individuals or entities to prevent unauthorized access or misuse. Each entity alone does not possess complete knowledge, thereby enhancing security.

questions.question: Which of the following is a symmetric-key block cipher?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Twofish

Twofish is a symmetric-key block cipher that was a finalist in the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) contest. It has since been placed in the public domain. Twofish is related to the earlier Blowfish algorithm. Twofish operates on 128-bit blocks, employing 16 rounds with variable key lengths up to 256 bits.

Elliptical Curve Cryptosystem (ECC) is an asymmetric algorithm. Schnorr is also an asymmetric algorithm. Rivest Cipher 4 is a symmetric stream algorithm.

questions.question: Which of the following secure design principles BEST addresses the potential risks introduced by unconfigured settings?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Secure defaults

The potential risks introduced by unconfigured settings are best addressed through the secure design principle of secure defaults. This principle demands product and solution teams consider the security implications of weak "default" settings in their product or solution (e.g. passwords, algorithms, or controls) and instead utilize responsible default security settings, even if those increase the complexity of implementation or use.

Trust but verify is a secure design principle that challenges assumptions of trust derived from certain criteria without trust being explicitly verified (e.g. traffic originating from an internal network). Separation of duties is a secure design principle that demands a sensitive task be split between two or more individuals to reduce the risk of fraud, abuse, or errors. Fail securely is a secure design principle that bids developers consider the security implications of exceptions (errors) in their code and incorporate error handling routines that manage them, to preserve the security of the application (and the data accessible through it).

questions.question: Which of the following roles is accountable for determining how and why personal data is processed under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data controller

Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the data controller is the entity that determines the purposes and means of processing personal data. The data controller may carry out these functions with others, but ultimately is the entity accountable for determining why (purposes) and how (means) personal data is processed.

Data owner is a term more commonly used in internal data governance frameworks, referring to the person or entity responsible for classifying and managing data within an organization, but it is not a defined role under GDPR.

The data custodian is responsible for the technical and operational protection of data, ensuring it is securely stored and handled, but does not define how or why it is processed.

The data processor is an entity that processes data on behalf of the data controller, following its instructions, and does not have independent authority over the data, nor does it determine why the data is processed.

questions.question: Which of the following defines a cloud model that is hosted for the benefit of a single organization and is accessible only to that organization?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Private cloud

A private cloud is hosted for the benefit of a single organization and is only accessible to that organization.

Public cloud is incorrect because this model has assets that are available for rent by anyone. Community cloud is incorrect because this model provides assets to two or more organizations. Hybrid cloud is incorrect because this model is a combination of two or more cloud options (public, private, or community). With public and community clouds there are many companies that have access.

questions.question: What can Class C, electrical fires, be extinguished with?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Carbon dioxide

Fires are classified according to what material is burning. Class C fires are electrical fires. Class C fires require carbon dioxide or dry powders to extinguish them. Using water on a Class C fire can cause electrocution.

  • Class A: Common combustibles, such as wood or paper. Extinguishable with water, dry powder, or wet chemicals.
  • Class B: Liquids, such as fuels and oils. Extinguishable with CO2, foam, or dry powder.
  • Class C: Electrical, such as wiring and equipment. Extinguishable with dry powder.
  • Class D: Combustible metals, such as magnesium or sodium. Extinguishable with dry powder or CO2.
  • Class K: Commercial kitchen fires or grease fires. Extinguishable with wet chemicals.

questions.question: Josephine is examining a table that includes multiple objects and subjects. It outlines the specific access that each subject has to different objects. Which of the following BEST describes what Josephine is using?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: An access control matrix

An access control matrix is a table that contains a list of subjects, objects, and permissible actions. The columns and rows map subjects to objects. The matrix contains what permissions are assigned to each user for a specific object.

An Access Control List (ACL) is a static list of who has access to specific objects. A constrained access control system restricts the level of access that exists. For example, an ATM/cash machine that has Windows XP as its operating system, but the interface is constrained so that the customer only has access to 0-9, clear, cancel, and enter. An attribute-based access control system controls access based on attributes, which could be MAC addresses, time of day, etc.

questions.question: A user sends a request to a server that is supported by a set of interfaces that belong to different nodes. If the first available node that the request is received by responds, what type of IPv6 addressing is in use?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Anycast

An IPv6 anycast address is a unique type of address used in IPv6 networking that allows multiple devices to share the same IPv6 address. Anycast addresses are primarily used for load balancing and redundancy purposes in distributed networks. Anycast addresses in IPv6 are represented using a specific address format. They use a prefix followed by a unique identifier, similar to other IPv6 addresses. However, unlike unicast or multicast addresses, anycast addresses are assigned to multiple devices or network interfaces. The main characteristic of anycast addresses is their ability to facilitate one-to-nearest communication. This means that when a packet is sent to an anycast address, it is routed to the nearest (topologically closest) device that holds that anycast address. This routing decision is typically based on routing protocols and network topology.

A broadcast address is a special type of address used in computer networks to send data packets to all devices within a specific network segment. It allows a single sender to reach multiple recipients simultaneously without knowing their individual addresses.

A unicast address is a type of network address used to send data packets to a specific device or computer within a network. It uniquely identifies a single destination for communication within the network.

Multicast is a network communication method where data packets are sent from one source to multiple destinations simultaneously. It optimizes bandwidth usage by delivering content to a specific group of recipients who have expressed interest in receiving the data.

questions.question: An organization just experienced a minor security breach in which a workstation was infected with malware. After reviewing Security Information and Event Manager (SIEM) logs, it was determined this malware did not spread or call out to a command and control (C2) server. Management later revealed this was due to a simulation training exercise, in which the malware was due to an employee clicking a malicious link in an e-mail. What stage of the incident management process would MOST likely allow management to determine how to better prepare the workplace for the next potential incident?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Lessons learned

This simulation exercise would allow management to recognize during the lessons learned phase how to reduce their risk of such an attack in the future. In this phase, all involved parties can reflect on what occurred from beginning to end. With this knowledge after a test, they can be better prepared for the future.

The reporting phase occurs well before the lessons learned phase and typically occurs during the incident, when management and stakeholders are informed. Remediation involves fixing whatever issues led to the exploit to ensure they don't occur again. Recovery involves getting back to the state the organization was in before an incident. While each stage plays a role in the overall learning, lessons learned is the stage that truly facilitates the learning.

questions.question: Which of the following access control models is designed to make decisions using classifications and clearances?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Mandatory Access Control (MAC)

A system that employs Mandatory Access Control (MAC) uses classifications and labels to define user access. Every resource is classified with a label and users cannot access resources unless they have an equal or greater clearance level. MAC is widely used in government and military environments. MAC is often referred to as a lattice-based model because it looks like a garden lattice with well-defined boundaries when it is represented on paper.

Discretionary Access Control (DAC) allows the data owner to control and define access to objects. Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) maps a subject’s role with their needed operations and tasks. Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) makes decisions based on attributes for either the subject, object, or actions.

questions.question: According to the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model, which layer is the Transport layer?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Four

The Transport layer is the fourth layer of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model. It provides data transport and end-to-end transmission control and performs flow control. Examples of layer four protocols include Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and iSCSI (Small Computer Serial Interface over IP (Internet Protocol)).

The OSI model is numbered from the bottom up. Physical layer = 1

OSI model:

  • 7 - Application
  • 6 - Presentation
  • 5 - Session
  • 4 - Transport
  • 3 - Network
  • 2 - Data link
  • 1 - Physical

questions.question: A vulnerability scan is used for which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

choices.text: To identify points of weakness in a system

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: To identify points of weakness in a system

A vulnerability scan is used to help identify potential points of weakness in a system. It is not intended to exploit or mitigate the discovered weaknesses, only report them.

Some of the tools that are used at the beginning of a vulnerability assessment can map a network’s topology. An example tool is Nmap. However, the point of the vulnerability scan is to find the weaknesses. Mitigating weaknesses needs to be done after the vulnerability assessment is complete, which is a completely separate process. If the weaknesses are being exploited by someone with permission, it would be called a penetration test.

questions.question: Which of the following connection types is a logical circuit that always exists and can be used at any time by the customer?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Permanent Virtual Circuit (PVC)

A virtual circuit is a logical path over a packet-switched network between two routers. Once created, a PVC always exists and can be used at any time by the customer. There are two main types of virtual circuits:

  • Permanent Virtual Circuits (PVCs)
  • Switched Virtual Circuits (SVCs)

An SVC is more like a dial-up connection and requires the circuit to be dynamically built at the time of use. An SVC is used for a temporary connection. PVCs can be used for phones that when you pick them up they connect directly to one destination. SVCs are seen in a normal telephone network that connects a phone to whomever the caller wishes. Digital Subscriber Line (DSL) is a digital connection that is an upgrade from traditional cable modem connections to the home. Integrated Services Digital Network (ISDN) came before DSL as an alternative connection type to the office. ISDN is very old technology at this point.

questions.question: Liam works in a Security Operations Center (SOC) and monitors firewall connections for suspicious traffic. He notices unusual network patterns and discovers that the firewall sees data link layer unicast traffic between devices on the same Local Area Network (LAN) that are not connected to the firewall. He confirmed the firewall is connected to a switch. Of the following, what BEST explains what may cause this behavior?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Forwarding table (CAM) overflow attack

A switch references its forwarding table, also called the Content Addressable Memory (CAM) table, when sending frames out interfaces. If the switch does not know what interface the destination Media Access Control (MAC) address is connected to, it will send the frame out to all interfaces except the source interface. Once it learns the device's MAC address, it stores it in the forwarding table for future forwarding decisions.

If the forwarding table exceeds the allocated memory of the switch, it will begin to forward frames out of all interfaces. Attackers can exploit this vulnerability by creating thousands of bogus MAC addresses that overflow the forwarding table. This allows the attacker to see unicast traffic between devices on a network.

Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) poisoning attacks happen when the attacker returns the wrong information when a device sends out an ARP request. This causes traffic to be sent to the wrong device, probably the threat actor, instead of the correct destination.
