Post Office Protocol Version 3 (POP3) is an email transmission protocol. It allows client email software to access an email server and download it to the local computer.

POP3 is different from the alternative Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) because it's designed to delete the email after being retrieved. IMAP stores email on the server. POP3 should not be confused with Simple Mail Transport Protocol (SMTP), which is used to send email. POP3 is strictly meant for storing and receiving emails.

questions.question: In an effort to enhance security at Stealth Suites Security & Beats, the company has begun implementing Software Defined Networking (SDN) and Software Defined Security (SDS) wherever possible. What is NOT a reason why SDN and SDS are far superior to traditional networking and security?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security

choices.text: They are complex and difficult to manage
It is easier to implement security controls
There is a wider range of integrations

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: They are complex and difficult to manage

With Software-Defined Networking (SDN) and Software-Defined Security (SDS), configuration is nowhere near as complex or difficult as the physical methods. Configuration is much easier, being right at your fingertips on one screen.

While there is a learning curve with SDN and SDS, they are overall far easier to configure than physically setting everything up by hand and maneuvering around a residence or enterprise environment. With the convenience of everything being accessible and administrated on one screen, security implementations are also far easier to understand and recognize. Additionally, these software programs can be integrated with other programs. Everything you need can be on one computer via software, configured the way you want, and accessible wirelessly or however you would like.

questions.question: According to the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model, which layer is the presentation layer?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Six

The presentation layer is in the sixth layer of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model and is represented in descending sequence as the second layer from the top. The presentation layer transforms data into format structures that other systems can understand. ASCII and EBCDIC are two of the original languages in this layer. Examples of presentation layer formats include JPEG, MPEG, ASCII, and GIF.

Layer four is the transport layer. Layer five is the session layer. Layer seven is the application layer.

questions.question: When discussing data processors for an organization, what does the acronym GDPR stand for?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: General Data Protection Regulation

The European Union’s (EU) General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is intended to protect an individual's personal information and set specific rules for how it can be transferred and used. It's part of several government privacy laws used to protect private information gathered and stored by organizations. GDPR has strict definitions for the data subject, data controller, and data processor.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT part of the Development and Operations (DevOps) model?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Finance

Finance is not a standard component of the DevOps model.

The DevOps model has three overlapping components: software development, quality assurance, and operations. The DevOps model is closely aligned with the Agile development approach and aims to dramatically decrease the time required to develop, test, and deploy software changes.

questions.question: When referring to the Business Continuity Plan (BCP) or Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP), the Business Impact Analysis (BIA) does which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management

choices.text: Test and recommend changes to the BCP and DRP
Review the financial impact of a disaster

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Identify critical functions and calculate risk

Performing a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) is critical in developing a Business Continuity Plan (BCP). The BIA identifies all critical functions and processes so the organization can prioritize them based on criticality. The BIA also involves calculating risk for the identified business functions so that vulnerabilities are prioritized appropriately.

Mitigating risk occurs after a BIA or a risk analysis. The risk analysis must be done first before the appropriate decisions can be made on how to mitigate risk. There are four ways to mitigate risk: Risk avoidance, Risk transference, Risk reduction, and Risk acceptance. Testing the BCP or the Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP) occurs after the alternatives have been accessed, chosen, and built. Part of the BIA is to analyze the financial impact of a disaster, but that is just a piece of calculating the risk. So, this is almost the best answer here. But the answer marked correct is a more complete answer by adding in ‘identify critical functions’ and making the calculation of risk more generic so that it includes the financial calculation.

questions.question: Of the following, what quantitative risk analysis term is used to define the estimated cost an organization will experience if a threat is realized for a particular asset?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Single loss expectancy

The Single Loss Expectancy (SLE) is the monetary loss that an organization can expect if a specific threat is realized for a particular asset. The formula is SLE = AV (Asset Value) x EF (Exposure Factor). The AV is the full monetary value of the asset. The EF is the percentage of expected loss if a threat is realized.

As an example, if a building is worth $100,000, the AV = $100,000. If the EF for a fire is 50%, the EF = (.50). Using these values, the SLE would equal $50,000.

$100,000 x .50 = $50,000.

The Annualized Rate of Occurrence (ARO) is the estimate of how many times this will happen in a year. For example, if a fire is likely to happen once every two years, the ARO would be 1/2.

The Annualized Loss Expectancy (ALE) is the spreading of the SLE over the years of the ARO, or multiplied by the number of times in a year.  ALE = SLE x ARO.

So, for the fire, the ALE would be $50,000 x 1/2, which would be $25,000.

questions.question: Post Office Protocol Version 3 (POP3) is typically run on which TCP port?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 110

POP3 (Post Office Protocol Version 3) by default uses port 110 to access email communications. POP3 allows an email client to access email on a remote mail server.  Port numbers at the 4th layer of the OSI model (transport layer) are used to indicate the protocol that the TCP datagrams are carrying.

Port 25 is used by Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) which is an email relay service. Port 23 is telnet, a remote access tool that sends the user ID and password in the clear. Port 123 is Network Time Protocol (NTP) and is used to send the time to network devices.

questions.question: A Fagan inspection is a formal code review that sends code through a detailed review and testing process that includes how many steps?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Six

The following are the six steps of a Fagan inspection:

  1. Planning
  2. Overview
  3. Preparation
  4. Inspection
  5. Rework
  6. Follow-up

questions.question: What type of cipher exchanges letters of a plain text message with a different alternative letter to create ciphertext?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Substitution cipher

In substitution ciphers, each letter is replaced by an alternative letter. For instance, each A is replaced with the letter G. ROT13 is an old, popular substitution cipher that substitutes each letter with the 13th letter from the current letter's position. For each A there is an N. For each B there is an O, etc.

Transposition ciphers alter the order of the letters of the plaintext. For example, encryption of the plaintext HELLO could become the ciphertext of LLEOH (depending on the cipher and key). But all the letters from the plaintext are still there, they are just in a different order. A one-time pad is a substitution cipher that uses a key that is as long as the plaintext and properly random and only used once. They are provably unbreakable by brute force attacks. A running key cipher is a substitution cipher that uses a key as long as the plaintext.

questions.question: What is the MOST effective control at preventing piggybacking?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Double door installation

Double door installations, or mantraps, force individuals into a small room with an ingress and egress door. Before the person can exit through the egress door, the ingress door must be closed and locked. If the individual is authorized, the egress door will unlock, and they can proceed. If they are not authorized, both doors remain locked until a security guard or police officer arrives and escorts them off the property or arrests them for trespassing. It is common for mantraps to have a weight scale across the floor to ensure only one person is in the room at a time.

Identification badges, bollards, and administrative policy would be additional controls, but mantraps are considered the most effective at preventing piggybacking.

questions.question: Which of the following is generally the weakest security control when allowing access to a building?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: Two to three-meter fence with concertina wire

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A daytime guard

Personnel is generally considered the weakest link in an information security program, and this includes guards. Guards should never be considered preventive in nature as there are so many ways to distract a guard. This can be subjective, but for the purposes of the CISSP exam, controls that remove the possibility of human error are generally considered stronger. Security guards are important because they can respond to a security incident and should be used in addition to other physical security controls. A security program that only relies on guards can be manipulated, bribed, or socially engineered.

A double-door system, or mantrap, is a short area contained between two locked doors. The first door, into the contained area, and the second door should have different controls. For example, a badge to get through the first door, and a fingerprint to get through the second door into the secured area.

A retina and access card system is a multi-factor authentication system, or it could be called specifically two-factor authentication. Someone could steal the badge and try to access that secured area, but the retina scan would prevent the thief from gaining access.

A two to three-meter fence with concertina wire is difficult to cross for the average intruder. The concertina wire is usually constructed of razor wire and is atop the fence in a looped fashion.

questions.question: Using the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model, which layer is the Network layer?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 3

The Network is in the third layer of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model. The Network layer contains protocols like Internet Protocol (IP) and Internetwork Packet Exchange (IPX)

The seven layers in descending sequence are:

  • 7) Application
  • 6) Presentation
  • 5) Session
  • 4) Transport
  • 3) Network
  • 2) Data Link
  • 1) Physical

questions.question: The "try...catch" functionality is an example of:
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Exception handling

The "try...catch" functionality is an example of exception handling used in software development. It's a form of input handling in the event a user enters an unexpected input value. First, the software will "try" to execute the code. If there are no errors, that is great. If there is an error, it then ignores the rest of the "try" and executes the catch block.

Cross-site scripting involves script hidden inside the code of websites to hide a function on a webpage. It is not a form of exception handling in code.

With error handling, when there is an error, an object is generated that contains the details about it. It could then move on to "try...catch" to execute code.

Bounds checking is when a variable is entered and the software checks to see if it is within bounds. It is often used for numbers to ensure that the number received is within the expected or needed answers.

questions.question: Host Alpha sends a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) synchronize (SYN) packet to Host Beta, and Host Beta receives and responds by sending out a synchronize acknowledgment (SYN/ACK). After Host Alpha gets this, it responds with an acknowledgment (ACK). This is known as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: TCP 3-way handshake

A 3-way handshake is used to establish a Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connection. A client establishing a connection with a server initiates the connection by sending a TCP SYN packet as the first part of the handshake. In the second part of the handshake, the server replies to the client with a SYN-ACK packet, which synchronizes it. In the third part of the handshake, the client responds with an ACK packet back to the server. This handshake is considered a 3-way, not a 2-way.

TCP sockets are also known as port numbers. They are used to identify the type of traffic that is contained within the TCP packet. For example, socket or port number 80 indicates Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) traffic. The sliding window is the number of packets that can be sent before an acknowledgment must be sent back. If any packets are missing within that window they can be retransmitted.

questions.question: The Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) Act primarily applies to what type of organization?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Publicly held

The Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) Act primarily applies to publicly held organizations and is enforced by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). SOX holds executives accountable if they are found to submit fraudulent accounting findings to the SEC. SOX is based on the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations (COSO) framework. A publicly held company is traded on the stock exchange.

Portions of SOX do apply to privately held and non-profit companies. Since the question says ‘primarily,’ that results in publicly held as the answer to this question. SOX does not apply to government departments or agencies.

questions.question: A local business is becoming more aware of a rise in cybersecurity events and breaches. Even though they believe all necessary data is encrypted, what is another practice the business can implement to both reduce the risk of customers' sensitive information being leaked and also reduce the business' liability?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: Limit the data that is collected by the business
Limit data use in accordance with the Service Level Agreement (SLA)
Erase hard drives and have involved employees sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) at the first sign of a breach

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Limit the data that is collected by the business

Data collection limitation focuses on collecting only the necessary customer data needed by the business. This practice limits the liability of the business in the event of a breach or mishandling of data. It also means less customer information would be breached in case of an event. The business can delete unnecessary data and start collecting only the bare minimum that it needs from now on. 

Relocating may allow the business to skirt regulations and enforcement of laws, but it would not reduce the risk of sensitive information being leaked. This would be neither a cost-effective solution nor ethical, and would likely damage the business' reputation.

Limiting data use according to the Service Level Agreement (SLA) is good practice, but it doesn't protect against a breach or the results. Erasing hard drives is not the most secure way to remove data from a drive and, with proper forensic programs, it can be easily retrieved. Data forensics would also allow breached data to be traced back to a point of origin via metadata or other means.

Additionally, erasing hard drives in combination with having employees sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) is unethical and likely to be revealed at some point in the company's history.

questions.question: Quade has been analyzing packets traversing a router in their data center. When data is at this point, what is it called?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data in transit

Data in transit is the term for data moving across a network. At this stage, Transport Layer Security (TLS), formerly Secure Socket Layer (SSL), plays a role in encrypting this traffic.

Data in use refers to data actively being used by a program or application. This data can be found in RAM or CPU caches. 

Data movement and data in transference are not common terms.

questions.question: Prior to the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the European Union (EU) adopted a requirement intended to protect personal data, but it was ultimately replaced by GDPR. Which ruleset does this describe?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data Protection Directive (DPD)

The Data Protection Directive (DPD) was not directly enforceable, forcing every European state to create its own laws about data privacy. This ultimately led to the United States creating its Safe Harbor Privacy Principles to comply with this European directive. Safe Harbor and its replacement of EU-US Privacy Shield are both defunct. The US failed to protect the privacy data of Europeans as promised in those two regulations.

After the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) was created, other countries followed suit with similar regulations. Brazil created its General Personal Data Protection Law (LGPD) and Thailand created the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA).

The OECD.org web page states that the OECD is "An international organisation that works to build better policies for better lives. Our goal is to shape policies that foster prosperity, equality, opportunity, and well-being for all. We draw on 60 years of experience and insights to better prepare the world of tomorrow."

questions.question: When Process A is prevented from writing to Process B, this is called what?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Process isolation

Process isolation is a combination of hardware and software to protect each process from the other processes on an operating system. Process isolation ensures that any activity in memory affects only the isolated process.

The other three terms are not correct. There is a least privilege but not a least process. There is a separation of duties, but not a separation of privileges or separation of processes.

questions.question: Which of the following is specific to legally securing protection for inventions?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Patents

Patents legally secure protection for inventions. Patents must be unique ideas that provide useful processes to complete a task. Third parties can purchase patents and have them transferred to the new owner. The patent holder can also collect royalties from an organization using its ideas.

A trademark is a legally registered symbol, name, logo, or distinctive sign that represents a business, product, or service. It distinguishes them from others in the market and protects against unauthorized use, ensuring brand recognition, reputation, and consumer trust. A trade secret is confidential information that provides a business advantage. It can be a formula, process, design, or any proprietary data not publicly disclosed. Protecting trade secrets is vital, often through contracts, security measures, or legal action against unauthorized use or disclosure. Copyright is a legal protection for creative works like literature, music, and art. It grants the creator exclusive rights to reproduce, distribute, and display their work. Others must seek permission for usage, thereby promoting creativity and protecting intellectual property.

questions.question: Of the following, which BEST describes Data Loss Prevention (DLP)?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: An automated mechanism that prevents the disclosure of sensitive information
Another term for Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID)
A type of anti-malware that sandboxes every transition state of the system

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: An automated mechanism that prevents the disclosure of sensitive information

A Data Loss Prevention (DLP) system monitors for and prevents potential disclosures of sensitive information. For example, if Social Security numbers are detected in a document, the DLP system may prevent them from being emailed or printed.

Another term for Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) is a distinct technology from DLP. RAID provides protection of the stored data through a few different techniques such as mirroring and parity. In the cloud, there are technologies that emulate RAID capability. There are two terms that apply and they are erasure coding and data dispersion. The former is similar to RAID 5 and the latter to RAID 0. There may be many names for specific backup systems, but DLP is not one of them. Anti-malware usually does not sandbox a state, it would sandbox a file or program. Either way, DLP is not a term used in relation to anti-malware.

questions.question: Which of the following scan types completes the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) three-way handshake as an attack?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: TCP connect scanning

Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) connect scanning opens a full connection, meaning that the scanner replies with an ACK to complete the TCP three-way handshake. This type of scan is usually selected when the user does not have privileges to run half-open scans.

TCP SYN scanning is incorrect because it runs half-open by sending packets with only the SYN flag set. TCP ACK scanning is incorrect because it runs half-open by sending packets with only the ACK flag set. TCP remote scanning is a fabricated term.

questions.question: Which of the following protocols is used to pull email messages from an email server to an email client's inbox?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Post Office Protocol 3 (POP3)

Post Office Protocol 3 (POP3) is used to pull email messages from an email server to an email client's inbox. With POP3, the email is generally deleted from the server after it's downloaded to the local inbox.

Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is incorrect because it is primarily used to transfer emails between servers. File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is incorrect because it is used specifically for file transfer, to move a file to a server or from a server. Telnet is incorrect because it is used for remote logins and should not be used today because it sends all data in the clear (including the password).

questions.question: In cryptography, what is the mathematical function that determines the cryptographic operation called?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: The algorithm

The algorithm is the mathematical function that determines the cryptographic operations of the encryption and decryption processes. Cryptographic algorithms rely on keys to maintain confidentiality.

A cryptosystem includes both the key and the algorithm. The key is also known as a cryptovariable. One of the difficult parts of learning cryptography is that there are many names for the same things. The algorithm is the mathematical function that takes the plaintext and turns it into ciphertext with the aid of the key. That key allows the ciphertext to be sent back through the algorithm and returned to plaintext. The algorithm should be a well-known and well-tested algorithm, where the key must be kept a secret.

questions.question: An organization has hard drives and servers storing customer data. The organization wants to ensure data is deleted as soon as possible once customers no longer use their services. Unsure of when it would be acceptable to delete such data, what should the organization do as a best business practice?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: Hold the data for as long as possible in the event it is needed in the future
Delete the data upon customers exiting the service

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Reference user agreements and government regulations

The organization should reference its user agreement documents along with government regulations. For example, they may want to delete data when it is no longer needed. This would allow them to follow the European Union (EU) General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Article 5, which states that data is to be retained only for the amount of time it is required. Additionally, this would allow the organization to avoid legal issues in the future if the data they stored was involved in a crime, but the data is no longer stored with them. By having this data still in storage, the organization may have to oblige court orders to provide copies of all data, which could be burdensome to the company. Deleting data when it is no longer needed also frees up resources, lessening costs over time for any organization.

Holding the data for as long as possible may consume resources and allow for greater involvement in potential legal issues. Deleting the data upon customers exiting the service may be a viable option, but it is dependent upon regulations and agreements between the organization and the customer. Depending on agreements between the customer and the organization, it may also be in the best interest of the organization to save that data for analytics or to sell to third parties if possible. Information can be found in the contracts with the customer as well as in the organization’s policies.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a biometric authentication factor?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) implant

While a Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) implant is embedded under the skin, it is still considered a type 2 authentication factor since it is not a physical characteristic of your body or behavior. It is still "something you have."

Retina scans look for patterns of blood vessels in the back of the eye. Hand geometry is the recognition of the physical dimensions of the hand. Signature dynamics is the study of the act of someone's writing. These are all examples of type 3 authentication factors and qualify as biometric.

questions.question: Which of the following models focuses primarily on the principle that software quality is directly associated with the quality of its underlying development processes, without mandating a specific approach?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Software capability maturity model

The Software Capability Maturity Model (SCMM) is based on the principle that a mature software development process will produce quality software.

The waterfall model reflects a specific linear, structured, and somewhat rigid approach to software development, while the agile model abandons this rigid development structure for an incremental, iterative approach that quickly meets customer or business needs. The Privacy Maturity Model (PMM) is a tool used to determine a company's level of ability to protect personal information. It comes from the American Institute for Certified Public Accountants (AICPA).

questions.question: Which type of security control is used when the preferred security control is too expensive to implement?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Compensating

Compensating controls are used to provide alternatives to aid in security enforcement. They are used in addition to main security controls and are frequently used to reduce risk to an acceptable level when the preferred control is too expensive or restrictive for business operations.

Corrective controls take a non-functional condition to functional. If the control returns the condition to normal, it would be a recovery control. A disaster recovery hot site would be a corrective control and returning to the home location could be a recovery control. A deterrent control is something that dissuades behavior. A guard at the door or knowledge that violating policy could result in being fired are both something that could dissuade bad behavior. Administrative controls, also known as managerial, are often displayable on paper, such as policies, procedures, background checks, laws, etc.

questions.question: Which pair of terms correctly identifies the two basic components of Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Certificate authority and registration authority

Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) uses a central authority to store encryption keys or certificates in order to establish the identity or digital signature of a user. PKI systems use Certificate Authorities (CAs) and Registration Authorities (RAs). A Certificate Authority (CA) is a trusted party that validates or signs the certificate of the user. Other parties trust this signed certificate because they trust the certificate authority. A Registration Authority (RA) acts as the broker between a user requesting a new certificate and the CA. The RA verifies the identity of the user before the CA generates and signs the certificate.

Classification and authorization are two terms critical in information security. Classifying data and systems helps the corporation understand how sensitive something is and how it needs to be protected. Authorization is the process of granting permissions to a user. Neither are part of PKI. Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) issues tokens in the process of authenticating users. This is a Single Sign On (SSO) technology commonly used today. This is not part of PKI. Kerberos issues tickets in the process of authenticating users. This is an SSO technology that has been used in corporations for the past several decades. This is not part of PKI.

questions.question: When file encryption is strong, it is said to have increased which level?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: The work factor

When file encryption is strong, it is said to have increased the work factor level. Work factor refers to the difficulty of breaking an encrypted file. Therefore, it takes significantly more time to hack or break.

Substitution and transposition are two different types of encryption techniques. They are both used together in block ciphers today. Substitution is the method of altering plaintext by replacing a value with a different value. A simple example is the Caesar cipher. If you assign a number to each letter of the alphabet (a=1, b=2, c=3 and so on) and then add a value (such as 3) to a letter in the plaintext, (for example the first word in the question “when” where w=23) So w=23 + 3 = 26. The 26th letter of the alphabet is Z. So Z would be the ciphertext value.

Transposition is the process of altering the order of the plaintext in order to encrypt it. If the plaintext is again ‘when’ the ciphertext could be ‘hwne’. All of the letters are still there, they are just in a different order now. Today’s block cipher does a combination of both substitution and transposition.

Claude Shannon, at Belcore, wrote a paper in 1945 explaining that confusion and diffusion are two critical concepts in cryptography today. Diffusion speaks to the relationship between the plaintext and the ciphertext. Basically, what is wanted is to ensure that patterns in the plaintext do not appear in the ciphertext.

questions.question: Which of the following strategies uses multiple layers or levels of access control to provide multi-tiered security?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Defense in depth

A defense in depth strategy uses multiple layers or levels of access control to provide layered security. An asset can be effectively secured through various layers that an attacker would need to overcome to compromise the protected asset. An organization could use a combination of physical, logical, and technical controls and administrative access controls to create layers of protection.

Least privilege is the idea and process of granting the lowest level of access possible. Need to know is the concept that information assets should only be made accessible if there is a business need for that access. Security policies define and communicate management's goals and objectives regarding specific topics.

questions.question: Of the following alarms, which would be considered the MOST critical for a Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP) to ensure function properly?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Fire alarms

Fire alarms provide an audible sound if a fire is detected. Human safety is always considered the highest priority.

Intrusion alarms are incorrect because they do not ensure human safety as much as fire alarms do. Heartbeat alarms are incorrect because they monitor servers or security systems and do not impact human safety. Component failure alarms are incorrect because they monitor a server's components like a power supply and do not impact human safety.

questions.question: Which of the following would MOST LIKELY be suitable to assist in preparing for a security audit?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: Reviewing Security Information and Event Manager output

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Breach and Attack Simulation

A Breach and Attack Simulation (BAS) would assist in preparing for a security audit. This system would simulate an attack, exploiting and highlighting vulnerabilities to be remediated prior to an official audit.

Asking other companies about their experiences wouldn't be as advantageous, as their audits are likely to be graded on the same guidelines and standards. Reviewing Security Information and Event Manager (SIEM) output would identify potentially malicious traffic, but would not simulate attacks and put give the perspective of an attacker. It would simply tell what people were doing in our network at that given time. Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) would only evaluate software. It wouldn't take into consideration open ports or insecure practices, and the suggested remediation would be mostly software-based. This is only a small portion of the overall security in an organization.

questions.question: Which networking method is used to map internal Internet Protocol (IP) addresses to external IP addresses?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Network Address Translation (NAT)

Network Address Translation (NAT) is a method of remapping one IP address space into another by modifying the network address information in the IP header of packets while they are in transit across a router. NAT operates at the network layer of the Open System Interconnection (OSI) model.

Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) maps the IP address to the hardware-based Media Access Control (MAC) address. This occurs when the IP protocol is sent over Ethernet.

Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is a protocol used to assign an IP address, dynamically, to devices as they are connected to a network. The connection could be physical or wireless.

Internet Protocol Message Protocol (ICMP) is a protocol used by network administrators. ICMP is used to PING devices to determine if they are connected and responsive. If they do not respond it is possible to then use traceroute to determine how far the communication can pass through the network. This allows the troubleshooting to begin at a certain point.

questions.question: Certain characters within website form inputs (e.g. ') are being converted into their HTML character entity reference equivalents (e.g. &apos), prior to processing. What web application security technique is being applied?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Output encoding

The conversion of certain characters within website form inputs (e.g. ') into their HTML character entity reference equivalents (e.g. &apos) prior to processing is an example of output encoding. Output encoding is an application security technique used to ensure that certain characters within form inputs are processed as data and not potentially misinterpreted as programming syntax (which could be used to inject malicious code, if processed).

Input validation is an application security technique used to ensure that actual input is aligned with the input expected for a particular field before it is processed. Such validation does not just consider field type (e.g. where a date field follows the structure and format of a date mm-dd-yyyy) but also field data (e.g. the lack of strings such as "1=1" and "<SCRIPT>", which could be used to inject malicious code, if processed). 

Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) is a cyber threat that injects malicious scripts into web apps. This attack manipulates user input, compromising data and spreading attacks. It is prevented by input sanitization, output encoding, and security measures.

Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) is a cyber attack that tricks users into unintended actions, exploiting their authenticated sessions. This attack is mitigated by tokens, referrer validation, and secure authentication mechanisms.

questions.question: After patching, many corporate systems crash due to issues with the patch. This MOST likely indicates a failure during which stage of the patch management process?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Test Patches

Patches are updates designed to fix vulnerabilities. Some of the key steps in a patch management program include:

  • Evaluate Patches: Determine whether the organization needs to deploy the patch
  • Test Patches: Test patches on a non-production system to ensure that they do their job and don’t create other issues
  • Approve Patches: Approve tested patches for deployment in production, potentially via a change management process
  • Deploy Patches: Deploy patches to production systems, potentially using automation
  • Verify Patch Deployment: Test patches to ensure that they were applied correctly and fix the vulnerability

questions.question: Where would a Metropolitan Area Network (MAN) MOST LIKELY be used?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Between locations within the same city

A Metropolitan Area Network (MAN) is generally used to connect locations within the same metropolitan area.

A Local Area Network (LAN) is used to connect devices within a small geographical area, such as a single building or a campus with adjacent buildings. A Wide Area Network (WAN) is used to connect devices across large geographical areas. The Internet is an example of a WAN.

questions.question: An employee is following a step-by-step guide that details how they should achieve some security goal. Which of the following are they likely using?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Procedure

Procedures are step-by-step descriptions of how a member of an organization should achieve a security goal.

A security policy is a high-level description of an organization's security requirements.

Standards define required activities that are designed to help an organization fulfill its policy goals.

Guidelines provide recommendations about how to do something if no specific standard exists.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes a covert channel?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering

choices.text: A way to send or receive information in an unauthorized manner
Part of a business continuity plan that allows executives to securely communicate during emergencies
The communication channel between an attacker and malware running on the victim's computer

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: A way to send or receive information in an unauthorized manner

A covert channel is generally hidden from access control mechanisms and is unknown to the system owner. It is an unintended communication path between two or more subjects sharing a resource. There are two types of covert channels, covert timing channels, and covert storage channels. Covert storage channels work by writing data to storage, allowing unauthorized subjects to read it. Covert timing channels work by encoding messages by utilizing or predictably altering the performance of system resources. A timing channel could also allow a bad actor to leak information to someone by the time that something occurs.

A covert channel is not a wireless radio channel. The name uses channel as an indication that there is information flowing to somewhere, not because it is a radio channel. A covert channel is not a way to securely communicate with other executives. It is a way for a bad actor to send information somewhere, or it could be an accidental sharing of information. The communication channel between the attacker and the malware running can be called the Command and Control (CnC) channel.

questions.question: What type of password attack uses pre-computed hash values instead of computing them during the attack?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Rainbow table

A rainbow table is usually a large file with a list of pre-computed hashes and corresponding passwords. This reduces the time needed to crack a password since the attacker searches for a hash instead of generating passwords and hashes.

Pretexting is a social engineering technique. Brute-force attacks try every possible password for a given character set and generate the hash values during the attack, requiring a lot of Central Processing Unit (CPU) or Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) power. Dictionary attacks try all the words in the dictionary and generate the hash values during the attack.

questions.question: The individual who controls a botnet is sometimes referred to as what?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Bot herder

A botnet is made up of thousands (sometimes millions) of computers that give the attacker (the bot herder) the ability to control them. A computer that is part of a botnet is called a zombie or bot. Data transmissions between the bot herder and the individual zombies are called Command-and-Control (C&C) traffic. Botnets can be used in Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks or brute-force attacks.

A zombie is an alternate name for a bot. Master node and arbiter do not apply here.

questions.question: When discussing cryptography, what BEST introduces Diffusion?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Transposition

In cryptography, Diffusion is introduced using Transposition. Diffusion means that if a single change in the plaintext occurs, multiple ciphertext changes will also occur. Transposition is the rearrangement of data, literally to alter the order of the existing values rather than use substitution. For example, if the value of the plaintext is ‘hello’ the ciphertext could be ‘elhlo’. All of the letters are still there, they are simply in the wrong order because they have been transposed.

Substitution is to replace the value. For example, the basic Ceasar cipher substitutes values in the plaintext by adding three or shifting down three letters in the alphabet. So, if the plaintext is again ‘hello’ the ciphertext would be ‘khoor’ if the value is shifted three letters over in the English alphabet. This does not introduce diffusion.

Exclusive OR (XOR) is a simple comparison of values. For example, if the two values are ‘0’ and ‘1’, it would be stated that they are different values. As opposed to comparing a ‘0’ and a ‘0’. Those two values are the same. In binary, the same is represented with a ‘0’ and different is represented with a ‘1’.  This does not introduce diffusion.

A NOT gate, also called an inverter, will take input and output the opposite. For example, if the input says close the door, the output would be the opposite and the door would be opened.

questions.question: Which of the following is a comprehensive evaluation of an organization's security that might be performed by an internal or external tester?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Security assessment

Security assessments involve a trained professional performing a comprehensive review of the environment under test. It is a more thorough assessment of the security of the threat environment than a security test.

Security tests validate that a security control is doing its job. They range from fully-automated scans to manual penetration testing.

Security audits are performed by accredited, third-party auditors. They are designed to prove to regulators or customers that the organization’s security controls meet the requirements of a particular regulation or standard.

Security exercise is not a type of security test.

questions.question: Which type of storage includes hard drives, flash drives, and CDs/DVDs?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Secondary storage

Secondary storage is inexpensive and nonvolatile and includes items such as hard drives, flash drives, and CDs/DVDs.

Primary memory and random access storage are incorrect because these types of storage are volatile (e.g. RAM). Volatile storage is incorrect because CDs and DVDs are nonvolatile.

questions.question: What is a mantrap?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Holding area

Mantraps, also known as double door systems, force individuals into a small room with an ingress and egress door. Before the person can exit through the egress door, the ingress door must be closed and locked. If the individual is authorized, the egress door will unlock, and they can proceed. If they are not authorized, both doors remain locked until a security guard or police officer arrives and escorts them off the property or arrests them for trespassing. It is common for mantraps to have a weight scale across the floor to ensure only one person is in the room.

A mantrap is not an attack or malware of any kind, it is a physical security control. There may be a slang term for entrapment, but mantrap is not it.

questions.question:
Which of the following development models has 12 principles stated in its manifesto, such as the following?

  • Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software.
  • Working software is the primary measure of progress.
  • Simplicity—the art of maximizing the amount of work not done—is essential.
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Agile

The Agile Manifesto is a document created in 2001 that defines the core philosophy of the Agile development model.

The 12 principles are:

  1. Our highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software.
  2. Welcome changing requirements, even late in development. Agile processes harness change for the customer’s competitive advantage.
  3. Deliver working software frequently, from a couple of weeks to a couple of months, with a preference to the shorter timescale.
  4. Business people and developers must work together daily throughout the project.
  5. Build projects around motivated individuals. Give them the environment and support they need, and trust them to get the job done.
  6. The most efficient and effective method of conveying information to and within a development team is face-to-face conversation.
  7. Working software is the primary measure of progress.
  8. Agile processes promote sustainable development. The sponsors, developers, and users should be able to maintain a constant pace indefinitely.
  9. Continuous attention to technical excellence and good design enhances agility.
  10. Simplicity—the art of maximizing the amount of work not done—is essential.
  11. The best architectures, requirements, and designs emerge from self-organizing teams.
  12. At regular intervals, the team reflects on how to become more effective, then tunes and adjusts its behavior accordingly.

Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) has five levels that represent the maturity level of a corporation's software development. The International Data Encryption Algorithm (IDEA) is a symmetric block encryption algorithm. DevOps is a combination of two departments: software development (Dev) and Information Technology (IT) operations (Ops).

questions.question: Which of the following types of network segmentation is MOST commonly implemented using a VLAN or VPN?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Logical segmentation

Logical segmentation uses VLANs, VPNs, and other devices to logically divide traffic into isolated networks that are on the same physical network.

Physical segmentation uses physically separated network components. The three types include:

  • Air-gapped: Two networks are physically disconnected from one another, providing the strongest level of segmentation.
  • In-band: This sends both data and control traffic over the same network segment but doesn't actually use physical segmentation.
  • Out-of-band: Data and control traffic are separated onto different paths, and some traffic may have its own, isolated path.

Microsegmentation divides the network into tiny segments (as small as a single device) to achieve extremely granular control over network traffic. Microsegmentation is essential for a zero-trust security model.

questions.question: A Business Continuity Plan (BCP) can help prepare an organization in the event of all EXCEPT which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Failure of Chief Executive Officer’s (CEO) laptop

A Business Continuity Plan (BCP) helps to prepare an organization for various disruptions of critical business processes. While the failure of the Chief Executive Officer’s (CEO) laptop might seem like a critical business process at the time, it does not require a BCP.

Long-term power outages, earthquakes, and tsunamis would be significant disruptions to the business, including critical business processes.

questions.question: Using the Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) model, which layer is the Application layer?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Four

The Application layer is the fourth layer and is represented in descending sequence as the topmost layer. The four layers are Application, Transport or Host-to-Host, Internet, and Network Access or Link. They correspond to layers within the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model.

Layer 3 is incorrect because it provides transport, layer 2 is incorrect because it provides internet access, and layer 1 is incorrect because it provides network access.

questions.question: Zac has been hired by a corporation as their new head of information security. The company has just formed this department after having discovered a potentially serious breach. Zac has begun his assessment of the companies' practices and has found that modifications to the Information Technology (IT) environment are not being properly controlled. Which management control is MOST LIKELY to reduce the risks associated with modifications to the environment?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Change management

Change management is a structured and systematic approach used to manage the process of introducing modifications, updates, or alterations to an organization's systems, processes, technology, or infrastructure. The primary goal of change management is to minimize disruption, reduce risks, and ensure that changes are implemented smoothly and effectively while maximizing benefits and minimizing adverse impacts.

Vulnerability management is a systematic approach to identifying, evaluating, and mitigating security vulnerabilities in computer systems, networks, applications, and other digital assets. The primary objective of vulnerability management is to proactively reduce the risk of potential security breaches and data compromises by addressing weaknesses in an organization's IT infrastructure before they can be exploited by malicious actors. Patch management is the process of identifying, acquiring, testing, and deploying software updates or patches to address vulnerabilities, bugs, or other issues in computer systems, applications, and other software. Patches are released by software vendors and developers to fix security flaws, improve performance, and enhance functionality. Asset management, in the context of Information Technology (IT), refers to the systematic process of identifying, tracking, and maintaining an organization's hardware, software, and other technology-related assets. The goal of asset management is to ensure that all IT assets are properly documented, accounted for, and utilized efficiently throughout their lifecycle.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a status that Network Mapper (Nmap) will output after a scan is completed?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Full

"Full" is not a status that is output by a Network Mapper (Nmap) scan. The following are the outputs of an Nmap scan:

  • Open: Port is open and accepting connections
  • Closed: Port is accessible but not accepting connections
  • Filtered: Unable to determine if the port is open or closed due to a firewall

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes an incremental backup?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations

choices.text: Captures changes since the last full or incremental backup
Captures a complete copy of all data
Captures changes since the last full backup

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Captures changes since the last full or incremental backup

An incremental backup captures all the changes since the last backup of any kind: full or incremental backup. So, if the routine is to perform a full backup on Saturday and incremental each of the other days of the week, the backup performed on Thursday, for example, would only backup new or changed material that was created since the backup on Wednesday.

A full backup captures a complete copy of all data. A differential backup captures changes since the last full backup. So, for the same scenario as above, on Thursday what would be backed up is all data created or changed since the full backup was performed back on Saturday. There is no method that focuses on when the last differential backup was created.

questions.question: The TCP/IP model consists of how many layers?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Four

The Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) model consists of four layers. The four layers are Application, Transport or Host-to-Host, Internet, and Network Access. They correspond to layers within the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model. Sometimes the TCP/IP model is shown as a five-layer model, as shown below. The TCP/IP was invented long ago, before the OSI model and therefore the names used for the layers are terms that we do not use today, so we have adopted a couple of different representations of the TCP/IP model.

The layers of the TCP/IP model are:

  • Application
  • Host-to-Host (or transport)
  • Internet (or Internetwork, Internetworking or Network)
  • Link (or combine this with physical and call it network access)
  • Physical

The seven layers of the OSI model are:

  • Application
  • Presentation
  • Session
  • Transport
  • Network
  • Data Link
  • Physical

Sometimes the physical and the link layers are considered one and called network access. The host-to-host layer equates to the transport layer of the OSI model and is sometimes called the transport layer. The top three layers of the OSI model are represented in the TCP/IP model as the application layer. There is often confusion in conversations due to this.

questions.question: Which issue would MOST likely be associated with a Central Processing Unit (CPU) that was at its End of Life (EOL)?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: Immediate end of patching and security support

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Reduction of replacement parts

A Central Processing Unit (CPU) that is at its End of Life (EOL) will immediately experience a reduction of replacement parts since there are no more of the CPUs being produced. This means a company can no longer immediately be promised a replacement by a manufacturer and will therefore have to rely on used parts and/or those still in stock by retailers. As time goes on, this supply will also decrease.

Customer support would still exist upon an asset entering EOL, as the CPU in this example is still within its service lifetime or End of Service Lifetime (EOSL) since EOL comes before EOSL. With that said, patching and security support will still exist. However, this does not necessarily mean there will be an immediate increase in vulnerabilities or that a rise in vulnerabilities will ever occur.

questions.question: Ultimately, who is accountable for the security of a company or organization?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Senior management

Senior management is ultimately responsible for establishing and enforcing security policies. The security policies and standards are usually developed by a committee that involves managers from each department.

It is the word accountable that identifies senior management as opposed to the information security officer or functional management. The IT department may implement a lot of the security controls but they would be responsible for that, not accountable. Accountability cannot be delegated, where responsibility can be.

questions.question: Which of the following deals with protecting data from unauthorized alteration?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Integrity

Organizations are responsible for maintaining the reliability of data by ensuring that only authorized users can modify it. Integrity is the protection of data from modification by any party without proper authorization.

Privacy and confidentiality refer to keeping data away from unauthorized eyes but don't specifically protect the data from alteration. Nonrepudiation is preventing the denial of truth or validity of something and is irrelevant to this question.

questions.question: When building a main or intermediate distribution frame, what is MOST LIKELY the biggest security threat to consider?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Unauthorized access

Main or intermediate distribution frames or wiring closets are the central storage areas for hardware, including routers, switches, cables, patch panels, and (sometimes) computer equipment. Main or intermediate distribution frames should be secured using physical security such as locks, swipe card access on the doors, and video surveillance. Just one snipped cable can cause severe network outages.

The unauthorized access could be gained through social engineering, or social engineering might be used to explain their presence. However, it is the unauthorized access that is the bigger problem because there are other ways to gain access.

Phishing is when an email is sent that tries to get a user to click on a bad link that takes them to a hacker's website, downloads malware, etc. A natural disaster could definitely cause problems for the building, the IT equipment, and all associated rooms, but it is, hopefully, not that likely.

questions.question: In the Biba model, the star (*) integrity property refers to which permission?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Write

The Biba model has two main rules:

  • Simple integrity property states that a subject cannot read an object at a lower integrity level, but can read an object at a higher integrity level. Known as [no read down] or [read up].
  • Star (*) integrity property states that a subject cannot write to an object at a higher integrity level, but can write to an object at a lower integrity level. Known as [no write up] or [write down].

The Biba model does not include a property for view or check.

questions.question: A process is a program loaded in memory. What BEST describes what a thread is?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: An individual instruction set

A thread is an individual instruction set that must be worked on by the CPU. Threads can execute in parallel with other threads that are part of the same parent process. This is known as multithreading. Threads are dynamically built and destroyed by the parent process. A process is a program loaded in memory.

Computers use ones and zeros to represent data, operating systems, programs, and everything else. Eight ones and zeros are used to represent a single character, such as the letter ‘A.’

The path that a process follows could relate to the sequence of steps or operations that a process follows during its execution. In software, this might be represented by a series of function calls, method invocations, or state transitions.

The implementation string of a process is not a term commonly used.

questions.question: While testing new software at Maple Leaf Industries, a software engineer is conducting synthetic transactions before allowing its usage in the workplace. What BEST describes the purpose of these synthetic transactions?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: To ensure there are no errors with the expected output
To ensure software completes the expected tasks
To provide the new software with additional packages to ensure functionality if needed

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: To ensure there are no errors with the expected output

Synthetic transactions ensure that whatever text is expected comes out when requested. This is excellent practice for testing code and validating input, especially against potential attacks. It goes beyond simply ensuring expected tasks are completed and increasing productivity, and does not provide software with additional packages. The main premise behind synthetic transactions is to put code in and determine what the output is. Any other benefit is additional, but should not be the focus of this practice.

Ensuring software completes the expected tasks is close, but the test should ensure that there are no errors in the completion of the task. So, the correct answer is more specific. Improving workplace productivity is a completely different topic. Synthetic transactions are about testing the software. Improving productivity could involve changing software or fixing software, but it could also be about processes that people follow, or changing management that improves productivity. Providing new software with additional packages is not a test, synthetic transactions are.

questions.question: James is an information security professional who strives to perform his job at the best level possible. Which ISC2 code of ethics cannon does this support?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management

choices.text: Provide diligent and competent service to principals.
Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure.
Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Provide diligent and competent service to principals.

There are four cannons in the ISC2 code of ethics. Providing diligent and competent service to principals is the third cannon. Principals here refer to the bosses that James was hired by.

The four cannons in order are:

  1. Protect society, the common good, necessary public trust and confidence, and the infrastructure.
  2. Act honorably, honestly, justly, responsibly, and legally.
  3. Provide diligent and competent service to principals.
  4. Advance and protect the profession.

questions.question: The Clark-Wilson model primarily deals with which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Integrity

The Clark-Wilson model focuses on data integrity and it relies on the separation of duties. Subjects access and modify objects indirectly through an interface or program. This is known as the "access triple" and is made up of the subject/program/object. The Clark-Wilson model defines Constrained Data Items (CDI) and integrity verification procedures and confirms transformation procedures.

The models address either integrity (Biba, Clare & Wilson), confidentiality (Bell-Lapadula), or both (Sutherland). They do not address authentication. That is the process of verifying who someone or something is. Availability is addressed through redundancy, backups, fault tolerance, and so on.

questions.question: An organization might use passwords to implement which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Authentication

The AAA model of access control includes:

  • Authentication: Verifying the identity of a user, device, application, etc. Passwords are one option for this.
  • Authorization: Validating that an entity has the right to make a particular request.
  • Accounting: Maintaining an audit trail of activities performed by users.

Identification is when a user claims a particular identity, kicking off the process of authentication and authorization. Usernames identify; passwords authenticate.

questions.question: In Kerberos, what provides proof that a subject has already authenticated through a Key Distribution Center (KDC) and is authorized to request service tickets?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Ticket-granting ticket

A Ticket-Granting Ticket (TGT) provides proof that a subject has already authenticated through a Key Distribution Center (KDC) and is authorized to request service tickets. A TGT is encrypted and can only be decrypted by the KDC. Subjects present the TGT to the KDC when requesting service tickets that provide access to other network resources.

The TGT is sent to the subject once the Kerberos Authentication Server (AS) confirms the user's claimed identity through the identification and authentication process (e.g. user identification and then a password sent to the AS).

Session keys are used to encrypt the user's session while they interact with a server. This would only protect the user's session from prying eyes, it cannot be used by the KDC to prove that they have been authenticated.

Kerberos only uses symmetric cryptography. The symmetric keys can be considered private keys, although that is confusing when one of the two keys used in asymmetric is also known as a private key. Either way, a private key cannot be used to prove authentication.

questions.question: The process of identifying, understanding, and categorizing potential threats is known as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Threat modeling

To ensure the highest level of security, organizations must identify possible threats to the organization's systems. This is done through threat modeling. Threat modeling refers to the process of identifying, understanding, and categorizing potential threats. The goal of threat modeling is to identify a potential list of threats and analyze those threats.

Table-top exercises are a way to test a Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP). They consist of a group talking through a DRP while sitting around a table, as opposed to actually touching equipment. This is a type of test that should be done before any equipment is touched to ensure the plan appears to be complete.

A vulnerability scan can be performed when the corporation is having a vulnerability assessment performed. A vulnerability scan would reveal systems that are unpatched, have open TCP/UDP ports, and more. This identifies possible vulnerabilities within the network. Vulnerabilities are flaws or weaknesses, such as open ports. Threats are circumstances or events that have the potential of adversely impacting a corporation and its mission, functions, images, reputation, assets, or individuals that affect the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of a system. A penetration test takes a vulnerability assessment further to actually confirm the existence of the weaknesses or flaws.

questions.question: Which of the following describes a method commonly utilized by next-generation antimalware solutions to evaluate suspect executables in a secure, isolated environment?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Sandboxing

Sandboxing is commonly utilized by next-generation antimalware solutions to evaluate suspect executables in a secure, isolated environment. Sandboxed environments are often enabled through virtualization technology, which prevents software executed within the sandboxed environment from interacting with the environment outside of the sandbox, except in controlled ways.

User and Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA) refers to a security capability that utilizes machine learning to establish a baseline of expected user and device activity in order to detect deviations that might indicate a compromise. Static Application Security Testing (SAST) is a method of security testing that analyzes an application's source code for potential vulnerabilities. Fuzzing is an automated application security testing technique that targets application inputs with unexpected, invalid, or random data as a method to identify vulnerabilities or bugs.

questions.question: In qualitative risk assessment, which technique takes anonymous feedback from participants to reach a consensus?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Delphi

The Delphi technique is one of the less common techniques and involves bringing focus groups into a room where they anonymously provide feedback. Each group compiles its feedback on a piece of paper and submits it. The feedback is then presented to the groups and repeated until a consensus has been reached.

A bowtie analysis is a risk assessment methodology that visually represents potential incidents, their causes, preventive barriers, and mitigations, offering a comprehensive view of risk management and control measures in a bowtie-shaped diagram. Bayesian assessment is a statistical method for updating beliefs or probabilities based on new evidence. It applies Bayes' theorem to iteratively refine predictions or hypotheses, incorporating prior knowledge and adjusting as additional information becomes available. In risk assessment interviews, experts engage stakeholders to gather information on potential risks. They explore scenarios, assess vulnerabilities, and discuss controls. These interactive sessions provide qualitative insights, enhance understanding of risk landscapes, and inform comprehensive risk management strategies for organizations across various sectors.

questions.question: Which function of change management is a labeling or numbering system used to differentiate between different software sets and configurations?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Versioning

Versioning refers to version control used in software configuration management. A labeling or numbering system is used to differentiate between different software sets and configurations across multiple machines or at different points in time on a single machine. Versioning also helps with rollback procedures when deployment fails.

The change management process has several steps.

Step 1 - Request the change. The requester submits a request to alter something. This could be a firewall change, a software code change, etc.

Step 2 - Review the change. A committee has been established to evaluate the effect of this change on the business, the business unit(s), the policy, legal compliance, and so on. This is looking at the benefits and the disadvantages of making this change.

Step 3 - Approve or reject the change. Based on the assessment in step two, the request is either accepted or denied.

Step 4 - Test the change. If the request is accepted the requesters can proceed to test this change in a test environment.

Step 5 - Schedule and implement the change. If the change operated as expected in the test environment, it can be scheduled for deployment to the production environment. Then the deployment can proceed as scheduled.

Step 6 - Document the change. Formal documentation needs to be created that documents all that occurred in the steps above.

questions.question: Which one-time password (OTP) algorithm generates a new code upon each login attempt?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: HOTP

One-time passwords (OTPs) are 6-8 digit numbers used as part of a multifactor authentication scheme. They can be generated in two ways:

  • HMAC-Based One-Time Password (HOTP): HOTPs are generated using an incrementing counter. Each authentication attempt using an HOTP causes the authenticator and server to both regenerate it.
  • Time-Based One-Time Password (TOTP): TOTPs are regenerated by the authenticator and the server at regular intervals. With synchronized clocks, this ensures that both devices have the same code at the same time without needing to communicate after initial setup.

NOTP and IOTP are fabricated acronyms.

questions.question: Which of the following solutions is designed to execute malware in an environment where it can do no damage and the organization can learn about its capabilities?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer:

Sandboxing executes potential malware in an isolated environment that includes monitoring capabilities. This helps to identify potential malware before it is delivered to its intended destination. Sandboxing is also used in mobile devices to isolate apps from one another.

An intrusion detection system (IDS) identifies signs of a potential attack — such as a Denial of Service (DoS) attack — and alerts security personnel. An intrusion prevention system (IPS) goes a step further and blocks the attempted attack.

A honeypot is a computer designed to look like a tempting target to lure attackers into attacking it instead of real corporate systems. This both wastes the attacker’s time and enables the organization to observe their tools and techniques. A honeynet is a network of honeypots.

Anti-malware is software installed on an endpoint that can identify, block, and potentially eradicate an infection on that system.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes a system’s minimum level of acceptable security?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Baseline

A baseline is the minimum level of acceptable security applied to a system. Baselines are used to standardize security levels across multiple systems. An example of a baseline is a Microsoft GPO that enables the host-based firewall on all systems.

Standards document, in detail, the security requirements for a subset of technology. Standards are generally referenced by and enforced in a separate security policy. Policies are high-level documents that align security objectives with business objectives. Guidelines are recommended actions or behaviors if a standard does not apply.

questions.question: Of the following, which is LEAST LIKELY to be considered an asset?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Security standard

A security standard is not a direct asset of an organization but is used to help protect assets.

An asset is anything of worth to an organization. Information, personnel, equipment, buildings, people, databases, spreadsheets, data lakes, servers, computers, cameras, etc. all have worth to an organization.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of eXtensible Markup Language (XML) code?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: <Highscore>198000092</Highscore>

eXtensible markup language (XML) was designed to store and transport data and be both human and machine-readable. It uses a simple text-based format for representing structured information such as documents, data, configuration, books, transactions, invoices, and much more. It was derived from an older standard format called SGML (International Standards Organization (ISO) 8879) and was modified to be more suitable for web use.

Highscore="198000092" would be a Windows batch command format.

SET @Highscore = '198000092'; is consistent with batch command format.

Set-Variable -Name "Highscore " -Value "198000092" is consistent with PowerShell.

questions.question: An organization is experiencing a major increase in connection attempts from unknown or malicious Internet Protocol (IP) addresses.
