As a result, their router is experiencing a heavier workload than ever before. Which of the following would be LEAST LIKELY to assist with this workload issue?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: Upgrading the router with one that is more powerful
Editing firewall rules to cater toward dropping the traffic faster

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Replacing the router

Replacing the router would not impact connection attempts from Internet Protocol (IP) addresses and would not necessarily reduce the workload of one device.

Upgrading the router would speed up processing and ease the workload for a single device while editing firewall rules could potentially allow traffic to be dealt with in a faster manner. Implementing redundancy or even editing firewalls to allocate certain traffic to another system could ease the burden of this workload and is typical practice when combating a distributed denial of service attack, for example.

questions.question: Which statement about a Business Continuity Plan (BCP) is INCORRECT?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management

choices.text: Business Continuity Plan (BCP) development does not require senior management buy-in.
A Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP) and a Business Continuity Plan (BCP) work together to ensure business operations remain possible.
Conducting a Business Impact Analysis (BIA) is critical in the development of a Business Continuity Plan (BCP).
A Business Continuity Plan (BCP) should be frequently reviewed, tested, and updated.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Business Continuity Plan (BCP) development does not require senior management buy-in.

When an organization develops a Business Continuity Plan (BCP), senior management must buy into the process. Responsibility for the BCP development should belong to a senior manager, preferably someone who is also on the board of directors. The organization has a duty to its stakeholders to ensure adequate BCP measures have been taken.

It is true that Disaster Recovery Plans (DRPs) and BCPs work together. ISO 22301, which is based on the BS 25999, holds that BCPs and DRPs, among many other plans, fall under the umbrella of Business Continuity Management (BCM). DRPs are most commonly associated with the hardware, software, and facilities that comprise the data center. BCPs are focused on critical business functions and ensuring that they continue to operate through major disruptions. It is a critical step to conduct a BIA for both business continuity and disaster recovery planning. BCPs, DRPs, and other plans such as the Incident Response Plan (IRP) should be frequently reviewed, tested, and updated.

questions.question: The CISO of an organization must determine which cloud provider to use for backing up all data associated with the respective business. With many things to consider, which of the following is LEAST likely to influence this decision?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Graphical user interface and accessibility

Graphical user interface and accessibility would be of least concern since the most important aspect of this decision is determining how to ensure the preservation of reliable data. There is likely documentation to assist data custodians with transferring data and navigating a graphical user interface, while the company holding the backups likely has customer service representatives to assist as well.

Location is an important issue for backup data, as preserving it near an area with frequent natural disasters could be troublesome. Cost would be of consideration, as it would impact net income. Company reputation would reduce or increase risk with the company being backed up depending on what that reputation was. An organization may seek to incur greater costs to avoid the risk of associating with a company that has a poor reputation.

questions.question: What is the main disadvantage of Single Sign-On (SSO)?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)

choices.text: Once an account is breached, the attacker has access to all systems and resources
It requires lots of time to implement
Kerberos is vulnerable to pass the hash attacks
Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is vulnerable to replay attacks

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Once an account is breached, the attacker has access to all systems and resources

Since a Single Sign-On (SSO) only requires one sign-on, if an account is breached, the attacker does not need to authenticate again to access any system or resource.

If SSO takes a lot of time to implement it is annoying and time-consuming, but that would be outweighed by the benefits gained from the SSO. Kerberos is vulnerable to pass the hash attacks, and Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is vulnerable to replay attacks. Just about all systems will have an attack against it. Patches or other tools can be used to protect the systems. The benefits that come from SSO are likely greater for a business than these problems. It is possible to have a more secure manner for users to log in rather than many systems with weaker or equal passwords and so on.

questions.question: An organization wants to ensure any data being stored, erased, or migrated is done in the most secure fashion. What technique would ensure data could not be accessed by unauthorized parties in any of these circumstances?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: Configuring a CASB prior to cloud migration

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Strong encryption

While each answer option may provide security in transit, rest, or even at the end of the life cycle, strong encryption is the only method that would protect data at all stages. Data encryption is done using Transport Layer Security (TLS), Secure Shell (SSH), or Internet Protocol Security (IPSec) while in transit. It can be encrypted with AES 256 at rest and can be "erased" using a method called "cryptographic erasure," in which encrypted data has all keys associated with it destroyed. This leaves the data inaccessible by any key or by modern decryption when a strong enough encryption algorithm is used.

Transport Layer Security (TLS) would only protect data in transit. A Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) manages cloud security at the edge of a network. If done properly, destruction only protects data at the end of its life cycle. The question involves data being stored and migrated, which is not the end of the lifecycle.

questions.question: What is the recommended height of a security fence?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 8 feet/2-3 meters

A fence is a physical environmental security measure since it provides security from outside threats. Eight feet (with barbed wire) is considered the preferred height for a security fence to keep most intruders out.

The standard fencing height recommendations are:

  • 3-4 feet/1-1.5 meters deter casual trespassers
  • 6-7 feet/1.8- 2.1 meters deter most intruders, but not determined ones
  • 8 or more feet/2.4 meters or more deter determined intruders

questions.question: Yusuf is a security engineer for a manufacturing organization. He is concerned about the security of the Industrial Control System (ICS). In the past, employees have plugged their personal devices into the network and accidentally introduced malware. Of the following, which control will MOST LIKELY prevent this from happening?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: 802.1X Extensible Authentication Protocol- Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP-PEAP)
Monitoring and alerting on entries in the router's Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) cache
Setting a maximum of one Media Access Control (MAC) address for each switch interface

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 802.1X Extensible Authentication Protocol- Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP-PEAP)

802.1X Extensible Authentication Protocol- Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP-PEAP) allows the administrator to require endpoints to authenticate before network access is granted. EAP-PEAP can require each device to present a trusted certificate or require valid credentials.

EAP-MD5 transmits an MD5 hashed password. Administrators cannot require a device to have a trusted certificate when using MD5. If a person knew the password, they could still access the network. EAP-MD5 should only be used when all other EAP options have been exhausted. Monitoring systems is always a good thing to do. Alerting on changes in the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) cache would not prevent users from connecting their personal devices and it could be difficult to detect personal device connections. Having only one Media Access Control (MAC) per switch interface would not prevent users from connecting their personal devices. A device usually has one MAC address for the Network Interface Card (NIC) that is connected to a switch port with a wire (CAT 4, 5, 6, etc.). So it is more of a description of how something usually works.

questions.question: In testing the Disaster Recovery Plan (DRP), which of the following involves performing all the steps of a real recovery, except that you keep the real, live production systems running in the original location during the test?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Parallel test

A parallel test involves performing all steps of a real recovery, except that you keep the live production systems running in the original location during the test. The actual production systems run in parallel with the disaster recovery systems.

In a simulation, the systems are not brought to a functional level at the alternate site. The plan is analyzed possibly in and out of the conference room. A simulation could involve stepping through some of the procedural documents to see if the instructions match what is visible in a system, without taking any actual action. A structured walk-through test occurs in the conference room where team members talk through a scenario using their plan. The completeness of the plan is assessed before they leave the conference room and attempt any actions on any systems. A checklist test is a review of the document to see if everything that the team knows they documented made it into the plan. It is also possible to use lists of often forgotten items or the like to assess what they have in their plan.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST represents a social engineering attack?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: Claiming to be a repairman to gain access to a secure system
Attempting to spoof a system Internet Protocol (IP) address
Performing a brute force attack on a system
Following an employee through a door that requires badge identification

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Claiming to be a repairman to gain access to a secure system

Social engineering involves tricking a person into divulging information or granting the attacker access to a system. This includes stealing credentials or tricking someone into granting them building access.

Attempting to spoof an Internet Protocol (IP) address would be referred to as just spoofing. Performing a brute force attack is also just referred to as a brute force attack. Following an employee through a door would be referred to as coat-tailing or piggy-backing. It is arguable that there is an element of social engineering in this attack, but it is just a piece of it, where claiming to be a repairman is social engineering.

questions.question: What type of cipher rearranges existing characters to create ciphertext?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Transposition cipher

Transposition ciphers rearrange existing characters to create ciphertext. When a message needs to be decrypted, the algorithm puts the arrangement back in the correct order to reveal the message. For example, taking the word ‘the’ and rearranging the letters to ‘het.’ All of the original plaintext values are still there, they are just in a different order.

Substitution ciphers replace each value of the plaintext with a different value, unrealized to the other content of the plaintext. For example, taking the letter A out of the plaintext and swapping a ‘D’ back in its place. A one-time pad is a type of substitution cipher seen primarily in the early 20th century. A running key cipher is also a substitution cipher. The key needs to be as long as the plaintext, often it was a book, think War and Peace. Then the plaintext is combined with the key (the book War and Peace) and there is a new value which is the ciphertext.

questions.question: What type of management system provides a secure location for users to keep their usernames and passwords?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Credential management system

Credential management systems provide a secure location where users can store their usernames and passwords for resources such as websites, network files, and software.

Database management systems read data dictionaries and determine access rights for users. Federated Identity Management (FIM) systems are used when there are multiple unrelated networks within multiple groups that share resources. Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is a single sign-on technology that can be used in federated environments.

questions.question: Which of the following authentication protocols protects the transmission of credentials by hashing the credentials and using a challenge-response that is resistant to replay attacks?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP)

CHAP is one of the authentication protocols used over Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) links. CHAP hashes usernames and passwords to prevent them from being transmitted in clear text. It performs authentication using a challenge-response that is resistant to replay attacks.

Password Authentication Protocol (PAP) is incorrect because it sends credentials in clear text. Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) is incorrect because it’s a framework and not a standalone authentication mechanism. EAP is used to negotiate the best authentication method that both a client and server agree on. Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP) is similar to EAP but is encapsulated in a Transport Layer Security (TLS) session using a server-side certificate.

questions.question: A log that provides a play-by-play record of actions within the end stations and/or network devices is known as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Audit trail

The audit trail allows an administrator to review events and users linked to those events. It can be used to review employee misconduct or provide a log of events leading to system failure. An audit trail is required for some security standards, including the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).

A third-party audit is an independent examination conducted by an external entity to assess and validate compliance or performance. Chain of custody is a documented record of the chronological history of the handling, transfer, and location of physical or electronic evidence in legal or investigative processes. Change management is a structured approach to transitioning individuals, teams, and organizations from current states to desired future states, minimizing resistance, and fostering successful adaptation to change.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST defines a teardrop attack?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: Sending fragmented IP packets with oversized payloads
Spoofing the source IP address with the victim's address and flooding the broadcast address with ICMP requests
Tricking someone into divulging information after being told something terrible has happened to a family member

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Sending fragmented IP packets with oversized payloads

A teardrop attack exploits a vulnerability in a victim's Internet Protocol (IP) fragmentation reassembly code. It works by sending fragmented IP packets with oversized payloads. When the victim tries to reassemble the packet, it causes it to crash. A teardrop attack is a Denial of Service (DOS) attack.

Spoofing the source IP address with the victim's address and flooding the broadcast address with an Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP)request is known as a Smurf attack. If there is a higher likelihood of hash collisions, the hash algorithm is susceptible to a birthday attack. Tricking someone into divulging information under any condition is a social engineering attack.

questions.question: Of the following, what BEST describes misuse case testing?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing

choices.text: Attempting to identify potential security flaws in a software’s design
Attempting to exploit vulnerabilities and writing a report to senior management
An exercise where individuals simulate recovery from a disaster
When security personnel verify employees of an organization and do not compromise security when presented with an opportunity to do so

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Attempting to identify potential security flaws in a software’s design

Misuse case testing is used to help identify potential security flaws in a software’s design by examining how software could be abused or manipulated into doing something malicious. Essentially, the tester behaves as a bad user of the software to see what they can make it do that was not intended.

Attempting to exploit vulnerabilities, if they have permission, describes a penetration test. Recovering from a disaster is a Disaster Recovery Plan test, which could be a simulation, parallel, or full interruption test. Not compromising security when presented with an opportunity sounds like a vulnerability assessment, except that the security person is verifying employees, which is not normally a part of a vulnerability assessment.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid database model?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Attribute-value

Attribute-value is not a valid database model.

The three most common types of databases today are relational databases, hierarchical databases, and object-oriented databases. The relational model, introduced by Edgar F. Codd, is the most popular general database model. Data in a hierarchical database is arranged in a tree structure, and relational databases have relationships between data sets that are organized in tables. Object-oriented was the next up-and-coming model. It looked like it was going to get adopted, but big data was introduced and took over.

questions.question: A proprietary formula used by an organization would BEST be categorized as what type of risk component?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Asset

An asset is anything that is valued by an organization, such as a proprietary formula. Protecting an organization's assets against threats is the primary goal of risk management.

Threat is incorrect because it is what an organization protects its assets from. A threat is the harm that can come to the asset. A vulnerability is a weakness or flaw. The proprietary formula is one of the things that distinguishes this company. It is almost the opposite of a vulnerability. Controls is incorrect because it is what protects the asset from the threat. Controls can be safeguards or countermeasures, which include things like encryption, Identity and Access Management (IAM), firewalls, and so on.

questions.question: Which of the following is an appropriate method of evaluating application security when access to the underlying source code is not available?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST)

When access to the underlying source code is not available, Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) is an appropriate method of evaluating application security. DAST testing evaluates application security through the use of scanning, enumeration, and synthetic transaction activities performed against the application's runtime services.

Static Application Security Testing (SAST) and code reviews are common methods to evaluate application security, but they both require access to the underlying source code. A Web Application Firewall (WAF) is not a method of evaluating application security but often acts as a compensating control to prevent certain application vulnerabilities from being exploited.

questions.question: In an e-commerce database, sensitive credit card numbers are each mapped to and replaced with a unique random number which serves as an identifier. When a transaction is processed, that identifier is used to temporarily recover the sensitive credit number it was mapped to, but only for the duration needed to complete the transaction. Which of the following data protection methods is being utilized in this scenario?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Tokenization

Tokenization is being utilized in the described scenario. Tokenization refers to the technique of mapping sensitive data elements to, and replacing them with, an identifying token that is not itself sensitive if revealed. Only the tokenization solution (or applications authorized by it) can recover the underlying data element from the identifying token. In the described scenario, because sensitive credit card numbers in the e-commerce database were replaced with random numbers to serve as identifying tokens, if that database were hacked, only the random number tokens (not the sensitive credit card numbers) would be compromised.

Anonymization refers to the technique of removing the fields in a data set that associates that data with a particular person (i.e. personally identifiable information fields) so that the balance of data in that set can be analyzed and shared without any risk to the privacy of those from whom the data was collected. Unlike tokenized data fields, anonymized data fields cannot be recovered. Encryption is a method to provide data confidentiality (customarily through the use of an algorithm and key, which encode plaintext into ciphertext and decode ciphertext back into plaintext). Hashing is a technique used in cryptography in which an algorithm is applied to the content of a message or file to produce a unique, fixed-length output (message digest) derived from that content.

questions.question: Which programming language uses only 0s and 1s?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Machine language

Computers only understand binary, also called machine language, which consists only of 0s and 1s.

Compiled language is incorrect because this language uses a compiler to convert code into an executable file. Interpreted language is incorrect because this language uses source code and distributes the code without compiling it into a file. Object-oriented language is incorrect because it also uses source code and not 0s and 1s.

questions.question: What physical lock uses a keypad?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Cipher lock

A cipher lock is characterized by a keypad, requiring a specific numerical sequence on the keypad to unlock an entrance. Keypads are used in data centers or even within restricted areas to add an extra level of security.

A tumbler lock is a common type of lock mechanism found in many doors and padlocks. It consists of a series of spring-loaded pins (tumblers) that align when the correct key is inserted, allowing the lock to turn and open. Incorrect keys won't align the tumblers, preventing the lock from turning. Tumbler locks offer basic security but are vulnerable to lock-picking techniques.

A mortise lock is a type of door lock that is set within a rectangular cavity, or mortise, in the door. It typically consists of a lock body with a latch, a strike plate, and a cylinder or keyhole. Mortise locks are known for their durability and security, making them common in commercial and residential applications. They are often considered more secure than standard cylindrical locks due to their robust construction and the fact that they are more challenging to pick or force open.

A biometric lock is a security device that uses unique physical or behavioral characteristics, such as fingerprints, retinal patterns, or voice recognition, to authenticate and grant access. It's a modern, highly secure alternative to traditional key or card-based locking systems, enhancing both convenience and protection.

questions.question: Sam’s organization uses signature-based detection to detect and prevent malware. He notices that a malicious piece of code has exploited an unknown vulnerability. He contacts the vendor and they inform him they will create a patch and release it soon. Of the following, what would this MOST LIKELY be considered?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Zero-day

A zero-day is a vulnerability that has not been patched by the vendor. Zero-day attacks are difficult to detect and prevent because the vulnerability is unknown, and signature-based detection engines often cannot detect malware that exploits zero-day vulnerabilities.

Worms are self-replicating, malicious software that spreads independently across computer networks, exploiting vulnerabilities to infect and replicate. Unlike viruses, worms do not require a host program to propagate. Polymorphic viruses are a type of malware that continually changes its code to evade detection by security software. This dynamic behavior allows it to mutate its appearance while maintaining its malicious functionality, making detection challenging. Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) are sophisticated and targeted cyber attacks characterized by a prolonged and stealthy intrusion into a network. APT actors, often state-sponsored or well-funded, employ advanced techniques to gain unauthorized access, maintain persistence, and exfiltrate sensitive data over an extended period.

questions.question: Stealthy Security Suites & Beats is looking to find Software as a Service (SaaS) to use for cloud storage. Which of the following would be LEAST LIKELY to provide this service?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: AWS Lambda

AWS Lambda is an Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud service. It is defined as a Function as a Service (FaaS) that functions with many other services on the AWS cloud service. While it is not necessary to know the services provided by providers such as AWS or Azure, this is a helpful way to understand these concepts.

Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and Dropbox are all cloud services. Each can offer a way to manage virtual machines or other virtual computing platforms for cloud storage. All three are generally defined as Software as a Service (Saas) but may offer internal services that serve as a Platform as a Service (PaaS), Function as a Service (FaaS), or any other service.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of half-duplex communication?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Walkie-talkie

A walkie-talkie (often used in law enforcement radio) can both send and receive communications, but communication can only transfer in one direction at a time. In other words, when communication comes from one walkie-talkie, it must end before the next communication can take place from the other walkie-talkie.

A car radio is incorrect because it is an example of simplex mode communication. A cellular phone is incorrect because it is an example of full-duplex mode communication. Email is incorrect because it would most closely resemble full-duplex mode communication.

questions.question: Malware is a term used to describe which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Malicious software

Malware is any software that has malicious intent. It may offer something productive for a user to help hide the malicious side of the software. Malware is classed into several categories. Phishing, viruses, worms, keyloggers, spyware, adware, rootkits, and ransomware are all examples of malware.

The other three terms are simply descriptions of software in different states. There is plenty of poorly designed software out there. When it is poorly designed it will likely malfunction. State-sponsored software could be something that a government has created. Perhaps something that is created to make it easier for people to file their taxes.

questions.question: Alain, the system administrator, has been setting up the identity and access management systems within his corporation. He works for a healthcare company that must protect sensitive patient data that the users have access to, at times. The method of controlling access that is preferred by management is one that groups users together since they have over 30,000 employees. The permissions are then assigned to the group. Which type of access control is being used at this company?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)

Access control is used to identify an individual who does a specific job, authenticate them, and then proceed to give that individual only the key to the door or workstation that they need access to and nothing more. Access control systems come in many variations and can include Discretionary Access Control (DAC), Mandatory Access Control (MAC), Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), and Attribute Based Access Control (ABAC).

DAC is a type of access control system that holds the business owner responsible for deciding which people are allowed in a specific location, physically or digitally. DAC is the least restrictive compared to the other systems, as it essentially allows an individual complete control over any objects they own, as well as the programs associated with those objects. A drawback is that it gives the end-user complete control in setting security level settings for other users and the permissions given to the end-user are inherited into other programs they use, which could potentially lead to malware being executed without the end-user being aware of it. MAC is commonly utilized in organizations that require an elevated emphasis on the confidentiality and classification of data (i.e. military). MAC doesn’t permit owners to have a say in the entities having access to a unit or facility. Instead, only the owner and custodian have management of the access controls. MAC will typically classify all end-users and provide them with labels that permit them to gain access through security with established security guidelines. Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) is an advanced access control model that focuses on granting or denying access to resources based on attributes associated with users, resources, and the environment. ABAC allows for fine-grained access control, where access decisions are based on a combination of attributes rather than simple roles or permissions. In ABAC, access control decisions are made using policies that define rules based on attributes. Attributes can include user attributes (e.g. role, department, clearance level), resource attributes (e.g. sensitivity level, type), and environmental attributes (e.g. time of day, location).

questions.question: Originally, voice networks were considered to be which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Circuit-switched

Voice networks were originally circuit-switched. This meant that when a call was placed from a phone on the traditional network (that can be found in homes that have had a phone number for a very long time) a connection was built and established across the network. Once the path of that connection was established, the telephone call would use that path until the phone call ended. This process happens every time a phone call is established on that type of network.

Packet-switched networks include X.25, Frame Relay, Aysnchronous Transport Mode (ATM), and Multi-Protocol Label System (MPLS), for example. When data is sent across these networks, each packet takes its own path. This is also how ethernet networks operate. Data packets can, therefore, arrive out of order. If the packets (frames or cells) are numbered, they can be placed back in the correct order before delivery to the user. Some protocols will even request a retransmission for any missing packets (frames or cells).

Network-switched is not a term found in networking.

Permanent virtual circuits is a term that describes a connection that is built across voice networks and remains in place, permanently. An example of this was the 'red phone' found on the United States president's desk during the Cold War. It was a connection to the Kremlin to ensure the president had quick access to speak with them.

questions.question: When discussing Wi-Fi networks, how many channels are available for use in the United States on the 2.4 GHz spectrum?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 11

The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has allocated 11 channels that may be used on the 2.4 GHz spectrum. Channels overlap and, if used incorrectly, can create interference. It is recommended to only use channels 1, 6, and 11.

questions.question: Risk mitigation decisions are made once an organization has performed a risk assessment. Which of the following is NOT a standard risk decision?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Risk tolerance

Risk tolerance is usually defined as the level of risk that a business can survive. For example, Research In Motion (RIM) had the Blackberry product many years ago. There was a weekend where no emails were delivered to anyone with a Blackberry over a period of approximately four days. They sold the Blackberry product off within four and a half years. That was a greater loss than the business could tolerate. Such loss like this will likely cause a business to immediately fold, or go out of business within five years.

There are four risk mitigation options: risk reduction (or sometimes stated as mitigation), risk avoidance, risk transfer (or share), and risk acceptance. Risk reduction is used if an organization decides to lower the risk using controls. Risk transfer is used if an organization decides to transfer the risk to another entity; this is commonly used with insurance. Risk acceptance is used if an organization chooses not to lower the risk and accept it as is. The other option is risk avoidance. To avoid is to not enter into or to stop specific behavior.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the use of magnetic fields to destroy file structures?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Degaussing

Degaussing happens when a magnetic field is created that realigns the magnetic fields on media. It's one way to remove data remanence on media such as a hard drive or tape drive. This is only effective on magnetic media, so it can't be used on media such as Digital Video Discs (DVDs), Compact Discs (CDs), or Solid State Drives (SSDs).

Merriam-Webster defines polarizing as “causing electromagnetic radiation and especially light waves to vibrate in a definite pattern.” The key to the definition is light as it would not alter the magnetic state of a drive. Magnetic entanglement does not exist, but there is quantum entanglement. Again, it deals with particles of light, not the magnetic state of a drive. Electrical discharging is the release of electrical energy through a medium such as gas. This could cause problems with a magnetic drive if the electricity is discharged into it, but it is not a normal way to destroy file structures on magnetic media.

questions.question: Of the following, which chart BEST shows the interrelationships between projects and schedules?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Gantt

A Gantt chart is a type of bar chart which best shows the interrelationships between projects and tasks over time. It provides a graphical illustration of a schedule that helps plan, coordinate, and track specific tasks in a project.

A Venn diagram shows the relationships between two or more sets — there is no schedule in a Venn diagram. So the critical word in the question is "schedules".

A histogram shows the frequency distribution in a graph form of a few data points of a single variable.

A Program Evaluation Review Technique (PERT) chart is similar to a critical path chart. PERT was created for the military and a critical path for the civilian world. The PERT chart shows three-time estimates. One for the shortest possible amount of time, the second for a probable amount of time, and the third for the longest amount of time tasks may take.

questions.question: The science of studying the methods of secure communications is known as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Cryptology

Cryptology is the science of secure communications and is the study of both cryptography and cryptanalysis.

Cryptography is the study of encryption and decryption techniques to protect the transmission and storage of data, voice, and video. Cryptanalysis is the study of methods to break encryption technologies. This can be referred to as ethical hacking, as it is necessary for the good guys to test the security level of the encryption algorithms that corporations are using to protect their data, voice, and video. Hacking is a term that has gone through several evolutions of use. Originally it meant that a software developer was very good at their job and they could take someone else’s code and make it do even more. Then it evolved to mean bad people who are trying to find holes in the software to be able to get the software to do more than it was supposed to for evil purposes.

questions.question: Of the following, who is MOST LIKELY responsible for ensuring due care and due diligence for a given data set?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data owner

The data owner is generally responsible for the protection of data. This includes due care responsibilities, and they will ultimately be held accountable for negligible activity leading to the disclosure of data. The Data Owner is responsible for a piece or set of data, which could be a file or a database.

Due care is best defined by the Blacks Law Dictionary as just proper and sufficient care to not be negligent. Due care helps shield an organization or individual from liability should a breach happen. If an organization or individual can prove they practiced due care, they are less likely to be found liable for the incident. Due diligence is defined as just and proper care that a reasonable and prudent person would take in similar situations.

The security manager, depending on the level of management, could be responsible for creating the policies that define the actions and care that must be exercised to protect data, but a data owner is a more likely answer. This level of management would include the classification policy that the data owner would use to indicate how sensitive their piece or set of data is. An administrator, depending on the type, could be the one who configures the security controls around the data, as indicated by the data owner. A data analyst would be someone who analyzes the data so that a business can make the decisions that it needs to.

questions.question: An organization wants to use secure software, specifically by using only closed-source products. Which of the following would the organization be LEAST LIKELY to pick?
questions.subject: Domain 8: Software Development Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Android

Android is an open-source operating system. It began in 2005 as an open-source project, was bought out two years later by Google, and has remained that way since. The organization may want to stay away from using Android as an operating system on any device if they have reason to believe vulnerabilities could become public knowledge much faster, for example.

Apple, Winrar, and Microsoft Windows are all closed-source programs. While Apple and Microsoft Windows are well-known operating systems, Winrar is a closed-source program designed to compress and extract files.

questions.question: Of the following, what data state is considered at rest?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Asset Security

choices.text: Data in a Central Processing Unit (CPU) register

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Data written to a disk

Data written to a disk is considered to be at rest. Data at rest is not actively used.

Data in Random Access Memory (RAM) is in use. Data traversing the network is considered to be in motion. Data in a Central Processing Unit (CPU) register is in use.

questions.question: What is the MOST effective control for preventing tailgating?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Turnstiles

Turnstiles allow only one person to enter at a time. As one person swipes a badge and enters the data center, the turnstile restricts the following person. It's a method of preventing tailgating, which happens when an unauthorized person follows an authorized person through an entrance.

Security cameras are a detective control. They would help understand who has been accessing the business, but they would not stop, slow, or prevent unauthorized access.

Identification badges by themselves are not preventive. If there is a locked door that is opened with the possession of an identification badge, that would help. However, the question is about tailgating which is when someone walks in behind an authorized person. So, it is still a weaker control than turnstiles.

When guards are very diligent, and they are combined with badges, and doors that open only with the badge, they could help with tailgating. However, the answer only says guards. Guards by themselves should rarely be considered preventive as humans are distractable. So, a turnstile is a better control.

questions.question: Change management involves proper documentation and signatures before the deployment of an update. Which of the following updates requires change management approval before deployment?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Server reconfiguration

Server configurations can have a critical effect on an organization. Change management requires documentation and proper signatures to authorize the change to ensure that testing and deployment procedures are followed. The process reduces risk to the organization.

Updating antivirus, spyware, and public utility monitoring services does not require change management. These should just be regular procedures within Information Technology (IT).

questions.question: Of the following, which protocol BEST provides confidentiality for email?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Secure Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions

Secure Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) are used to encrypt and digitally sign emails. S/MIME uses the RSA encryption algorithm and has been incorporated into many commercial products, such as Microsoft Outlook, Mozilla Thunderbird, and MAC OS X Mail. S/MIME relies on the use of the X.509 certificates for exchanging cryptographic keys.

The Post Office Protocol (POP) 3 is a basic protocol that enables a user to access their emails. It works by downloading the messages off of the server onto the local device. That provides little security because the email is not on the central email server. However, the emails are sent in the clear and are not encrypted. There is no confidentiality. Anyone listening will see the text of your email.

Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is a protocol that enables the sending of emails. It transmits from the email client to the server. However, the emails are sent in the clear, just as they are with POP3.

Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) changes the older logic of POP and SMTP by leaving the emails on the server. This is what allows the same emails to show on a mobile phone, a desktop computer, and a tablet all at the same time. It too sends emails in the clear. It is possible to use Transport Layer Security (TLS) (formerly SSL) to encrypt the sent and received. Technically, that is IMAPS and the question only has IMAP as a possible answer.

questions.question: In which of the following security components is cryptography LEAST LIKELY to be utilized?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Security Architecture and Engineering
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Availability

The third principle of the Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (CIA) triad is availability. The focus of availability is to ensure reliability and access to system resources or data. Of the available options, cryptography is least likely to be used to provide the availability of a system. If the cryptography key is lost or corrupted, the data will be inaccessible.

Cryptography is used in confidentiality in the form of encryption, for integrity in the form of hashing, and for authentication in the form of asymmetric digital signatures and hashing.

questions.question: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is typically run on which TCP port?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Security Assessment and Testing
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: 25

Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP), by default, uses port 25 to send email communications. SMTP allows email servers to exchange mail in transit and is generally not used by clients.

Port 23 indicates the telnet protocol is being used. Telnet is a remote connection protocol that should not be used since it is completely in the clear to include the user's name and password. Port 110 indicates the Post Office Protocol (POP) 3 protocol is being carried out. POP3 is another email transfer protocol. Port 123 indicates Network Time Protocol (NTP) is being carried out. NTP is one of the oldest protocols still in use everywhere. It is used to carry the time that the network is synchronized to. Typically today, the source of that time is the atomic clock.

questions.question: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) and User Datagram Protocol (UDP) are the backbone protocols for most communication, and they operate on which of the following Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model layers?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Transport (Layer 4)

Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) operates at Layer 4 (the transport layer) of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model. It supports full-duplex communications, is connection-oriented, and employs reliable sessions. TCP is connection-oriented because it employs a handshake process between two systems to establish a communication session. User Datagram Protocol (UDP) does not employ a handshake but still operates at Layer 4 of the OSI model.

The physical layer contains wire, fiber, wireless, Binary digITs (BIT), and so on. The data link layer contains Ethernet, token ring, Point to Point Protocol (PPP), and so on. The application layer contains protocols such as HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol), SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol), and File Transfer Protocol (FTP).

questions.question: When discussing Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) or Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP), what BEST describes the role of the nonce?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

choices.text: Removes the need to transmit the password in clear text

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Adds replay resistance

A nonce (Number used Once) is a random number or value generated by the authentication server. When a client requests to authenticate, the server will reply with the nonce; this is often called the challenge. The client will combine the nonce with a predefined password and use a hashing algorithm to generate a response. The server will use the same nonce and predefined password to create a hash. If the hash generated by the client and server match, the server will authenticate the client. Each nonce can only be used once and helps prevent replay attacks.

The password should never be transmitted in clear text. The nonce makes the hash more effective which, by definition, removes the clear text password from the transmission. Random numbers such as nonces do help protect against rainbow table attacks. However, when discussing that random number, it is actually called a salt. It functions in much the same way as the nonce within Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) though. Hash collisions will occur. The way to prevent them is twofold, have a strong hashing algorithm with a larger message digest field, e.g. 512 bits long.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is NOT true regarding procedures and guidelines?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Security and Risk Management

choices.text: Procedures and guidelines both provide detailed specific instructions.
Procedures and guidelines both outline actions a user is expected to take.
Procedures and guidelines work together to improve security.
Procedures and guidelines are both essential to a capable security system.

questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Procedures and guidelines both provide detailed specific instructions.

Procedures and guidelines both provide direction for a user, but procedures detail a step-by-step process to accomplish the desired results, whereas guidelines cover broad general areas or recommendations.

Procedures and guidelines both work with standards and baselines to fulfill corporate policies. Guidelines are optional suggestions for employees. So, the user is not expected to follow guidelines, although they can if they wish to. Guidelines can be used to answer Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) with information that assists users in complying with the policies, procedures, standards, or baselines.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an objective of business continuity management?
questions.subject: Domain 7: Security Operations
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Improve overall business efficiency

Improving overall business efficiency is not an objective of business continuity management. Business efficiency should be an operational component, not disaster-related.

Business continuity management purposes include achieving and maintaining enterprise infrastructure, managing infrastructure reliability, and minimizing downtime.

questions.question: Of the following, which is NOT a valid access control model?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Identity and Access Management (IAM)
questions.explanation:
Correct answer: Rotational Access Control model

"Rotational" is not an access control model.

Discretionary Access Control (DAC) is a type of access control system found in many computing environments where access rights are assigned based on the discretion, or decision, of the owner of the information or resource. In a DAC model, the owner of a resource (such as a file, directory, or data object) has the authority to decide which other users or groups can have access to that resource and the extent of their permissions (e.g. read, write, execute, delete).

Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) is an advanced and flexible access control model that determines access rights based on attributes. In ABAC, access decisions are made by evaluating policies against the attributes of users, resources, and the environment within which access is being requested. Attributes can be characteristics of the user (such as role, department, or clearance level), characteristics of the resource (such as classification, owner, or sensitivity level), or contextual information (such as time of day, location, or the state of a system).

In Mandatory Access Control (MAC), each user and resource is assigned a classification label based on security levels, such as "Top Secret," "Secret," "Confidential," and "Unclassified." These labels represent the sensitivity or importance of the information. Access decisions are then made based on predefined rules that specify which security levels can access resources of a given classification. The rules are typically based on a hierarchical or lattice-based model, where higher-level users can access lower-level resources but not vice versa.
